Job Description:
Job no: 494177
Work type: Full Time Permanent
Location: Victoria
Categories: IT
About Seymour Whyte:
For over 30 years, Seymour Whyte has been a leading civil contracting business in Australia. We combine the agility and personal connection of a Tier 2 contractor with the expertise of a Tier 1 company. Now, with the enhanced resources of VINCI, one of the largest and most prestigious construction companies in the world, we offer our employees and clients the best of three worlds.
Employee Benefits:
Join a workplace that truly values and supports its employees. We offer flexible health and wellbeing programs to ensure you stay at your best, along with competitive pay that reflects your worth. Our unique bonus scheme rewards your hard work, and through our partnership with VINCI, you can grow your investment with our generous employee share program. We believe in a healthy work-life balance, offering a purchased leave program and paid parental leave. Additionally, enjoy peace of mind with salary continuance insurance, be part of an inclusive culture, and celebrate your birthday with a paid day off.
About the role:
Lead GIS delivery on a major civil infrastructure project through the Design, Construction, and Handover phases. Collaborate with Digital Engineering specialists to prepare and refine spatial data for the Civillo platform, ensuring accuracy and structure. Reporting to the Digital Engineering Manager and supported by national and regional leads, you'll drive project success and contribute to the GIS team's broader vision.
Support the development and maintenance of GIS-based solutions for infrastructure projects, ensuring data accuracy and alignment with project needs.
Create maps and GIS outputs that meet the regulatory standards and norms, including compliance with metadata and cartographic requirements.
Use Civillo for project data management, ensuring that the integration of GIS data is smooth and effective.
Work with various GIS tools, including QGIS and ArcGIS Pro, to analyse and refine spatial data.
Actively engage with the GIS team to share insights, contribute ideas, and explore opportunities for innovation.
The successful applicant will have the following skills and experience:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in GIS, Geography, Urban Planning, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in GIS, with strong skills across various GIS tools, including QGIS, ArcGIS Pro, and similar.
Experience managing large and complex spatial datasets, particularly in infrastructure and urban planning contexts.
Proven ability to produce maps and GIS outputs that comply with Victoria's regulatory standards, including metadata and cartographic requirements.
Ability to communicate technical information clearly to a diverse range of stakeholders, including those less familiar with GIS concepts.
Seymour Whyte is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds, including veterans. Our commitment to an equitable construction industry extends to an inclusive culture that embraces our differences and gives everyone the opportunity to grow and be equally valued. We're unified in our direction to having a workplace that is balanced and fair for all.
There has never been a more exciting time to join Seymour Whyte and contribute to a successful and sustainable future.
Next steps:
Submit your CV online to apply for this role.
All successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical and criminal history check.
Register on our website for job alerts to be advised when new roles become available. https://careers.seymourwhyte.com.au/en/listing/
To learn more about us, visit www.seymourwhyte.com.au

Job Description:
Make an impact with NTT DATA
Join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. Our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive.
Your day at NTT DATA
The Data Governance Consultant (L4) is an advanced subject matter expert, responsible for designing and developing the company's data infrastructure.

This role will be required to leverage skills and expertise to introduce new ideas and improve on existing solutions in line with established frameworks and governance.

This role plays an important part in how the organization shapes and performs data governance. Additionally, this role develops and implements data governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to establish data governance best practices across the organization.
What you'll be doing
Core Responsibilities:
Strategic Leadership
Design and implement enterprise-wide data governance frameworks and strategies
Lead complex data and analytics advisory engagements using modern agile methodologies
Develop data-driven transformation roadmaps aligned with business objectives
Partner with C-suite executives to drive data governance initiatives
Technical Excellence
Architect comprehensive data governance solutions encompassing:
Metadata management and data lineage
Data quality and master data management
Privacy and security compliance
Data architecture and modelling
Guide implementation of modern data platforms including data lakes, warehouses, and analytics solutions
Business Impact
Drive business value through data-centric transformation initiatives
Contribute to practice growth through thought leadership and solution development
Mentor junior team members and foster knowledge sharing
Support pre-sales activities and proposal development
Required Experience:
7+ years in data governance implementation and strategy
Proven track record of enterprise-wide data governance initiatives
Experience with major data governance platforms (Purview, Collibra, Informatica, Alex Solutions)
Required Technical Expertise:
Data Management:
Architecture, Modeling, Metadata Management, Data Quality, MDM etc
Governance:
Frameworks, Policies, Standards, Controls, DAMA DmBOK
Technology:
Modern Data Platforms, BI, Data Science, AI Governance & Delivery

Leadership & Communication:
Consultant and SME Persona
Executive stakeholder management expertise
Strong presentation and documentation skills
Agile project delivery experience
Team mentoring and development capabilities
Workplace type:
Hybrid Working
About NTT DATA
NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. We invest over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. We are also one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is part of NTT Group and headquartered in Tokyo.

NTT DATA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. Job Title: Threat Analyst II, Machine Learning Operations and Response (Remote, AUS)
Job Description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
Our CrowdStrike Data Science Machine Learning Operations and Response Team is looking for a Threat Analyst who is both customer and team-focused. This role will include both response and pro-active aspects. This role will be perfect for anyone who is just starting or considering a career involving detections and reverse engineering. The primary responsibility of this role will be to analyze malware and detections by investigating individual customer detection tickets. This team is focused on improving detection capability and efficiency through analysis of malware or other threat detections impacting our customer base. Experience with detections of potentially malicious behavior by machine learning models is a plus.
Bring your passion for helping internal partners resolve questions about detections of potentially malicious activity by machine learning and our detection capability. Our goal for the team is to both help internal teams respond to customer-inquiries about threat detection and to provide information about the effects of our detections into the Data Science organization - including detection efficacy and managing false positive detections.
This role will work most closely with internal teams such as Technical Account Managers, Falcon Complete, Data Scientists and the Malware Research Center in Data Science.

What You’ll Do:
Review current product detections to ensure they are performing to the company standard
Perform tasks to enable better-management of false positive detections
Analyze binary files to determine their legitimacy
Address internal questions and concerns regarding customer threat detections
Review Machine Learning predictions

What You’ll Need:
Exposure and understanding of different types and functionality of malware
General knowledge of reverse engineering malware, or malware operations
Fundamental understanding of attributes of binary files such as imports/exports and packers
Ability to demonstrate practical knowledge of research/collection skills and analytical methods
General understanding of threat/risk management and threat/risk assessment
Familiarity with various operating systems
Knowledge of one scripting language, Python, Bash or PowerShell
Ability to break down complex problems into workable components
Experience with threat detections by Machine Learning
BA/BS or MA/MS degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field

Bonus Points:
Experience in a security operations center or similar environment responding to incidents
Good understanding of Windows OS internals and the Windows API
Knowledge of MacOS and/or Linux OS
Familiarity with tools used in targeted and criminal cyber-intrusions
A background in exploit and vulnerability analysis
Knowledge of programming C, C++, Java, assembly or GoLang
If you have experience in using a post-exploitation framework (for example Metasploit)
Splunk, SIEM or Elastic knowledge
MITRE ATT&CK Framework knowledge
#LI-JC1
#LI-Remote
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:
Remote-first culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards with option to participate in ESPP in eligible countries
Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
Physical and mental wellness programs
Paid parental leave, including adoption
A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
Access to CrowdStrike University, LinkedIn Learning and Jhanna
Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration
Birthday time-off in your local country
Work with people who are passionate in our mission and Great Place to Work certified across the globe
CrowdStrike is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone is valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist | Generative Artificial Intelligence
Job Description:
Join our innovative and collaborative team as a Senior Data Scientist in our Digital team Reimagine the future by efficiently creating enriching digital experiences for customers and harness the power of data and AI to deliver value for our customers. We are a team of collaborators, and we welcome partnering with you to accelerate digitalisation.
At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.
What role will you play?

You will oversee data projects from inception to deployment, ensure the delivery of solutions that offer actionable insights and enhance workflow efficiencies for business teams. You will guide non-technical stakeholders through the complexities of solving business challenges using data and technology, while also collaborating with technical experts like Solution Architects, Developers, and Data Engineers to design and implement robust data science pipeline solutions.

In this role, you will ensure solutions are seamlessly integrated with broader systems, adhere to strict deployment and regulatory standards, and are effectively tested and implemented in partnership with Technology Partners and Enterprise Technology. Additionally, you will communicate regularly with all project stakeholders, maintain compliance with Macquarie's regulatory standards, and mentor junior analysts to foster a successful project delivery environment.

What you offer

Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning or related field
Strong background in Generative AI, Large Language Model (LLM), prompt engineering, Natural Language Processing (NLP), including experience with text representation, document processing
Proficiency in Python, experience with Generative AI framework and Deep Learning algorithms for building Chatbots (OpenAI python packages, LangChain, LlamaIndex, Pytorch, TensorFlow)
Experience building Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution end-to-end, along with testing and evaluation of RAG solution performance
Experience using Data Science platform such as Azure Machine Learning Studio and Dataiku.

We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.
About Corporate Operations Group

In our Corporate Operations Group, you will work at the heart of Macquarie. Join a collaborative team who accelerate digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of our people, customers, shareholders and communities. Our teams include technology, digital transformation and data, operations, human resources, business services, corporate strategy and solutions and the Macquarie Group Foundation.
Benefits

Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
One wellbeing leave day per year and up to five additional days leave based on length of service
Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing
Access to a wide range of learning and development opportunities
Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.
If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

Job Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Junior Consultant
to help grow our team.
As an aviation consultant at To70, you will work on projects for airports, air navigation service providers and the government, both in Australia as well as overseas. Our junior role is a stepping stone in your career at To70. In one or two years you will see many different projects, work in different expertise areas, and learn from our seniors and experts.
After a period as a junior consultant, you will have developed into a valuable consultant, and you will begin leading your own projects. Are you ready to shape your career path with us?
Full-time · Melbourne/Brisbane
The company and our people
To70 delivers high-quality consulting and research services to the global aviation community. With our services, we help aviation and society cope with the current and future challenges in airport and airspace operations. Together with clients, we work to provide independent advice, helping them identify and analyse problems, recommending solutions and assisting with their subsequent implementation.
To70’s experts have extensive experience in the aviation sector. Our experts are renowned for their passion for aviation and lateral thinking that results in innovative practical outcomes. We are driven and disciplined professionals who want to achieve the best quality for our clients. Our wide range of clients includes airports, airlines, government bodies and air navigation service providers.
We have an open, informal and energetic culture where hard work and fun are both valued. In this role you will join and build out our expanding team, in Melbourne or Brisbane.

Your function
You're working on projects, in small teams

You're working on the optimisation of airspace and airport operations

You will be involved in stakeholder consultation

You're analysing safety, efficiency, capacity and the environment.
You will be synthesising complex data to determine valuable insights.

You're developing models and running simulations.

You formulate recommendations, write reports, and present your results to clients

You plan and organise your own tasks

Your profile
You bring analytical capabilities, a passion for aviation and an entrepreneurial spirit.
You're curious, critical, innovative and ambitious and want to progress your career and grow your professional network.
You're able to communicate and express yourself clearly, in oral and written forms, in English. Additional languages are an advantage.

You have computer scripting skills and experience (e.g. JAVA, Python, R, MATLAB) and your experience in CAD, airport/airspace simulation software (AirTOp, TAAM, CAST etc.) would be highly regarded.

You have a technical/engineering background and you've completed a Bachelor degree in a relevant field (e.g. aviation/aeronautics/aerospace, operations research, data science, statistics, analytics, or mathematics) or have considerable relevant experience.

You're an Australian Citizen, or a Permanent Resident of Australia or New Zealand citizen.
We offer

More information?
Call or email Arie van der Eijk +61 458 373 273, arie.vandereijk@to70.com.au

Job Description:
VALD is the world leader in technology for the allied health industry, providing innovative human-measurement technology to 6,500 clients in over 100 countries. If you have a favorite team in the NBA, EPL, or NFL, there's a good chance they use VALD Technologies.
Since its humble beginnings in 2015 in Brisbane, Australia, VALD has grown to a team of over 200 team members in over 30 countries, with 5 offices across four continents.
Driven by a multidisciplinary team of researchers, clinicians, sports scientists, designers, developers and engineers, VALD's suite of systems offer unparalleled insight into human movement, performance, injury risk and rehabilitation.
About the role
VALD is building the world's largest musculoskeletal database, with over two billion data points and counting. Using this data, we can help practitioners to objectively assess patients' progress and make more accurate, data-informed treatment decisions. We are looking for an experienced data scientist to join our growing team and build the technical foundations for VALD's future growth.
In this role, you will:
Develop, test and deploy machine learning models for applications such as outlier detection, rehabilitation trajectory modeling, and predictive device maintenance.
Enhance VALD's text-to-SQL generative AI tool in Databricks Genie, empowering internal stakeholders to unlock the value of our data.
Create and optimize reporting dashboards in Databricks AI/BI Dashboards and Power BI to surface critical insights for VALD's Product and Commercial teams.
Automate the analytics pipeline to establish a normative data repository, enabling practitioners to easily benchmark patients' performance against a reference group.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to support various initiatives across VALD, including patient rehabilitation analytics and customized normative data reporting.
Own and maintain the data science codebase, implementing best practices in development life cycle management and source control.
Is this you?
Our ideal candidate has:
Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python (including PySpark and ML libraries), Databricks, SQL, Git, R, Excel, and Power BI.
Proven experience building machine learning models in Python.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure and its applications in data science.
All the attributes that make a great data scientist – curiosity, attention to detail, teamwork, communication skills, a passion for problem-solving, and a willingness to meet deadlines.
Ability to handle ambiguity and thrive in a startup environment.
Why VALD?
An opportunity to be part of revolutionizing the health and performance industries is just the beginning when you join VALD.
We have a range of benefits we offer to our team, such as:
The opportunity to work in a company that is redefining allied healthcare.
Learn from a range of high-performing individuals and teams across a range of disciplines.
Be part of a down-to-earth, inclusive and vibrant team.
Chefs that prepare you delicious fresh breakfast and lunch.
On-site barista to make your coffee just as you like it.
Team gym, masseuse, and access to physiotherapy and exercise physiology services.
Diversity & Inclusion Commitment
VALD's best asset is not our technology but our people and culture. A culture of inclusion and diversity is critical to our business. We know diverse teams perform better. It's not a separate initiative – we aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We are committed to fostering an inclusive work environment and embracing diversity, including gender, nationality, disability, age, marital/parental status, ethnicity, gender identity, socioeconomic background and sexual orientation. We welcome applications from people from all backgrounds.
Apply now
In your cover letter, please share with us why you think your experience is relevant to this role and how this opportunity fits into your longer-term career goals. We can't wait to meet you and discuss what a career with VALD could look like for you!
Successful applicants will be subject to background checks (including identity and criminal record).

Job Description:
Description

NextGen is Australia's leading provider of Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions to the mortgage lending industry. Our 'ApplyOnline' platform is an industry standard for digital loan lodgement and assessment. We deliver quality products and services to a range of financial institutions and intermediaries and are experiencing strong growth. We have an exciting roadmap full of opportunity in the Australian financial landscape with a mission to make lending easy.

At NextGen, we believe our people make our business, and our values; Balance, Integrity, Collaboration, Respect and Discovery, are not just posters on our walls. They are how we live each day and are critical to our success.

We are looking for a passionate BI Developer who embodies these values to join our team. You will be responsible for creating actionable insights for internal and external clients by sourcing, transforming, and presenting data in Power BI, MSSQL, and Databricks.

Your new role as a BI Developer @ NextGen

Develop Insightful BI Solutions – Identify and craft business intelligence insights that address the needs of both internal stakeholders and external clients, driving informed decision-making across the board.
Implement BI Enhancements – Lead the integration of new or refined BI solutions, ensuring that insights align with evolving business objectives and provide measurable impact.
Design Data Presentation – Format and prototype queries, visualisations, and dashboards with precision, delivering clear and effective presentations of data that meet business standards.
Provide Agile Data Support – Generate ad-hoc queries and reports that allow the business to respond promptly to emerging data requirements.
Expand Our Data Lake – Source and incorporate foundational data (“Bronze data”) into our data lake, strengthening the base for robust analytics and reporting.
Enrich Data Quality – Enhance data reliability and validation processes (“Silver data”) to maintain high standards of accuracy and consistency.
Deliver Refined Analytics – Generate and implement refined, aggregated analytics (“Gold data”) that empower strategic insights and deliver actionable intelligence across the organisation.

Who are you?

Mandatory:
Development Experience: You have hands-on experience in a developer role, with the ability to bring technical expertise to our BI and analytics team.
Eligibility to Work in Australia: Full, unrestricted work rights are required.
Desirable:
Power BI Savvy: Experience with Business Intelligence & Analytics using Power BI is a plus—you know how to bring data to life.
SQL Mastery: Skilled in Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services, and SQL Analysis Services (or similar tools), with a knack for building scalable data solutions.
Team Data Projects: You thrive in collaborative environments and have experience developing or enhancing data products as part of a team.
Data Infrastructure Knowledge: Familiar with data lake, lakehouse, or data warehouse technologies like Databricks, BigQuery, or Hadoop? We’d love to hear about it.
Programming in Data Science: Proficiency in data science languages like Python, R, or SQL is highly valued here.
Quantitative Mindset: A background in mathematics, statistics, data science, or a similar field will set you apart.

What you'll get in return

Transparent, open and people first culture
Flexible work options, and spectacular views in a modern space for when you work from our North Sydney office
Reimbursement for your home office set up
Plenty of social activities
Generous remuneration package + all employees are eligible to participate in our STI program.
We also know that the above is a long list of things, and that success in any role can come from a number of compositions of skills and so we encourage you to apply if you feel that your skills and experience matches what we are looking for.

A great opportunity to join a business that truly lives its values, genuinely values work life balance and see's it as a critical ingredient to enabling people to bring their whole selves to work.

About NextGen
NextGen is Australia's leading provider of Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions to the mortgage lending industry. Our 'ApplyOnline' platform is an industry standard for digital loan lodgement and assessment. We deliver quality products and services to a range of financial institutions and intermediaries and are experiencing strong growth. We have an exciting roadmap full of opportunity in the Australian financial landscape.

Job Description:
Associate
Full-Time
Mandala Advisors Pty Ltd
Responsibilities
1. Client Engagement and Project Delivery:
o Work with project teams, typically consisting of three to five consultants, to deliver high-quality outcomes.
o Be responsible for delivering dedicated workstreams of work within client projects
o Support project leads in managing client relationships, establishing trust.
o Communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
o Gather and analyse data, structure ambiguous problems, and formulate actionable recommendations.
o Present findings to client leadership and collaborate with their teams to implement solutions.
2. Team Leadership and Development:
o Mentor and develop junior team members, providing feedback and take part in the firm performance assessment process.
o Foster a culture of self-awareness, empathy, and engagement within the team.
o contribute to an inclusive environment, encouraging diverse perspectives and strengths-based development.
3. Firm Development and Contributions:
o Participate in firm-building activities, such as recruitment, quality assurance, and team engagement initiatives.
o Contribute to business development efforts under the mentorship of senior leadership.
o Suggest, plan, and deliver activities to reinforce team culture and success.
4. Personal and Professional Growth:
o Pursue continuous learning opportunities to address development areas and build on strengths.
o Manage workstreams and tasks effectively, demonstrating self-motivation and a growth mindset.
o Seek and act on feedback to improve performance and achieve career goals.
Skills and Experience Required
Education:
o Bachelor's degree required.
o Advanced degree (e.g., MBA, PhD) or equivalent work experience preferred.
Experience:
o Minimum of five years of experience in strategy, economics, public policy, government regulation or related fields (such as law, maths or data science).
o Demonstrated ability to contribute meaningfully in team environments and deliver on-time, high-quality projects.
o Proven track record of strong achievement and career progression.
Technical and Analytical Skills:
o Ability to structure complex problems and develop data-driven solutions.
o Proficiency in quantitative analysis and logical reasoning strongly preffered.
Interpersonal and Leadership Skills:
o Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
o Ability to build relationships with clients, colleagues, and partners at all levels.

Job Description:
Join us on our mission to make a better world of work.
Culture Amp is the world’s leading employee experience platform, revolutionizing how 25 million employees across more than 6,500 companies create a better world of work. Culture Amp empowers companies of all sizes and industries to transform employee engagement, drive performance management, and develop high-performing teams. Powered by people science and the most comprehensive employee dataset in the world, the most innovative companies including Canva, On, Asana, Dolby, McDonalds and Nasdaq depend on Culture Amp every day.
Culture Amp is backed by leading venture capital funds and has offices in the US, UK, Germany and Australia. Culture Amp has been recognized as one of the world’s top private cloud companies by Forbes and most innovative companies by Fast Company.
For more information visit cultureamp.com.
How you can help make a better world of work
We are passionate about data at Culture Amp, and having a winning data strategy is crucial for our success. We have an exciting opportunity for a Director of Product to join our Data Intelligence Camp, (Camps are what we call our product teams!). This camp’s mission is in the name - we’re here to improve the quality, discoverability and accessibility of data to the broader product group at Culture Amp, ultimately with the aim of delivering inimitable customer value from our data strategy. We want to inspire our teams, enabling them to better contribute to and use data by showing them what truly great data and insights looks like.
In this role you will work within a cross-functional leadership team to take ownership of strategy execution and the roadmap, and you’ll embark on a journey of discovery to ensure our teams are enabled to effectively use data.
What you’ll spend time doing:
Drive, evolve, and shepherd the execution of our data strategy to ensure whole of business alignment
Mentor a small team of Product Managers to hone their craft and level up their capabilities
Collaborate across all camps including with the Data Intelligence leadership team (Engineering, Design, and Data Science leaders) to refine and deliver an aligned data strategy, with a well-oiled execution machine
Partner with your product peers across the function to influence and enable the effective use of data to realise our strategy
Formulate goals and ways of working that promote cross-product collaboration and deliver ambitious product outcomes
Collaborate with top notch Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, and People Scientists
Communicate with a broad range of stakeholders, including highly technical domain specialists, as well as completely non-technical colleagues, with a strong ability to align, challenge and drive collaborative strategic execution
What you’ll potentially bring to the table:
Significant expertise in Product Management leadership roles
Expertise and experience in data-specific product challenges, balancing the needs of our product teams and end users, including internal customers
Comfort with ambiguity and the desire to own, drive and build clarity
Structured thinking, that ties both strategic outcomes and commercial ambition to the day-to-day, giving clear guidance to technical teams on what should be prioritised and why
The ability to take broader strategy and turn it into a pragmatic yet ambitious set of priorities over various time horizons
A strong toolkit of product management frameworks for prioritisation and documentation
The ability to apply consistent product development processes and practices that set teams up for success (such as lean development), and adopt practices set at the group level for effective company-wide co-ordination
The ability to communicate and distill highly complex and detailed topics into very simple and concise formats - both verbally, in written format, and in a structured way
The ability to collaborate with and influence a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders, demonstrated in increasing organisational data productisation and delivery of data-related customer outcomes across adjacent product areas (i.e. not in your direct control)
A drive to build and foster highly-effective teams
Willingness to collaborate with our European product team (not in direct reporting line, but close collaborators)
Curiosity and passion for people and culture, and their linkage to business outcomes. At heart, you're what we call a people geek!
We believe that our employees are the heartbeat of our success. We're committed to fostering a work environment that truly cares for and develops its people, and creates lasting positive impact. In addition to providing a competitive compensation package, some of the key benefits we offer are:
Employee Share Options Program: We empower you to be an owner in Culture Amp and share in our success
Programs, coaching, and budgets to help you thrive personally and professionally
Access to external providers for mental wellbeing and coaching support to sustain the wellbeing, safety and development of our people
Monthly Camper Life Allowance: An automatic allowance paid out each month with your pay - you can spend it however you like to help improve your experience and life outside work
Team budgets dedicated to team building activities and connection
Intentional quarterly wellbeing pauses: A quarterly company-wide shutdown day in each region to to collectively pause, reset and focus on restoration and rest, without having to tap into individual vacation time
Extended year-end breaks: An extended refresh period at the end of year
Excellent parental leave and in work support program available from day 1 of joining Culture Amp
5 Social Impact Days a year to make a positive impact on the community outside of work
MacBooks for you to do your best & a work from home office budget to spend on setting up your home office
Medical insurance coverage for you and your family (Available for US & UK only)
Additionally, we don't just focus on our internal community; we believe in creating a better world of work for all. We're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, with Employee Resource Groups and ally communities in place.
We have a strong commitment to Anti-Racism, and endeavor to lead by example. Every step we make as a business towards anti-racism is another step we can take to support our customers in making a better world (of work). You can see our current commitments to Anti-Racism here.
Please keep reading...
Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting significantly fewer requirements.
We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested: we'd love to know how you can amplify our team with your unique experience!
Thank you for taking the time to read this advert. If you decide to apply, as part of your application, we will ask you to complete voluntary diversity questions (excluding Germany). Please watch this video from our amazing DEI Leader, Aubrey Blanche to share more on why we collect the data and how we will use it.

If you require reasonable accommodations or adjustments due to a disability to complete the online application or to participate in the interview process, please contact accommodations@cultureamp.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Job Description:
Accent Group Limited is the leading digitally integrated retail and distribution business in the Apparel and Footwear performance and lifestyle market in Australia and New Zealand. With over 850+ stores, 34 brands and over 30+ online platforms. Our brands include; Glue, Platypus, Skechers, Hype DC, Vans, Dr. Martens, Subtype, The Athletes Foot, CAT, Merrell, The Trybe, Timberland, Stylerunner, Hoka, UGG, Saucony, & Nude Lucy!

Accent Group Limited is the leading digitally integrated retail and distribution business in the Apparel and Footwear performance and lifestyle market in Australia and New Zealand. With over 850+ stores, 34 brands and over 30+ online platforms. Our brands include; Glue, Platypus, Skechers, Hype DC, Vans, Dr. Martens, Subtype, The Athletes Foot, CAT, Merrell, The Trybe, Timberland, Stylerunner, Hoka, UGG, Saucony, & Nude Lucy!

We have an exciting role available for a Head of Data and Insights to join our Technology Team based in our Cremorne Office, Melbourne.

About the Role

Reporting to the General Manager of Technology, this is a rare and exciting opportunity, perfect for a strategic and organised team player. The Head of Data and Insights will be responsible for leading the organization’s data strategy, overseeing data management, and driving the use of data and analytics to deliver actionable insights that influence business decision-making. This leadership role involves managing a cross-functional team of data professionals and collaborating closely with other teams to ensure the effective utilization of data to improve business performance.

You will have a deep understanding of data management, advanced analytics, and business intelligence, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful insights that support business growth. You will be leading a team with resources based in Melbourne and Sydney, our ideal candidate is a seasoned technology leader who can demonstrate an understanding of retail fundamentals, data driven insights that can continue to transform our business.

The key responsibilities will include the following:
Data Strategy & Vision:
Define and implement the organization’s data and insights strategy, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Oversee the design, development and management of the organisation’s data infrastructure that supports business needs and drives data-driven decision-making.
Ensure that data is managed as a strategic asset across the company and continuously look for opportunities to unlock its value.
Business Intelligence Strategy (BI) and Execution:
Define and implement the BI strategy in alignment with organizational objectives, ensuring BI solutions deliver actionable insights to all levels of the business.
Lead the selection, implementation, and optimization of BI tools to support data visualization, reporting, and analysis needs across departments.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and business intelligence applications that provide real-time insights to key stakeholders.
Ensure the BI tools are integrated with the data warehouse and other internal systems to provide a holistic view of organizational data.
Advanced Analytics & Reporting:
Lead the development of advanced analytics solutions such as predictive modelling, trend analysis, and machine learning integration to enhance the organization’s capabilities.
Oversee the creation of ad-hoc reports and custom queries to support business decision-making in real time.
Ensure that insights drive business decisions, improve operational efficiency, and uncover new opportunities for growth.
Leadership & Team Management:
Lead and inspire a team of data analysts, engineers, and insights professionals to deliver high-quality, actionable insights.
Foster a collaborative, innovative, and performance-driven culture within the data and insights team.
Build team capabilities through training, mentoring, and hiring top talent.
Data Governance & Quality Assurance:
Establish and enforce data governance standards to ensure the integrity, accuracy, security, and privacy of data in the data warehouse and BI systems.
Implement data quality checks and validation procedures to maintain the reliability and consistency of data across all platforms.
Work closely with data stewards and business units to ensure data definitions and business rules are standardized and well understood.
Cross-functional Collaboration:
Work closely with business leaders to identify data-driven opportunities and ensure the use of insights to improve business outcomes.
Advocate for the adoption of data-driven decision-making processes, promoting the use of BI tools and reports across the organization.
Support data-driven decision-making across the organization by promoting data literacy and ensuring stakeholders understand how to interpret and use insights.
Collaborate with other technology teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources and the scalability of data solutions.
Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data science, analytics, and business intelligence, applying new techniques and tools to improve business performance.
Lead the adoption of cutting-edge data solutions, machine learning, AI, and automation to enhance data capabilities and efficiency.
Continuously refine the data strategy to meet evolving business needs and opportunities in the marketplace.
Stakeholder Reporting & Communication:
Present data and insights to executive leadership and key stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
Be an escalation point for business leaders on data and insight queries
To be successful you will ideally have the following skills & experience:
Demonstrated 7 years of experience in data management, data warehouse, or business intelligence roles, with at least 3 years in a leadership position.
Strong expertise in data warehouse architecture, design, and management (e.g., SQL, ETL, cloud data platforms).
Experience in the retail industry highly regarded
Experience managing data infrastructure projects at scale and working with cross-functional teams to meet business intelligence needs.
Familiarity with data governance principles and standards (desirable)
Strong stakeholder management and team engagement capability and influence business outcomes
Exceptional communication skills across all business facets and with partners/vendors
Ability to identify, allocate and monitor performance of team members to successfully deliver outcomes to agreed timeframes
Proven experience working in a fast-paced retail culture
Knowledge of data warehouse technologies and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Proficiency in BI tools, data visualization, and reporting platforms (e.g., Qliksense, Power BI)
Familiarity with data analytics and machine learning integration in BI solutions
The role does require some flexibility to accommodate technology deployments outside of usual business hours

Job Description:
We Dream. We Design. We Deliver.
Join hummgroup, one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring non-bank financial services institutions. We specialise in fast, easy finance with a market-leading range of business asset finance, credit cards and point of sale payment plan solutions designed around the core needs of today’s businesses and retail consumers. Come join our team and be a part of our next chapter of innovation and growth.
What's so exciting about this role?
We are transforming the data landscape with the implementation of a new modern data platform. The Data and Analytics functions is as one of our most critical in relation to the strategic side of the business, supporting business growth, great customer experiences, and outstanding operational results.
We are looking for an experienced Data Platform Lead/Tech Lead to spearhead the transformation of our legacy data infrastructure into a modern, scalable, and cloud-based data platform. In this pivotal role, you will work closely with the Chief Data Officer (CDO) to develop and execute a data transformation strategy that will enable advanced analytics, data science, and business intelligence capabilities across the organisation. You will lead the design and implementation of a modern data platform transformation, focusing on technologies like Snowflake, Databricks, and cloud-based solutions (AWS, Azure)
What Does An Average Day Look Like?
No day is average at humm but here’s an idea of what you can expect to do in this role:
Define the architecture and roadmap for moving to a new data platform, ensuring minimal disruption and maximum value aligned with the company data strategy and business objectives
Advocate for modern data practices, Data as a Product, and data governance principles, implement data management controls as standard
Collaborate with the CDO to refine a comprehensive data strategy that aligns with business objectives and future growth plans
Oversee the creation of data assets, pipelines, and processes to the new platform, ensuring data integrity, security, and performance
Implement CI/CD pipelines and automation tools to streamline data operations and improve deployment speed and reliability
Manage and optimize data storage solutions, including data lakes, warehouses, and real-time processing frameworks implementing FinOps processes integrated at outset
Ensure the integration of the new platform with existing and new enterprise systems, enabling seamless data flow and accessibility
Work closely with IT, analytics, and business intelligence across the Group to ensure the data platform meets the needs of all stakeholders, providing reliable and timely access to data.
Stay informed on emerging data technologies and trends, evaluating their potential impact on the platform and business
Who will thrive in this role?
An experienced Data Platform Lead/Tech Lead who is technically and strategically minded with a passion for leadership.
We’re also looking for someone who brings:
8+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or a similar role, with at least 3 years in a leadership position
Proven experience in designing and implementing modern data platforms, with expertise in technologies such as Databricks, Snowflake, Azure Data Lake, or similar
Strong understanding of data governance, data quality, and data security principles
Strong leadership and team management abilities, with a track record of building and mentoring high-performing teams
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge of data integration, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks
Excellent planning skills with experience managing large-scale data platform transformations in a scaled agile environment
A degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field; advanced degree preferred
Working at hummgroup
We embrace flexible working arrangements, ensuring a genuine work-life balance and a fun, vibrant inclusive culture that embraces diverse perspectives and values the unique contributions of each of our team through our behaviours Leadership - Accountability - Collaboration - Commerciality.
We invite candidates of all gender expressions, ethnicities, ages, and other culturally diverse groups to apply. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and welcoming and supportive environment where all our people can thrive.
If this sounds like the opportunity, you have been looking for then apply today!

Job Description:
Inner West Council is an Inclusive Employer.
Inner West Council (IWC) is committed to Equal Employment, we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply.
IWC is dedicated to reflecting our community and strongly encourage Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people of diverse sexualities and genders, Veterans, young people, and mature aged workers to apply.
This is one of the many reasons why IWC was the 2023 AR Bluett Award Winner and recognised as the most progressive council across NSW. We are also The Australian Business Awards Employer of Choice Winner for 2023
IWC are intent on respecting the rights and improving opportunities for people with disability. If you identify as a person with disability and require reasonable adjustments to support you in your application and throughout the recruitment process, please contact:
Reasonable Adjustment Assistance:
Julia Phillips, Disability Inclusion Programs Officer - phone: 02 9392 5819, email: julia.phillips@innerwest.nsw.gov.au
IWC's P&C Workforce and Diversity team, email: diversity@innerwest.nsw.gov.au
The above contacts are for reasonable adjustment assistance only. Click here for more information on reasonable adjustments
For any other enquiries, specific to this job advert and application, please contact the Hiring Manager. Details are listed under the Enquiries header below.
About Inner West Council
Inner West Council (IWC) is among Sydney’s larger local metropolitan local government councils looking after a community of 201,000 people living in some of the inner city’s most vibrant, creative, liveable, and diverse suburbs. As we continue to deliver quality, innovative, and inclusive programs and services, we invite you to join in on our journey towards becoming the best council for our community.
The community is at the heart of IWC, and our values of Integrity, Respect, Innovation, Compassion and Collaboration are at the centre of everything that we do.
We offer flexible career life balance with hours that allow you to relax and recharge. We offer a variety of flexible work arrangement options (e.g. flexible hours and working from home) where appropriate giving you even greater quality of work life balance.
Permanent employees benefit from our great value gym membership from $16.60/week giving access to a vast network of gyms in Sydney.
About the role
The Head of Data (Data Manager) will be responsible for developing and executing the Council’s data strategy, ensuring that data is leveraged as a strategic asset to drive business objectives. The role will oversee all aspects of data management and governance, information management, and data analytics. The role will be pivotal in transforming the Council into a data-driven organisation by building a robust data architecture and integrating data into decision-making processes.

Among the core focus of this role are:
Design and delivery of spatial data and records management to support the Council’s operations.
Direct and manage the work and activities of staff and ensure that the team consistently works to meet its targets and commitments against their individual or teamwork or performance plans and Council’s Operational and Strategic Plans.
Lead, manage and inspire the team, coach and develop staff, facilitate partnerships across Council and help solve problems and resolve issues, and model achievement of goals and commitments.
Please read the Position Description to familiarise yourself with all the requirements and conditions of the role.
Remuneration
An annual Total Remuneration Package (TRP) in recognition of:
Market relativity
Additional hours worked to meet position requirements and performance expectations
Access to IWC motor vehicle lease back scheme
Option to Salary Sacrifice for nominated otherwise deductible items as requested (if taken up)
Some of the required skills, experience and qualifications
Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Information Technology or relevant experience.
Significant experience in a senior data leadership role, including expertise in data strategy, data management, and data architecture.
Expert knowledge and experience in the design and delivery of spatial data and records management solutions.
Demonstrated knowledge of data governance, data privacy (State Records Act 1998, Australian Privacy Act 1988, GIPA act 2009), and data security.
Expert knowledge of state and local government planning requirements.
Enquiries
Darren Morris, Chief Information Officer on 9392 5730
Closing Date
Sunday 5 January 2025, 11:30PM

Job Description:
Join the department as a Principal Data Scientist and be part of a team that is making a difference and creating a lasting legacy. Our department is playing a significant role in Queensland's future. As a Principal Data Scientist in the Data and Analytics team, you'll be responsible for working as part of a team of analysts in the Insights and Digital Unit, providing analysis at both the strategic and operational levels.

At DEC, our people are our strength, and we pride ourselves on a positive culture that values and respects the diversity of our team. In this role, you'll be part of a diverse and talented team.

Here's what we're looking for:
- Demonstrated expertise and experience in the following technology domains to analyse, provide technical direction, standardisation, professional advice:
o Database: Microsoft SQL Server or other associated DB technologies
o Strong understanding of Azure cloud based services specifically around Azure Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning suite.
o Data Engineering and Data Modelling
o Development languages such as SQL, PowerShell, Python or other languages used in Azure environments
o Proven ability to analyse business and system problems and develop innovative solutions with strong focus on delivering high quality client services and outcomes.
- Demonstrated ability to plan, design, implement and deliver the development of complex data science solutions ensuring that solutions balance functional and nonfunctional
requirements.
- Demonstrated knowledge in the application of data structures and associated components, data standards and architectures including security and compliance.
- Demonstrated skills and knowledge in the implementation of data science designs that support demands for advanced data analytics with the ability to solicit a detailed understanding of requirements.
QGP use the Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA). This framework describes information and communication technology capabilities. The skills required for this role are as follows:
- DENG 5
- DTAN 4
- DBDS 4

As part of this role, you will:
- lead the provision of business intelligence, reporting and analysis to support decision making at whole of government, category portfolio and agency level.
- leading the design of a repeatable high-quality data integration and categorisation process for procurement information across Queensland Government's finance systems using strong technical and design skills.
- leading the research, analysis and interpretation of data sourced from systems as required to find solutions to business issues applying statistical, mathematical, analytical, problem-solving and evaluation.
- leading maintenance and managing improvements to the whole of government procurement machine learning capabilities, including strong technical skills data engineering process, database structures, machine learning building in the Microsoft Azure stack (data factory, SQL Server, Azure machine learning studio etc).
- leading the development and documentation of conceptual and logical data flows in support of category management.
- setting up ongoing operational machine learning models.
- managing individual performance and proactively guide the performance and development of all team members', addressing concerns in a timely and appropriate manner.

Join our team and be part of our legacy. We celebrate diversity and invite applications from all backgrounds. For further information about this exciting opportunity, please see the attached role description.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.

Job Description:
Our Solution
Demyst unlocks innovation with the power of data. Our platform helps enterprises solve strategic use cases, including lending, risk, digital origination, and automation, by harnessing the power and agility of the external data universe. We are known for harnessing rich, relevant, integrated, linked data to deliver real value in production. We operate as a distributed team across the globe and serve over 50 clients as a strategic external data partner. Frictionless external data adoption within digitally advancing enterprises is unlocking market growth and allowing solutions to finally get out of the lab. If you like actually to get things done and deployed, Demyst is your new home.
The Opportunity
As a Data Engineer at Demyst, you will be powering the latest technology at leading financial institutions around the world. You may be solving a fintech's fraud problems or crafting a Fortune 500 insurer's marketing campaigns. Using innovative data sets and Demyst's software architecture, you will use your expertise and creativity to build best-in-class solutions. You will see projects through from start to finish, assisting in every stage from testing to integration.
To meet these challenges, you will access data using Demyst's proprietary Python library via our JupyterHub servers, and utilize our cloud infrastructure built on AWS, including Athena, Lambda, EMR, EC2, S3, and other products. For analysis, you will leverage AutoML tools, and for enterprise data delivery, you'll work with our clients' data warehouse solutions like Snowflake, DataBricks, and more.

Demyst is a remote-first company. The candidate must be based in Australia.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal project managers, sales directors, account managers, and clients’ stakeholders to identify requirements and build external data-driven solutions
Perform data appends, extracts, and analyses to deliver curated datasets and insights to clients to help achieve their business objectives
Understand and keep current with external data landscapes such as consumer, business, and property data.
Engage in projects involving entity detection, record linking, and data modelling projects
Design scalable code blocks using Demyst’s APIs/SDKs that can be leveraged across production projects
Govern releases, change management and maintenance of production solutions in close coordination with clients' IT teams
Requirements
Bachelor's in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or similar technical discipline (or commensurate work experience); Master's degree preferred
1-3 years of Python programming (with Pandas experience)
Experience with CSV, JSON, parquet, and other common formats
Data cleaning and structuring (ETL experience)
Knowledge of API (REST and SOAP), HTTP protocols, API Security and best practices
Experience with SQL, Git, and Airflow
Strong written and oral communication skills
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to learn and adapt quickly
Benefits
Distributed working team and culture
Generous benefits and competitive compensation
Collaborative, inclusive work culture: all-company offsites and local get togethers in Bangalore
Annual learning allowance
Office setup allowance
Generous paid parental leave
Be a part of the exploding external data ecosystem
Join an established fast growth data technology business
Work with the largest consumer and business external data market in an emerging industry that is fueling AI globally
Outsized impact in a small but rapidly growing team offering real autonomy and responsibility for client outcomes
Stretch yourself to help define and support something entirely new that will impact billions
Work within a strong, tight-knit team of subject matter experts
Small enough where you matter, big enough to have the support to deliver what you promise
International mobility available for top performer after two years of service
Demyst is committed to creating a diverse, rewarding career environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage individuals from all walks of life to apply.

Job Description:
Location:
Melbourne

Employment Type:
SA - Salaried

Department:
Information Technology

About Roy Morgan
Roy Morgan is Australia’s most reputable and longest established market research company, with an unparalleled reputation for reliable, accurate, meaningful, revealing market research. At the forefront of data and research innovation since 1941, today Roy Morgan continues to provide accurate and independent information insights to leading Australian and international companies and governments, as well as partnering with these same companies on bespoke data applications and technology development.

About The Role
The Technology department is responsible for positioning Roy Morgan as an efficient and innovative Research Company that employs best in breed technologies and methodologies to generate powerful insights for its customers.

With this newly created role, we are seeking a Data Engineer to join the Information Technology team with a laser focus on R&D, mapping and implementation of a wider Data Lake/Warehouse strategy, with a strong emphasis on AWS technologies and a driving force with our transformation journey. This is a unique opportunity to assist in developing new ways of working with our world-renowned data sets.

Reporting to the Head of Information Technology, the Data Engineer will initially focus on helping us with R&D on transforming older data stores into high performing data engines, data engine selection, specifically for wide columnar storage and processing engines, fast query performance etc and continuous improvement on data sets, their storage and transformation. The initial work will involve data modelling and testing in several technology stacks/engines, with a focus on building real time analysis queries to upgrade our client facing API backends. Moving beyond, you will be an integral part of helping the company modernise our Data Lake/Warehouse and all associated data management and pipelines, including being a part of the team that develops, implements and maintains the company’s Data Lake/Warehouse strategy.

The Data Engineer will work closely with Data Scientists in building analytics models, automating internal processes and finding new and better ways to warehouse and process data to help improve our products and business decisions. The successful candidate will collaborate with product managers, fellow engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver top-notch data-driven solutions for our customers.

About You
Ideally, your skills and experience should include:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Data Science
Previous experience in Data Engineering or similar role, preferably within “big data” and/or the Market Research industry
Strong background in data pipeline design, ETL processes, and data modelling
Strong practical programming skills in R/Python, SQL
Deep understanding of Devops principles, with relation to Data Engineering
Proficiency in AWS Services including Redshift, Keyspaces, EMR, Lake Formation, Glue jobs, S3, Lambdas, Fargate etc
Strong analytical, problem-solving, conceptual and research skills
Practical experience in applying AI and machine learning for real-world solutions
Knowledge of data management and visualization techniques
Proven ability to work simultaneously across a variety of different projects and initiatives, while working autonomously, as part of a team and collaboratively
Well-developed communication skills with the ability to convey complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Achievement oriented with proven experience of being a part of a cross skilled, motivated and cohesive team

Our Offer to You
We believe in investing in our people and when you join us, you can expect:
Vibrant work culture
Competitive salary package
Company social events, including Friday night activities
Company EAP service
Benefits including entertainment events, annual flu vaccine, discounted MYKI passes, and corporate discount for health insurance

Roy Morgan values diversity and is committed to building an inclusive workplace culture that reflects our community. We encourage diversity and recognise the enrichment diversity brings to our business and people - whether its diversity of skill, experience and/or background. We welcome applications from diverse backgrounds and community groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Technology team at a time of transformational change and if it sounds like your next opportunity, then apply now!

Job Description:
Make an impact with NTT DATA
Join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. Our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive.
Your day at NTT DATA
The Business Intelligence engineeris a seasoned subject matter expert, tasked with participating in the transformation of data into insights that drive business value using data analytics, data visualization, and data modelling techniques and technologies.

This role is required to transform data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions and is also responsible for the establishment of system applications and/or tools that the company uses to record, organize, store, secure, and access data.

This role is required to have seasoned technical specialist proficiency in extracting and modelling data, generating data models, visual analytics and dashboards
What you'll be doing
Key Responsibilities:
Work as team to deliver modern data solutions
Implementation of modern data platforms
Elicit and document business requirements
Testing and defect resolution
Production support
Documentation

Conduct Data Engineering and Data Migration Activities
Deliver tactical solutions as part of data platform build and data migration activities
ETL builds
Pipelines
Azure components
Work with complex models and large volumes of data
Build an understanding of data models of varying complexity across a range of industries
Work with data models across different technology stacks
Develop Power BI dashboards and semantic models
Build high quality Power BI Semantic models, including efficient data transformations in Power Query and SQL
Design, develop and implement interactive and effective visualisations
Demonstrate consultative skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Creative and conceptual thinking
Understand and dynamically apply the data lifecycle
Demonstrated ability as a team player
Strong time management skills

What would make you a good fit for the role
Across the business, the standout common characteristics across our teams is that we’re approachable, supportive and have a can-do attitude. In addition to this, you will be a good fit for the role if you bring:
3+ years working as a BI Engineer or technical BI Analyst
Experience with some or all of the following tools
Azure Data Components (ADF, SQL, Synapse, Fabric)
Power BI
Databricks
MS BI Stack (SSMS, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS)
MS Power Apps
Proficient understanding of business intelligence and data warehousing concepts
Perform and execute data analysis and data modelling
Proven ability to translate business requirements into effective technical design
In addition to the above skills, we require the following:
Australian Citizenship
Academic Qualifications and Certifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or another quantitative field is preferred.
Workplace type:
Hybrid Working
About NTT DATA
NTT DATA is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. We invest over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. We are also one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is part of NTT Group and headquartered in Tokyo.
Equal Opportunity Employer
NTT DATA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, disability, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected category. Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

Job Description:
Primary Details
Time Type: Full time
Worker Type: Employee
Location: Flexible
Type: Full time permanent opportunity
Hybrid role, Happy to talk flexible working
The opportunity
This exciting new role will support the Data Community, Adoption & Innovation team in driving effective data adoption across our AUSPAC division, including the embedment of innovative tools like generative AI. This role is all about bringing our business on the journey and helping them to use and adopt data & AI initiatives being delivered.
Your new role:
As the Data Adoption Lead, you will play a key role in:
Communicating and simplifying the complexities associated with the delivery of data & AI initiatives, applying a people centric approach to adoption management
Implementing initiatives to shift the mindset and behaviour changes required to sustain adoption success
Collaborate and engage with relevant teams to synchronize data adoption efforts to minimise the change experienced by end users.
Measure adoption success to identify and adjust for changes to engagement and training requirements.
This role will report into the Head of Data Community, Adoption & Innovation and will be required to ensure alignment with broader Data & Analytics strategic communication and engagement activities.
Other responsibilities include:
Develop and implement strategic engagement activities necessary for the successful business adoption of analytics initiatives, including but not limited to GenAI.
Evaluate the technology, process and people impacts to determine necessary support materials required for adoption success.
Identify and tackle potential barriers to adoption, partnering with business leaders to ensure a seamless transition for impacted employees.
About you:
You will have experience and/or familiarity with:
Data analytics, processes, and governance practices with the ability to transform complex data concepts into compelling narratives that drive change
The ability to manage multiple change initiatives to meet delivery timelines, you will be able to identify and solve problems related to data adoption
Are able to collaborate closely with relevant teams (e.g., Change Chapter and human centred design), to help synchronize data adoption efforts and minimise changes experienced by stakeholders.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Confidence with presenting and engaging with both business and technical stakeholders
Ability to manage multiple change initiatives and meet delivery
About QBE
We can never really predict what’s around the corner, but at QBE we’re asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future – helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.
We’re an international insurer that’s building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.
And our people will be at the centre of our success. We’re proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities.
With more than more than 13,000 people working across 27 countries, we’re big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.
We believe this is our moment – what if it was yours too?
Benefits
We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As a QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:
‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance
Our ‘Thriving at our Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice
18 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid super
The ability to maximise retirement savings through voluntary super contributions and company matching
Income protection insurance & reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums
Additional leave and support through QBE’s Family Domestic Violence First Responder Network
Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners

We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have been recognised for the following awards:
2021 LinkedIn Top Employer & HRD Employer of Choice

Gold Employer status for 4 years in a row 2019 - 2022 Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion
Ranked 6th place in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2021 as voted by graduates
Top 20 Workplaces for Dads in 2019 and 2020 (HBF Direct Advice for Dads)
Family First accredited employer since 2021
