Job Description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

AI Products at Xero

The AI Products group exists to collaboratively build products that use AI and ML to reduce toil and deliver the right insight at the right time. Working within the Data & Science team, you will join a diverse, globally distributed team of scientists, engineers, product managers, and analysts who help Xero turn data into beautiful, insightful products.

The role

ML engineers design and build the infrastructure and services that power AI products that serve millions of customers every day. They also work closely with Applied Scientists through the research and development process to create harnesses and to safely take models from research to production environments. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you'll lead the technical delivery of projects and design system architectures, collaborating with senior colleagues.

Life at Xero

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xero, you’ll be joining us on our mission of applying theory to real world problems in a pragmatic and creative way! You’ll have exposure to a variety of complex challenges at a global scale, whether it’s working with cutting edge language models or more traditional ML methods – you’ll get to create AI Products that delight our end users and help save them time!
To tackle the hard problems we’re aiming to solve, you’ll
Build our AI research and production infrastructure and services, ensuring their scalability while preserving flexibility for research teams
Make sure we're solving the right problems with the right methods
Share knowledge with colleagues and lifting the bar for the AI Products team
Work with teams across Xero to improve the quality and usability of data
Here is what we look for in a Machine Learning Engineer at Xero :
Experience delivering ML and AI products at scale including strong SQL skills, understanding of distributed processing (data, ML, etc) and collaboration with scientific disciplines (statistics, ML) and Tensorflow is a nice to have
You like to solve hard problems and understanding how things work
You are comfortable learning new frameworks (distributed processing, ML, etc) and applying them to real problems
You are willing to dive into the unknown, and allow new information to change your decisions
Constant learning and growth are an important part of who you are
You are always willing to learn from others, ask for help and grow and mentor early career engineers
Why Xero?
Offering very generous paid leave to use however you’d like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, health insurance, life insurance, and income protection, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you’ll do the best work of your life at Xero.

Job Description:
Our Enterprise Data Platform team is responsible for managing Macquarie’s Corporate Data Platform. The businesses we support are highly reliant on the platform for a broad range of use cases including data science, self-service analytics, operational analytics and reporting.
At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.
What role will you play?

As a Senior Cloud Engineer, you will help deliver new platform capabilities leveraging various AWS and Kubernetes technologies. You will have the opportunity to be a part of several greenfield projects that will transform the platform and the way the business uses it.

Your day to day will be varied and include deploying new tools on AWS infrastructure and/or Kubernetes, conducting PoCs to assess new technologies, automating manual tasks, enhancing the platform CI/CD pipeline and supporting the platform applications.

What you offer

5+ years’ of enterprise experience as a Cloud/Devops/Data Engineer
Hands-on experience with AWS cloud platforms and their respective services
Hands on experience with Kubernetes
Experience with Big Data processing technologies like Hive, Spark, Starburst Presto
Strong scripting skills - python, bash
Experience working in DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Continuous Delivery environments
Ability to support the businesses and colleagues through your effective communication skills
Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams
Passionate problem solver with a learning mindset and a keen interest in Big Data and Cloud Technologies
We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.
About Technology

Technology enables every aspect of our business, for our people, our customers and our communities. Bring your unique perspective and join a global team who is passionate about accelerating the digital enterprise, connecting people and data, building platforms and applications and designing tomorrow’s technology solutions.
Benefits

Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
One wellbeing leave day per year and up to five additional days leave based on length of service
Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing
Access to a wide range of learning and development opportunities
Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.
If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

Job Description:
Shape the Future of Data Science at Findex – Step Up to Your Next Challenge! We are currently seeking a naturally curious and solution orientated Senior Data Scientist to join our Melbourne team! The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing & maintaining positive relationships with internal & external clients to to deliver innovative solutions. This is a permanent, full-time opportunity with hybrid working conditions.
Shape the Future of Data Science at Findex – Step Up to Your Next Challenge!
We are currently seeking a naturally curious and solution orientated Senior Data Scientist to join our Melbourne team! The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing & maintaining positive relationships with internal & external clients to to deliver innovative solutions.
This is a permanent, full-time opportunity with hybrid working conditions.
What will your typical week look like?
Focusing on solution design with 30% hands on work.
Set up data pipeline in cloud (e.g. using Data Factory in Azure) to integrate data from multiple sources.
Provide analytics to assist end users to better understand key insights from dashboards, graphs, benchmarks etc.
Identify, create, manage, and maintain analytically rigorous data and automating collection processes.
Identify data patterns, trends and develop predictive models.
More about the perks!
Full remote working set-up to work from wherever you want – work from home and/or office!
We provide flexible schedules, work environments, and experiences.
Thrive in a team who come together to achieve amazing outcomes!
A genuine opportunity for long-term career progression!
Let’s talk about you!
Must Have:
Proven commercial experience in analytics/data science.
Hands on DataOps/Devops practices.
Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture.
Knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms.
Advanced Python programmer.
Bonuses:
Experience with Azure and Azure Devops.
Comfortable extracting data via SQL queries & using business intelligence tools (Power Bi).
Work with data engineering tools and setup pipelines in Azure (Azure data factory, Azure ML).
Experience in solution design and architecture.
Developed and deployed machine learning models.
Microsoft certifications.
A Note to Applicants : At Findex, we believe in the value of diverse experiences and perspectives. While meeting all the requirements can be beneficial, we understand that no one can be a perfect match for every single point on a job listing. If you're passionate about this role and believe you can make a significant contribution, even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Job Description:
The Regional Planning and Rostering Specialist is responsible for optimising and publishing rosters for Estia Health homes within a specific region.
This role ensures efficient staff deployment by analysing and designing rostering strategies that align with organisational goals and comply with business rules, safety protocols, and relevant legislation.
The role will also focus on the creation of demand forecasts to develop capacity plans for the region, producing optimised rosters up to 12 months in advance while adhering to Estia Health policies and operational agreements.

The responsibilities we will trust you with:
Develop and implement strategic rostering plans that align with organizational goals, ensuring optimal staffing levels and efficient use of resources for your designated region.
Analyse historical data and forecast future staffing needs based on demand patterns, trends, and business requirements to ensure accurate and timely staffing.
Continuously review and optimise rostering processes to improve operational efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance staff satisfaction within designated region.
Timely publication of rosters in accordance with relevant awards and to the agreed-upon quality standards with business stakeholders
Conduct regular roster reviews and optimisation to ensure an effective alignment of staff with demand requirements
Review and manage leave requests within specified timeframes and report of leave offered at roster publish to relevant manager
Track and analyse key performance indicators (KPIs) related to rostering and staffing, making data-driven decisions to improve performance and achieve business objectives.
Provide training and support to relevant staff on rostering systems and processes, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities.
Utilise rostering software and other tools effectively to manage schedules, track performance, and ensure the accuracy of data.
Engage with key stakeholders and provide regular formal and informal updates on the progress of activities managed by the resourcing team to enhance business outcomes
Contribute to the development of appropriate documentation of the team’s resource planning processes to ensure a consistent and high-quality delivery of rosters
Prepare and present reports on staffing metrics, roster compliance, and optimisation efforts to senior management, providing insights and recommendations for improvements.
Continuously enhance personal skills in resource planning and customer service to exceed KPIs and effectively meet customer needs.

The person who will be amazing in this role:
A degree in a related field such as Business Administration, Human Resources, Data Science, or Operations Management is desirable.
Certifications in project management, data analysis, or specific rostering software could be advantageous.
Experience in understanding of rostering and resource planning processes, theories, and methodologies
Advanced Computer skills including Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Experience in applying Industrial, regulatory rules or enterprise agreements within a business
A high level of prioritisation, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills
Ability to ‘think outside the box’ and to work within multiple/conflicting time constraints
Ability to analyse complex data sets and identify trends and patterns.
Capacity to align rostering strategies with organisational goals and objectives.
Demonstrated experience in analysing data to inform decision-making processes.
Practical experience with rostering or workforce management software.
Strong verbal and written communication skills for interacting with various stakeholders.
Proven ability of using data to drive decisions, communicate effectively, and manage both the technical and strategic aspects of workforce scheduling.
As one of the largest and fastest growing aged care providers in Australia, we need exceptional people to join us on our journey of changing the way we offer aged care. If this is you, Apply Now!

Job Description:
About Accenture:

Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent- and innovation-led company with 774,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and AI with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. Our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Song, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients reinvent and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Migration Lead with expertise in leading complex data migration programs. You will be the point of contact for managing data migration initiatives, ensuring data integrity, and working closely with clients to deliver projects on time and within scope. It requires a unique blend of technical expertise, project management skills, and strong communication and collaboration skills. This position involves prior experience in delivering the entire data migration process, from planning and strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities:
Demonstrated experience working collaboratively with a range of stakeholders to frame the problem statements, assess options for the data migration strategies, aligned with client’s strategic direction and value, and influence decisions
Lead end-to-end data migration programs, from architecture, design and lead the development of the overall migration architecture and approach, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and data integrity.
Deep Understanding of modern technologies used in data management, integration, cloud (hyper-scalers) and security
Proven exposure to data mesh and/or domain-driven design
Prior experience in working on large, transformation projects in the Financial Services domain will be highly regarded.
Oversee and monitor project timelines, budgets, and deliverables, ensuring successful project outcomes while mitigating risks.
Ensure adherence to data governance, compliance, and best practices throughout the migration process.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
15+ years of experience in data architecture, engineering, and delivery, preferably in a financial institution.
Proficient in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing & modern data platform solutions.
Extensive knowledge of data governance, security frameworks, and regulatory compliance in the financial sector.
Excellent leadership and team management skills, with a track record of successfully leading technical teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on delivering high-quality data solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

Benefits of working at Accenture:

18 weeks paid parental leave
Long & short-term career break opportunities
Structured career development program
Local and international career opportunities.
Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™
Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people.

Job Description:
The Opportunity
Join the pinnacle of academic excellence at Monash Business School and help propel your career in academia. The Department of Econometrics & Business Statistics at Monash University is a global powerhouse with a dynamic team of approximately 50 leading academics and a similar number of PhD students, all with particular strengths in Actuarial Science, Business Analytics and Econometrics. According to the University of Nebraska Global Research Rankings Business School Actuarial Science Rankings, over the last two years we have improved our world ranking from 36th (based on 2016-2020) to 7th (based on 2000-2024) and our national ranking from 5th to 4th.
The Role:
The department is introducing a new specialisation within the Bachelor of Actuarial Science entitled Actuarial Analytics. Preference will be given to candidates conducting data-driven applied research in actuarial science, with expertise in areas such as applied statistics, data science, or machine learning as they relate to actuarial science. Candidates should be prepared to teach across both Actuarial Science and Business Analytics units/subjects, as required.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct high quality and impactful research
Prepare and deliver lectures, workshops, and seminars
Supervise and engage with honours or postgraduate students
Attend departmental, school, and/or faculty meetings
Fulfil committee responsibilities
About You
For the Level B Lecturer Role:
Qualifications: A doctoral qualification in actuarial science or a closely related discipline (or be close to completing such a doctorate)
Research Prowess: Showcase a robust research background with a commitment to top-tier journal publications
People Skills: Possess a high level of interpersonal skills, motivating and actively engaging with students at a tertiary level
For the Level C Senior Lecturer Role:
Credentials: A doctoral qualification in actuarial science or a closely related discipline
Scholarly Impact: Demonstrate evidence of high-quality scholarly activity, including publications in top-quality journals
Innovator: Proven track record of obtaining significant external grants for research, coupled with enthusiasm for curriculum development
About Monash University
At Monash, work feels different. There’s a sense of belonging, from contributing to something groundbreaking – a place where great things happen.
We value difference and diversity, and welcome and celebrate everyone's contributions, lived experience and expertise. That’s why we champion an inclusive and respectful workplace culture where everyone is supported to succeed.
Together with our commitment to academic freedom, you will have access to quality research facilities, infrastructure, world-class teaching spaces, and international collaboration opportunities.
Learn more about Monash.
Be part of our story. Work with us to #ChangeIt.
Monash supports flexible and hybrid working arrangements. We have a range of policies in place enabling staff to combine work and personal commitments. This includes supporting parents.
To Apply
Your application must address the Key Selection Criteria. For further instructions on how to apply, please refer to 'How to apply for Monash Jobs'.
We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse people, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, and people of all genders, sexualities, and age groups.
We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible recruitment process at Monash. If you need any reasonable adjustments, please contact us at hr-recruitment@monash.edu in an email titled 'Reasonable Adjustments Request' for a confidential discussion.
Your employment is contingent upon the satisfactory completion of all pre-employment and background checks required for the role, as determined by the University.
Enquiries: Professor George Athanasopoulos, Head of the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics, Econometrics & Business Statistics, BusEco-EBS.HOD@monash.edu

You bring a solid foundation in software development and data science, with the ability to design and deploy data-driven applications, especially relating to IOT systems. Your professional maturity enables you to work both independently and as part of a team, demonstrating technical expertise and client engagement skills.

Work with a globally renowned institute driving innovation in railway technology.

Engage in diverse, high-impact projects that shape the future of railways.

Job Description:
Senior Data Scientist
Job No.: 997011
Location: Melbourne - CBD & Inner
Job type: Full-Time
Country Road Group (CRG) is embarking on transformation to position itself for growth, leveraging our scale, capabilities and culture as a House of Brands. We are investing in new and existing capabilities and have a number of exciting opportunities available.
The Senior Data Scientist plays a pivotal role in advancing Country Road Group’s data-driven strategy by leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and statistical modelling. This role focuses on developing, scaling, and productionising predictive models to support key business objectives, including customer engagement, loyalty programmes, and digital marketing optimisation.
In addition to managing and optimising codebases, the Senior Data Scientist works closely with the broader analytics team, IT, Loyalty, and the Product Owner – Engagement to ensure that data science models, including incrementality models, churn prediction, RFM models, mixed media models, and demand forecasting for digital marketing, are fully integrated and adopted across the organisation.
This role involves high-level technical expertise, ensuring that data science models are scalable and deliver actionable business insights.
Key Accountabilities
Lead the design, development, and productionisation of advanced data science models, including incrementality models, churn prediction, RFM models, and forecasting models for digital marketing demand.
Develop and scale mixed media models to assess marketing impact and optimize media allocation. Collaborate with IT for efficient deployment and with the Product Owners for integration across engagement platforms and channels.
Manage and optimise codebases for scalable model development. Maintain a code library to promote reuse and ensure adherence to best practices, version control, and collaboration standards.
Leverage advanced data science techniques like predictive modelling, machine learning, and statistical analysis to drive customer engagement and marketing performance. Collaborate with the analytics team to transform raw data into actionable insights and develop churn and RFM models to support retention and improve customer lifetime value (CLV).
Work closely with the Loyalty, CRM, and Customer Engagement teams to deliver insights and models that support customer segmentation, retention, and personalisation efforts.
Monitor and optimise model performance by fine-tuning algorithms, refreshing data, and incorporating new sources. Develop a feedback loop to enhance models based on results and business outcomes.
Lead the scaling of models and analytics across business units, driving measurable impact. Explore new technologies and foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and internal governance, while collaborating with IT to maintain clean, accurate datasets for model development.
Key Capabilities
Extensive experience in data science or advanced analytics roles, with a strong focus on machine learning, predictive modelling, and statistical analysis.
Experience in developing and productionising models, including incrementality models, mixed media models, churn models, RFM models, and forecasting models for digital marketing.
Strong understanding of code management, including version control systems like Git, and experience managing and optimising code libraries.
Experience working with cross-functional teams, including IT, Loyalty, and Marketing, to deliver and scale data science solutions.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms and tools, such as AWS, Google Cloud, and BigQuery.
Advanced proficiency in Python, R, and SQL, with hands-on experience in building and deploying models in AWS or Google Cloud environments.
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau or Power BI for communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders.


Why work for CRG?
The Country Road Group is one of Australasia’s largest Lifestyle Brand Houses comprising of iconic brands such as Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Here are some of the great things we offer:
Generous employee discounts across our House of Brands
Seasonal clothing allowance
An additional day of leave for your birthday
An Industry leading Parental Leave Program
Flexible working arrangements to support work/life balance
Annual learning calendar to support the ongoing development of our team
Support community partnerships across our Corporate Social Responsibility Program
We are committed to operating ethically, sustainably, and responsibly.

About CRG
Country Road Group is Australia's largest Lifestyle Brand Houses comprising of iconic brands including Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Our Values include being Customer Obsessed, Collaborative, Inspirational, Responsible and Dedicated to Quality. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate individuals to be part of the Group’s evolution and support each brand to realise their full potential.
Country Road Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application to assist you through the recruitment process

Job Title: Data Analytics Sales Specialist, Google Cloud
Job Description:
At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see ourReconciliation Action Plan for more information.

Minimum qualifications:
7 years of experience in promoting analytics, data warehousing, or data management software.
Experience planning, pitching, and executing a territory business strategy.
Experience executing commercial and legal agreements with Procurement, Legal, and Business teams.
Experience working with sales engineers and customer technical leads to build business cases for transformation and plans for implementation.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience with market leading Business Intelligence (BI), data analytics middleware, or data warehouse technologies.
Understanding of data analytics technology stack (e.g., Hadoop/Spark, Columnar data warehouses, data streaming, ETL and data governance, predictive analytics, data science framework).
Understanding of Google Cloud Data and Analytics offerings (e.g., BigQuery, Looker, Pub/Sub).
Ability to engage audiences through social channels, deliver messages that inspire customers.
Ability to engage and influence executive stakeholders as a business advisor and thought leader in data and analytics.
Excellent business acumen and analytics skills, using data to inform decisions and influence stakeholders.
About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
In this role, you will build an understanding of our customers' businesses and bring expertise to executive-level relationships to help them deliver their strategies. You will leverage expertise promoting data analytics and work with Account teams, Customer Engineering, and Partners to ensure customer results.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities

Calibrate business against the objectives and key results, report the state of the business for the assigned territory.
Build and maintain executive relationships with customers as the data analytics subject matter expert, influencing long-term strategic direction.
Develop and execute strategic account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across key industries. Focus on building accounts.
Assist customers in identifying use cases suitable for Google Cloud Data and Analytics solutions, articulating key solution differentiation and business impact.
Work with Google account and technical teams to develop and drive pipelines, and provide expertise. Develop Go-To-Market (GTM) efforts with Google Cloud Platform partners.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. Job Description:
Join our growing team as we revolutionise data modernisation for the Capital Markets industry. You will be involved in the design of cutting-edge product features and solutions, while also making an impact in sustainability through ESG data analytics and carbon offset initiatives. This is your chance to shape the future of data across RoZetta’s global network of clients.
Company Overview
Born from a rich legacy in deep research and development, RoZetta Technology has honed its expertise in managing global market data for over two decades. We proudly serve global market data vendors, delivering data to banks, hedge funds, regulators and universities.We are the innovators behind DataHex, the world's leading managed data technology platform. Built by a team of brilliant data scientists and cloud technologists, DataHex is designed to handle petabyte-scale market data across all asset classes, sourced from exchanges worldwide.
DataHex's impact is truly global, with major data vendors in the US, Europe, and Asia currently leveraging its power.
Role Overview
The role involves providing technical leadership to both the data science team and the broader RoZetta team, with a focus on solution design. This role will be pivotal in bridging the gap between data science innovations and the implementation of practical, scalable solutions, reporting directly to the Chief Data Scientist. The primary responsibilities will include designing data-driven solutions and collaborating with the technology implementation team to transition proof of concept (POC) solutions into production.
Core Responsibilities
Solution design:
Lead the design and development of data-driven solutions that address key business challenges and opportunities
Develop comprehensive solution architectures that integrate various data sources, tools, and technologies
Ensure solution designs are scalable, maintainable, and aligned with the company’s strategic goals
Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of RoZetta’s technology platform, product suite, vision, strategy and roadmap
Data science:
Conduct advanced data analysis and develop predictive models to derive actionable insights
Utilise machine learning and statistical techniques to build and validate models
Stay abreast of the latest developments in data science and incorporate relevant advancements into the organisation’s practices
Collaboration and project management:
Work with cross-functional project teams to deliver data science projects from inception to deployment
Work closely with the technology implementation team to ensure a seamless transition of POC solutions to production
Assist with the development of project plans, manage timelines, and ensure milestones are met
Communicate project progress and outcomes to stakeholders effectively
Provide technical guidance and support during the implementation phase
Ensure that solutions are optimised for performance, scalability, and reliability
Leadership:
Assist with the mentoring of data scientists and provide technical leadership within the team
Help foster a culture of continuous learning and innovation
Contribute to the development of best practices and standard operating procedures
Qualifications & Skills
Advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or a related field
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R or Java
Strong expertise in machine learning, statistical modelling, and data analysis techniques
Experience in big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure)
More than 5 years commercial experience in capital markets / ESG industry
Demonstrable solution design expertise
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Leadership experience and entrepreneurial outlook
Our core values and how we work
We embrace Entrepreneurial Spirit. We seek ways to add value and win.
We are One Team. We win together and collaborate to solve problems together.
We are Accountable. To ourselves, our team, clients and partners.
We are Committed to Excellence. We have a keen eye for detail and we over-deliver.
We Lead the Future. We are trusted advisors to our clients, innovators and solution-focused.
Remuneration and benefits
A full time permanent position
TBA (based on experience) + Employee share options
A hybrid work - 3 days in the office and 2 days from home
A chance to work on exciting innovative and high-profile projects
If you would like to join our innovative team send your application to:
recruitment@rozettatechnology.com

Job Title: Research Fellow on Machine Learning/Natural Language Processing
Job Description:
Classification: Academic Level B
Salary package: $112,916 - $128,026 per annum plus 17% superannuation
Terms: 2x Full time, Fixed Term (24 months)
These positions will provide opportunities to:
Conduct cutting edge research in machine learning and AI, such as but not limited to natural language processing and interpretable machine learning.
Opportunity to supervise research students and work as part of a larger team.
Opportunities for inter-disciplinary collaborations, and collaborate with industry and government
About ANU and School of Computing
The ANU by 2025 Strategic Plan calls for the University to serve society through transformational research and education. As one of the great universities of the world, ANU is driven by a culture of excellence in everything we do. Our lived experience is increasingly one of large-scale systems of people, whose actions and interactions are influenced by our digital, physical and biological environment. The School of Computing in the ANU College of Engineering, Computing and Cybernetics (CECC) has a strong foundation in computing and information sciences at ANU. We are a transformative centre for research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, computer systems and software, and theoretical foundations of computing. We span traditional and modern thinking, connecting decades of computer science methodologies with modern data and computational science. Our mission is motivated by the need to design, drive and sustain strategic activities via five broad focus areas: Computing Foundations, Computational Science, Intelligent Systems, Data Science and Analytics, and the Software Innovation Institute.
About the opportunity
We invite two new Postdoctoral / Research Fellows to join a CSIRO/ANU/UNSW project on artificial intelligence for health, safety and environmental objectives. The Research Fellow appointments will be two years fixed term. The research project connects with the research strengths in the school on artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML) and vision, natural language understanding, and robotics. The intended project also collaborates with other requisite disciplines to integrate human and social values in AI systems, touching on aspects of philosophy, cognition, ethics, and safety.
This appointment will focus on interpretable machine learning for data summarisation, with applications in climate change, health and environment. Competitive applicants in this stream are expected to have in-depth knowledge in at least one of the following areas: machine learning algorithms, human-centered machine learning, natural language and text processing. The intended research will involve algorithm design, formulating and solving human-centered machine learning problems, and connecting algorithmic innovation to application domains. The research fellow is expected to work with a team led by Prof Lexing Xie, Prof Jing Jiang and Dr Thang Bui.
The intended research will have a mix of theoretical and empirical components. We invite researchers with diverse skill sets and research methodologies to apply.
We are looking for strong team players with excellent interpersonal skills and the capacity to quickly develop productive and professional relationships with colleagues. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with talented PhD, master and undergraduate students in the School of Computing. Appointees will also have opportunities to gain teaching experience, in a way that is aligned with their career development and project settings.
Applicant Enquiries
To enquire about this opportunity, please contact Prof Lexing Xie at lexing.xie@anu.edu.au , Prof Jing Jiang jing.jiang@anu.edu.au, or Dr Thang Bui at thang.bui@anu.edu.au.
We expect to hold reviews after the advertisement has closed, with potential future rounds scheduled in 2025.
Working at ANU
This is an opportunity to work with a world class University that undertakes cutting edge research and has a strong tradition in research-led teaching excellence. We offer:
attractive benefits and excellent support to maintain a healthy work/life balance and offers generous remuneration benefits, including four weeks paid vacation per year and 17% employer contribution to superannuation.;
generous paid parental leave entitlements of up to 32 weeks. We are one of the leading employers in Australia for parental leave entitlements;
designated parent rooms, quiet spaces and childcare facilities on campus;
career support, training, mentoring & upskilling opportunities.
For more information on a range of lifestyle, financial and non-financial rewards and programs,
To see what the Engineering, Computing and Cybernetics at ANU community is like, we invite you to follow us on social media at Instagram and Facebook.

Job Description:
Who is sa.global
sa.global addresses industry challenges through vertical-focussed solutions. Leveraging modern technologies like AI and Copilot, we empower organizations to make intelligent decisions and act faster. Our solutions and services are 100% based on Microsoft business applications and the Microsoft Business cloud, and benefit advertising and marketing, accounting, architecture and engineering, consulting, homebuilding, legal, and IT services companies. Through our industry-first approach, we want to put solutions in the hands of people closest to the problem to enable organizations to act faster and make intelligent decisions.
Over 800,000 users in 80 countries around the world rely on sa.global's industry-focused expertise to gain value faster, adapt quickly to changes, and build for the future. We have 30+ years of real-world experience, we are an 11-time winner of the Microsoft Dynamics Partner of the Year Award, and we’ve been a part of Microsoft’s elite Inner Circle for11 years. Our global organization has a 1000-member team across 25 countries.

For more information, visit www.saglobal.com.


Why Choose sa.global
Open, flexible, vibrant, collaborative, and diverse – these are just some of the terms that our employees use to describe the culture at sa.global. We believe and encourage innovative and dynamic thinking. Our culture and values give us the extra edge to help us scale greater heights.
Led by our Core Values: Agile, Capable, and Committed, which form an integral part of who we are, we constantly strive to provide an inclusive work environment. Our employees come from varied cultural and social backgrounds, and we strive each day to work towards making sa.global a great place to work.


Values of sa.global
Contribute towards a working environment that represents “one sa.global” where everyone is seen as an equal, and equality and diversity is championed
Interact with a wide variety of colleagues, customers, and stakeholders at all levels with respect, courtesy, and professionalism
Come as you are, make work fun & others successful, and foster an always learning mentality

About the Role
We offer a career with growth opportunities in a dynamic, collaborative, and supportive organization. We also have a strong and ethical working culture. If you'd like to work with a team that is passionate about their work while also having a good sense of fun, you might have just found what you are looking for!
sa.global is looking for a motivated and skilled Presales Consultant to join our dynamic consulting team in APAC! The ideal location for this role is Australia. As a Presales Consultant, you establish and develop capabilities, positioning sa.global as an innovator for clients. You drive revenue growth globally, communicating and designing solution offerings to clients.

Major Areas of Responsibility
Design, build, and demonstrate scenario flows with Microsoft Dynamics 365 aligned to the client's key requirement
Demonstrate strong stakeholder management skills both internally and externally supporting the sales team with bid management and RFI
You will assist in designing bespoke solutions through defining the client’s needs that is not only ‘fit for purpose’ but also aligned with the company’s best practice
Create differentiated propositions while solving business-impacting client problems related to managed services solutions
Advise the delivery team during the functional solution design
Drive measurable and sustained growth by achieving successful business outcomes
Analyze current business practices, processes, and procedures as well as future business opportunities
Be known for your "client-centric" approach
Align the solution value with client objectives via discovery, demonstration, estimation, SOW, and deal close activities
Work directly with sales team and clients as a coach and subject matter expert
Support qualification and origination activities and sales pursuits by building compelling client specific propositions
Work with internal delivery team to shape propositions around existing capabilities, and define features where there are gaps


Skills and Experience
Hands on functional experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 modules (F&O and CE within professional services, legal, homebuilding industries)
First class communication / presentation skills at all levels (both technical & non-technical audience)
Capable of utilising strong interpersonal, verbal, presentation and writing skills to successfully interact with clients and the sa.global team
Ability to influence stakeholders throughout the sales cycle
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or Data Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience

Job Description:
Staff Software Engineer
You are collaborative and enjoy solving analytical problems to help our team to reach highest potential
We are a team of big thinkers who are engineering the future of banking
Together we will build tomorrow's bank today, using world-leading technology and innovation

Do work those matters

We're building tomorrow's bank today, which means we need creative and diverse engineers to help us redefine what customers expect from a bank. Envisioning new technologies that are still waiting to be invented and reimagining products that support our customers and help build Australia's future economy.

CommBank is recognised as leading the industry in IT and operations with its world-class platforms and processes, agile IT infrastructure, and innovation in everything from payments to internet banking and mobile apps. Our Software team are the brains behind Australia's number one banking app, Netbank, Cardless Cash, Comm Sec Pocket and Spend Tracker. We go beyond a passion for web and mobile development, creating reliable APIs at a unique scale in Australia. And you could be a part of that journey.

See yourself in our team

You will be working in the Market Risk reporting team of Global Markets technology, building software solutions that will help our business manage traded market risk effectively. We build software applications and manage software systems of various sizes to deliver high quality financial solutions. Technical deliveries in the various teams include working with popular technology tools for both on-prem as well as Cloud based software.

The technology group is made up of small vertical teams that delivers product-based software solutions and horizontal teams that work across the numerous teams to ensure that we uplift the learnings, use best practices, and enrich our overall knowledge base.

As a Staff Engineer, you'll be working within a cross-functional squad which is responsible for developing and managing customer capabilities. We are looking for a smart, driven and resilient engineer who enjoys delivering customer and business solutions in a collaborative, iterative and simple manner. Also, you'll be invited to attend our regular engineering guilds to broaden your expertise and participate in agile ceremonies, which will allow you to contribute to and define the way we operate.

We're interested in hearing from people who
Are passionate about building high quality software solutions with comprehensive test coverage.
Have solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and best practices.
Can lead a team from a tech strategy and delivery perspective.
Interested in cross team knowledge sharing for better software development
Collaborates within the team to apply the principles of design, development, testing, deployment, support, and evaluation.
Are actively involved in continuous learning, experimentation, and participate in peer code reviews.
Are constantly thinking outside the box and breaking boundaries to solve complex technical problems.
Work well in teams and have strong collaboration skills in driving continuous improvement initiatives.

Tech Skills

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don't expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these will set you up for success in this team:
Background in building Java based APIs and Python based apps for data science
Frontend framework - React and other typescript libraries
Databases - Oracle, Snowflake
Strong background in AWS Cloud - VPCs, Subnets, Security Groups, ECS, MWAA, S3, VPC Endpoints
Any experience with the following would be great - TDD, Docker, DevSecOps principles and tools like Github Actions

Domain Skills
Good understanding of Global Markets and associated Market risk (Sensitivities, VaR, Capital reporting) will be considered highly advantageous.

Working with us

Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with us is for you.

We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. We're looking for people who truly live our values: Care, Courage and Commitment and we'll offer you great opportunities to develop your career with us.

If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Job Description:
WHO ARE WE?
City FM Australia (City) provides world-leading facilities management and engineering solutions that ensure safe, successful, and sustainable outcomes for our partners, on time and on budget. Underpinning our core services and unique offering sits our technology platforms and initiatives, delivered through in-house Application, Programming, Testing, Development and Business Intelligence teams.

The Opportunity:
As a Subject Matter Expert in AI and Cloud Technologies, you will leverage data-driven insights to inform business decisions and develop innovative solutions using AI services. You will adopt machine learning models, analyze large datasets, and deploy AI solutions that enhance third-party applications.

Reporting to the Head of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, you will have the opportunity to:
Leverage AI services to extract, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Design and implement machine learning models for complex business challenges.
Deploy scalable and reliable AI solutions on the Azure platform.
Ensure the quality and security of training data to develop unbiased models.
Maintain up-to-date methodologies and benchmark against industry standards.
Partner with cross-functional teams to identify AI opportunities for business improvement.
Communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations.
Stay informed on advancements in Azure AI and machine learning & recommend new AI products.
To be considered for this role you will have / be:
Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science, focusing on machine learning and AI.
Strong programming skills in SQL and Python; experience with libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Proficiency in Azure AI and App services, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure AI Services, MLops, Azure functions, and containers.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
Experience with Power BI or Tableau & Agile development environments.
A passion for continuous learning in data science and AI.
Full Australian working rights and current police check.
Required certifications:
Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate

What’s on offer:
Exciting opportunity to grow & work within fun and supporting IT team
Permanent secure role within growing FM organisation
Hybrid working model (WFH 2 days a week)
Free onsite parking when in office
If you would like to be part of a growing Australian Facilities Management business, we would love to hear from you.
Please apply by sending an updated resume and cover letter. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted by phone.

City is an Equal Opportunity Employer who supports and encourages the diverse needs of each individual Team Member.
City does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from Recruitment Agencies. Please do not submit any resumes or associated profiles to the City careers portal or to any City team members. City will not pay any placement fees relating to unsolicited resume referrals.

Job Description:
About the job Lead Consultant
Lead Data Scientist
Melbourne / Geelong location
We Are Fujitsu
We use technology to make happier lives. We are a global leader in technology and business solutions that transform organizations and the world around us. We have a long heritage of bringing innovation and expertise, continuously working to contribute to the growth of society and our customers.
About the role
We are currently seeking a Lead Data Scientist to join our growing team. The role holder is an expert in their field with extensive experience of helping organisations gain value from data science solutions. They will be responsible for helping our clients understand how data science can benefit their business and leading teams in implementing these solutions. They will also mentor junior data scientists both internally at Fujitsu and as well as at our clients. They will provide technical advice and assistance to the Data & AI sales staff and existing or prospective customers.﻿ This role involves travel and working from Geelong twice a week on-site to deliver customer requirement.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities
Engaging with clients at all levels to understand their business challenges and identify innovative solutions using data science and AI.
Architecting and designing data science and AI solutions
Leading teams to implement advanced analytics and data science solutions for customers in an enterprise environment.
Helping organisations understand their data and how they can extract value from it.
Helping clients establish data science and AI capabilities and best practices at their organisation.
Providing mentorship and guidance to more junior data scientists at Fujitsu
Providing thought leadership in data science both internally and externally
Assist with building up the Fujitsu data science practice, capabilities and offerings.
Assist with pre-sales scoping, shaping of opportunities as well as developing proposals and presenting to clients.
Requirements and Experience
Developing and delivering data science and AI solutions in an enterprise environment
Knowledge and experience of MLOps preferably using MLFlow
Leading and motivating a data science team
Mentoring of junior data scientists
Implementing data science solutions in Azure cloud
Implementing data science solutions using Databricks
Excellent knowledge of SQL and Python. Preferable knowledge of R
Influence senior stakeholders in the benefits and opportunities that data science offers
Why Fujitsu?
We are an organization with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.
We put people first. We believe in the power of diversity to drive innovation and our AWEI (Australian Workplace Equality Index) Gold Employer status, and Rainbow Tick certification for LGBTI+ inclusion show that we value an inclusive culture.
We offer tailored career paths across our global organization to support your professional and personal growth.
Our customers trust us. We have an excellent reputation across the region and globally.
Best in-class reward and recognition programs flexible work, volunteering leave, and more.
We live our values of aspiration, trust, and empathy, all day, every day.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
As an inclusive employer, Fujitsu aims to recruit a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our purpose. In line with our diversity, equity, and inclusion strategy, we highly welcome applications from women and gender-diverse people; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; Māori and Pacific people; LGBTI+ people; people with a disability; culturally and linguistically diverse people; veterans, Australian Defence Force (ADF) and emergency responders. Transgender and gender-diverse applicants can request a copy of our Frequently Asked Questions﻿ to assist with the recruitment journey.
If you don't tick every box in this job description, please don't rule yourself out. Research suggests that underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they meet every requirement. We focus on hiring people who value inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage, and integrity, rather than ticking boxes so if this resonates with you, then please apply. For more information, please email careersapac@fujitsu.com.
Search Firm Representatives PLEASE READ:
Fujitsu does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs or resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written agreement in place for this position will be considered the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired by Fujitsu due to an agency referral where no existing agreement is in place with the Fujitsu Talent Acquisition Team. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions must be through engagement by the Fujitsu Talent Acquisition Team.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Senior Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in leveraging data to drive campaign strategies and marketing decisions, working closely with the Campaign Manager and Marketing team. This role is critical for identifying insights, campaign opportunities, and ensuring that data-led decisions are made across marketing initiatives.
Job Descriptions
Liaise with the Campaign manager to conduct deep analysis into customer data and behaviour to drive insight, identify key campaign opportunities, and support data-led decisions and prioritisation.
Work with Marketing team to conduct quarterly analytical reviews of marketing activities.
Manage the design and implementation of the marketing analytics framework in collaboration with other data analysts, Marketing, and Sales team
Prepare and maintain documentation of analytics and experimental research and prepare and present engaging presentations for a broad range of technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Requirements
Skills, knowledge and experience in data science, business analytics, behavioural sciences, or in a data-driven consumer organisation.
Demonstrated extensive skills in marketing analytics, ideally in a media organisation, with a deep understanding of customer-focused data analytics.
5 years + demonstrated substantial experience with experimental design, analysis, and reporting in a relevant discipline ideally a marketing organisation where you have optimised marketing activities.
Significant experience performing analytics in a modern cloud environment (Redshift, Snowflake, Databricks etc). Highly advanced experience using SQL to access and model large datasets, and Python or any other advanced analytics software package to analyse and visualise data. Highly advanced ability to analyse complex data from a variety of sources, including SQL databases, web services, JSON, and CSV.
Extensive experience with Microsoft Office, including Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Teams, and Sharepoint. Experience in JIRA/Confluence also helpful
Benefits
Join a rapidly expanding international organization, allowing you to contribute to its growth and success.
Collaborate with influential senior stakeholders.
Hybrid work arrangement.
Thrive in a dynamic and high-energy work environment.

Job Description:
Estia Health roster a workforce of over 10,000 employees in seventy-eight locations, and the bulk of the workforce rostering is done in homes. As we upgrade our Rostering, Time & Attendance system, there will be significant changes to the user interface, and we need to ensure that our teams can roster effectively with the upgraded solution.
This role will be a key member of the project team, understanding current rostering practices and how they translate into the upgraded solution, opportunities for improvements that can be implemented with the new solution, participating in testing, developing/updating training materials, and delivering training to ensure that our homes can effectively roster and comply with business rules, safety protocols, and relevant legislation.
Understand current rostering processes, business rules, safety protocols, relevant legislation, and goals for the project that will contribute to improved rostering practices; and understand how these will be delivered through the upgraded solution.
Participate in testing the new solution against these processes, rules, protocols & legislation, understanding any gaps and potential business impacts. Escalate to project manager as required.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of training materials, processes, and user guides for reference. Ensure a range of techniques, resources and media (which might include eLearning, virtual classrooms) have been identified to address end user learning needs.
Plan and deliver training and ongoing support to home teams on rostering systems and processes, ensuring they understand our business processes, how to use the system, and their roles and responsibilities in rostering.
Track progress of training initiatives and report on the effectiveness and uptake of the new roster system.
The traits that will help you succeed
A degree in a related field such as Business Administration, Human Resources, Data Science, or Operations Management is desirable.
Certifications in technical writing, project management, data analysis, or specific rostering software advantageous.
A good understanding of learning styles and experience in training others, preferably within a Health context.
Strong understanding of rostering and resource planning processes, theories, and methodologies.
Practical experience with rostering or workforce management software.
Advanced Computer skills including Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
A high level of prioritisation, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.
Demonstrated experience in analysing data to inform decision-making processes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills for interacting with various stakeholders.
Self-directed and highly motivated individual
As one of the largest and fastest growing aged care providers in Australia, we need exceptional people to join us on our journey of changing the way we offer aged care. If this is you, Apply Now!
Want to know more?
If you have questions, please email katrina.maurer@estiahealth.com.au
Estia Health is committed to embracing diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplaces. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities. If you need assistance to participate in our application process, please let us know.
Note: It is a condition of employment that you will be, and remain, vaccinated against COVID-19 and Influenza. All shortlisted applicants will need to pass the required background checks.

Job Description:
Company Description

At Neilson, we help families put financial protection in place for their loved ones. We are a Life insurance provider who offers a wide range of first class Life insurance products via multiple direct brands and corporate partnerships. We believe in offering our customers straightforward life insurance.
We’ve evolved from our origins in the UK to become an international operation with offices in the USA, Canada, Ireland, the UK and Australia, with our head office based in Windsor and an in-house digital marketing agency, Thinkbait, based in Dublin, Ireland. Having multiple locations worldwide enables Neilson to attract the absolute best people, allowing us to achieve our aim of being a leading global provider of life insurance.
We aim to provide a comprehensive range of innovative products and deliver exemplary service levels to our customers and corporate partners, providing a consistently high quality, fully integrated customer experience. We’ve been awarded Feefo’s top rating, the Trusted Merchant Gold Award, for our outstanding customer service.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our innovative team and lead key projects involving machine learning, time series forecasting and LLMs. You will have a solid mathematical foundation and proven experience in developing and deploying production-level code.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development, and implementation of data science models, responsible for designing and delivering technically complex Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) initiatives that produce significant business value
Utilize advanced techniques in machine learning, deep learning, and causal inference to drive business insights and optimize performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable data science solutions.
Develop production-level code using Python, ensuring scalability and integration with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Use SQL and ETL processes to manipulate and extract data from relational databases.
Communicate findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Provide mentorship to junior team members and contribute to the overall growth of the analytics team.
The Successful candidate:
Significant, demonstrable experience in data science or analytical roles
You will have a track record of achievement in data science, analysis, applied statistics or machine learning
Advanced Technical Skills: Expert-level knowledge of machine learning algorithms, model development, and deployment, with proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, R) and one database querying language (e.g., SQL). Experience with visualization tools like PowerBI is a plus.
Business Acumen: Strong ability to align technical solutions with business strategy, and to communicate complex findings to senior stakeholders
An academic background in statistics, mathematics, computer science, actuarial studies or similar is required
You will have experience working in a cloud (AWS / GCP / Azure) environment
You will have demonstrated clear and thorough logical and analytical thinking, as well as problem-solving skills and high attention to detail.
Project Management: Experience in managing large, complex projects or multiple concurrent projects, including setting timelines, deliverables, and navigating resourcing challenges
Why Join Us:
Work in a dynamic and innovative team driving real business impact.
Opportunities for professional growth and development in a leadership role.
Collaborative culture and cross-functional engagement with various teams and stakeholders.
Competitive salary and benefits.

Additional Information

Opportunities for professional growth and development in a leadership role.

Description and Requirements
About the HSECi team
MetLife is a leading global life insurer, and the insurance partner for Hostplus, one of Australia’s largest and fastest growing superannuation fund with over $100bn in assets and over 1.8 million members. MetLife have created a market-first service experience for Hostplus that delivers market-leading support and guidance for members for any insurance need they have, with a focus on first-point resolution and making sure the member’s needs are taken care of from beginning to end.

Summary of Responsibilities:

This role is essential for ensuring that the HSECi team utilizes data effectively to drive strategic decision-making, optimize operations, and enhance the overall member experience.

The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst is responsible for leveraging data to provide strategic insights and support decision-making processes across the HSECi team. This role involves analyzing large datasets, translating complex data into actionable insights, and developing predictive models and analytical tools to optimize operations and forecast customer behavior.

Principal Responsibilities:

Reporting and Dashboards:

Strong understanding of data modelling, particularly dimensional modelling (Kimball) enabling you to lead the design and build star schemas to support individual business units needs.
Understanding of SQL to support efficient coding standards.
Working in Information Delivery (ID) teams with experience using modern data platforms and tools such as Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, Matillion, Microsoft Power BI / Tableau, QlikView, Alteryx.
Developing dimensional data models to support BI and analytics solutions.
Design and develop comprehensive reports and interactive dashboards to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Ensure reports and dashboards are accurate, timely, and tailored to meet the needs of various stakeholders.

Data Analysis and Insights:

Analyze large datasets containing customer information, operational metrics, and other relevant data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Leverage data to provide strategic insights and support decision-making processes across HSECi.
Translate complex data into clear and concise insights and actionable recommendations.
Identify trends and patterns in insurance policyholder data and operational transaction data, providing actionable insights to support strategic decision-making and business planning.
Monitor the performance of insurance policies and operational processes against established targets and benchmarks, identifying areas for improvement and optimisation.

Predictive Modeling and Analytics:

Build and maintain predictive models, segmentation models, and other analytical tools to forecast customer behavior and inform strategic initiatives.
Continuously improve and refine models to enhance their accuracy and effectiveness.
Develop and maintain complex financial models built from primary and secondary data sources.

Collaboration and Communication:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams , including actuarial, underwriting, product, claims and marketing, to understand data requirements and deliver insights that drive business outcomes.
Communicate complex data findings and insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.

Data Governance and Quality Management:

Define and enforce data standards and governance to ensure data integrity, quality, and security.
Implement quality management frameworks to maintain high standards in data analysis and reporting.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest data analytics tools, techniques, and industry trends to ensure best practices are applied.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance data analysis and reporting capabilities.

Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Required:

Data Analysis: Expertise in analysing large datasets and identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Predictive Modeling: Proficiency in building and maintaining predictive models and other analytical tools.
Reporting and Visualization: Strong skills in designing and developing reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Analytical Skills: Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Communication: Exceptional communication skills to effectively convey data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in data analysis software and programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R.
Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to achieve business objectives.
Data Governance: Knowledge of data governance principles and practices to ensure data integrity and quality.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data analysis and reporting.
Strategic Thinking: Ability to leverage data to provide strategic insights and support decision-making processes.

Qualifications Required:

Essential
Certifications in data analysis or related fields
Desirable
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and predictive modeling.
Experience in the insurance or financial services industry..
..

Personal Attributes:
Positive, optimistic, warm, compassionate, confident, patient, calm, fair, honest, respectful of others, has integrity, open, resilient, strong talker and listener, hardworking, team player, leads by example, encourager, self-motivated, supports change in a positive way, owns their culture. Takes ownership and where needed, leadership
Benefits We Offer

When you join MetLife Australia, you are joining a company that demonstrates holistic care and wellbeing for employees with benefits and programs that address physical, mental, social and financial health. We offer life insurance benefits, generous paid parental leave, market leading menopause and fertility leave, car leasing and more. As well as Employee Assistance Program (EAP), access to 360Health medical support, volunteer leave and study assistance.

About MetLife
Recognised on Fortune magazine's list of the 2024 "World's Most Admired Companies", Fortune World’s 25 Best Workplaces™ for 2024, as well as the Diversity Council of Australia Inclusive Employer Award 2023-2024, MetLife, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. With operations in more than 40 markets, we hold leading positions in the United States, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.
Our purpose is simple - to help our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world at large create a more confident future. United by purpose and guided by empathy, we’re inspired to transform the next century in financial services. At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible. Join us!
