Job Description:
Head of Business Optimisation
Drive operational efficiency, process improvements, & innovation by leveraging data, analytics, automation, AI at icare.
Min 8yrs of experience in business process optimisation, automation/operational excellence.
Significant experience in building & operating Robotic factory at scale driving business benefits
Permanent Role| Sydney office| Hybrid working environment.

About the Role
The Head of Business Optimisation is responsible for driving operational efficiency, process improvements, and innovation by leveraging data, analytics, automation, and AI capability across the organisation. The role involves working with senior leaders to identify and develop business improvement strategy and roadmap, influencing them to re-imagining operations through a technology lens and leading execution of operational excellence initiatives. The role plays a pivotal role in bringing the combination of data-driven insights, automation technologies, and AI to transform business processes and build a scaled and sustainable model for business operation.
Benefits

A corporate wellbeing program with subsidised gym membership, free flu vaccinations and health check programs
17.5% annual leave loading
Comprehensive learning and development support aligned to icare’s Core Capabilities.
Our People Awards - On-the-spot Recognition, Quarterly Values Awards & Our People Annual Awards
Access to our Employee Assistance Program
Duties
It’s an exciting time at icare where no two days are the same: as Head of Business Optimisation, you will:
Thought lead the development of business process optimisation strategy and roadmap to drive operational excellence and improvement in service delivery efficiency and productivity across icare’s business operation
Collaborate and influence icare’s senior leadership team through to board in understanding and driving operational excellence and building a lean and simplified business operations
Own the delivery of cost reduction, operational efficiency and service improvement across all business process optimisation initiatives
Though lead discussion with leaders to shape the strategic initiatives in the business process optimisation domain, be able to shift mindset from building bots to simplifying and optimising service delivery via digital technology and AI
Develop service catalogue and play book to drive process excellence, process re-engineering, business process optimisation
Lead the use of Lean-six sigma methods and process data insights to improve end-to-end processes
Work with senior leaders to develop KPIs to measure business processes
Lead the development of process data collection, process mining and analysis, development of analytical methods to re-engineer business processes
Develop service catalogue, measurement systems and KPIs that supports the identification of process bottlenecks and lead optimisation team in delivering sustainable and measurable financial and operational benefits
Oversee the architecture, design and implementation of Robotics automation tool including integration with other systems and data platforms ensuring the bots remain performant, compliant and adheres to all risk and control frameworks
Setup and operate Robotics operations and ensure icare remains compliant with all internal and external policies (e.g. security, IT)
Collaborate with data teams to harness data insights that drive operational improvements and enhance decision-making capabilities.
Develop and implement performance metrics, KPIs, and reporting mechanisms to measure the impact of optimization efforts.
Lead the capture of business process mapping and mining tools to analyse existing process, identifying bottlenecks and improvement areas.
Oversee workshops and meetings to promote collaborative approach to process improvement and engage employees in the change process
Champion change management efforts to ensure successful adoption of optimisation initiatives across the organization.
Communicate the value and impact of optimization efforts to senior leadership, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives and strategic goals.
Actively build team capability through driving proactive training, hiring and team skill management
Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement by regularly reviewing processes and outcomes, making adjustments to ensure ongoing efficiency gains
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, ensuring the team is equipped with cutting-edge tools and practices by forecasting future needs for technology, infrastructure, and personnel to scale business optimisation capabilities
Foster collaboration between the data platform, data science and business optimisation team to ensure cohesive delivery of icare’s data, analytics and AI transformational strategy

Your story so far:
Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in business process optimisation, automation, or operational excellence roles.
Ability to influence senior leaders and thought lead business process transformation and ensure sustainable and measurable benefits delivery.
Proven experience in driving business transformations using lean-six sigma methodology and robotics process automation.
Strong track record in leading optimisation projects that resulted in measurable improvements in efficiency, cost reduction, or performance.
Good understanding of IT, architecture, Robotics automation platforms and tools.
Significant experience in building and operating Robotic factory at scale driving business benefits
Have the capability to lead, manage and motivate teams and build a high-performance culture
Strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to influence strategic decision within the organisation
High-level business acumen with experience in leading business process optimisation teams
Ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels
Proven project management experience needed to drive transformation and manage multi-project, multi-team delivery model.
Deep knowledge of process automation tools.
Strong understanding of process mining, and operational excellence and how to use data to drive business improvements.
Excellent project management, leadership, and change management skills.
Ability to work cross-functionally and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on delivering practical, data-driven solutions.
Pre-Employment Checks

Culture
We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and would encourage people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We are committed to our people’s development so the people of NSW can thrive.
About the Company
We care for the people of NSW, building confidence and trust so our communities can thrive. We make the complex simple, so our schemes deliver better outcomes for people and communities. Whether a person is severely injured in the workplace or on our roads, icare supports their long-term care needs to improve quality of life, including helping people return to work.

Job Title: VIE - Finance Business Analyst - Chandon Australia
Job Description:
Position
CHANDON is LVMH’s sparkling-wine Maison, founded in 1959 by Robert-Jean de Vogüé, a pioneer with the vision, courage and drive to redefine the category and craft exceptional sparkling wines in unexpected lands.
At CHANDON, we stand for our values of diversity and inclusion, courage and collaboration within our cross-cultural community. We are proud to be the Sparkling Wine Maison of the LVMH Group, with wineries in Argentina, Brazil, California, Australia, China and India, the sun never sets on CHANDON.
Job responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Finance Analyst (VIE) to join our dynamic team. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute across the business, from strategic planning and budgeting to data analysis and business development support. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a proactive mindset, a positive attitude, and a passion for leveraging data to drive business decisions.
Mission statement:
Strategic Planning & Budgeting:
Support the forecasting cycle (Budget, LEs, R&Os).
Prepare templates, consolidate data, and assist budget owners in preparing forecasts.
Prepare detailed budgets for key expenditure areas (T&E, insurance, H&S, electricity).
Financial Closing Process:
Support periodic financial closing activities, including journal entries, accruals, and intercompany recharges.
Reconcile general ledger accounts (e.g., debtors, creditors, accruals, leases).
Master Data & Data Visualization:
Manage master data for the POS system.
Support data-centricity projects, including defining data models, developing visualization tools (e.g., Power BI), and deriving data-driven insights.
Reporting & Analysis:
Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports and analyses (DTC reporting, A&P spend, OPEX variance analysis, sales forecasts, etc.).
Ensure data integrity through reconciliation checks between different sources (ERP, reports).
Support business partners with analytical coding inquiries.
Contribute to cost containment efforts during the landing process.
Business Development Data Insights:
Analyze consumer and business trends using scan data to provide actionable insights.
Report on A&P expenditure and ROI for key initiatives.
Business Development Support :
Support the DTC team with pricing, cost/revenue modeling, and offer development.
Optimize B2B sales processes and private event sales systems.
Provide support for accounts receivable and analysis related to digital engagement and sales.
Profile
Education:
University or Business School graduate in Finance
Languages:
Fluent English
Professional experience & know how:
A first experience in a business analysis role is appreciated
Excellent analytical skills
A taste for improving processes and tools
Excellent Excel skills (most files have macros)
Knowledge of Hyperion Essbase a plus
Data visualization skills (Power BI)
Interest in data science (beneficial)
Additional information
Location : Australia, Greater Melbourne area, Coldstream, Yarra Valley, Victoria
Start Date : February 2025
Duration: 12 months to 24 months.
Domaine Chandon Australia is proud to celebrate our differences and communities. Our priority is to attract, support and retain individuals- irrespective of gender, age, religion and sexual orientation.
CHANDON INDIA
MAISON
Nashik, in the Western Ghats mountain range, is where you’ll find the youngest Chandon sibling.
India is our wild card and our latest new frontier.
In 2010, Tony Jordan, Chef winemaker at Chandon Australia set off to learn about India’s emerging viticultural regions, from Bangalore in the south to Himachal Pradesh in the north. India has no long wine tradition, no terroirs with centuries of form. Its climate is tropical, with fierce summers and torrential monsoon rains.
Tony Jordan finally homed in on a terroir around Dindori, Nashik, 200km northeast of Mumbai. The first grapes – Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay and Pinot Noir – were bought in February 2011 and vinified in rented equipment and tanks at a local winery. Chandon India was officially launched with the release of the first cuvées in January 2014, and our winery was opened in April 2016.

Job Description:
About Working at Akkadian Systems
Akkadian Systems is a software consultancy with a focus on enterprise systems, data driven applications and full stack web applications. This will involve working in a team with strong collaboration using modern Agile development methodologies, with strong testing and DevOps principles.
This role requires a willingness to work closely with external client technical resources and SMEs to leverage their knowledge to collaborate on solving problems.
DevOps and Software Engineer - AWS/Python
This position will be predominantly focused on collaborating with developer and infrastructure teams, both in-house and client side, to create, upgrade and maintain cloud infrastructure and CI/CD solutions.
As a consultancy, Akkadian Systems has clients with diverse system, operational and governance requirements, so flexibility in solving problems within enterprise parameters is critical.

Description & Requirements
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Sales Director to lead our hospitality solutions business in Australia. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the hospitality industry and technology, a proven track record of driving revenue growth, and laser-focused on customer service.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base in the hospitality sector.
Working with a team of sales professionals, providing guidance and support to achieve individual and team goals.
Identify and pursue new business opportunities, including partnerships and collaborations with key industry stakeholders.
Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to inform sales strategies and identify growth opportunities.
Collaborate with the marketing and product development teams to ensure alignment of sales efforts with overall business objectives.
Prepare and present sales reports, forecasts, and performance metrics to senior management.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Hospitality Management, or a related field. MBA is a plus.
Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in sales, with at least 5 years in a leadership role within the hospitality industry.
Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
Strong understanding of hospitality solutions, including property management systems, guest experience platforms, revenue management, and other related technologies.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events.



About Infor

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com

Our Values

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.

Job Title: Enterprise Services Manager, AWS Professional Services
Company Name: Amazon Web Services Australia Pty Ltd
Job Description:
7+ years of technical specialist, design and architecture experience
10+ years of consulting, design and implementation of serverless distributed solutions experience
5+ years of cloud based solution (AWS or equivalent), system, network and operating system experience
10+ years of external or internal customer facing, complex and large scale project management experience
Bachelor's degree, or 7+ years of professional or military experience
Are you a seasoned customer-facing leader with a passion for driving cloud transformation? Do you have a proven track record of delivering complex professional services engagements that enable enterprise-scale customers to achieve their business objectives using AWS?

As an Enterprise Service Manager at AWS Professional Services, you'll have the opportunity to work closely with some of ANZ's most innovative organizations, serving as a trusted strategic partner and advisor. In this role, you'll be responsible for orchestrating cross-functional teams to design and implement comprehensive cloud adoption, modernization, and optimization solutions that drive measurable business impact and sustainable growth for our customers. By deeply understanding each customers unique challenges, business goals, and evolving technical requirements, you'll develop customer plans that unlock new sources of value and improved end customer experiences using the breadth of AWS services.

If you're passionate about the cloud, thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, and are excited by the prospect of empowering enterprises to innovate and transform their businesses on AWS, we want to hear from you. Apply today to join our elite team of cloud experts as an Enterprise Service Manager.

Key job responsibilities
Serve as the primary point of contact and strategic partner for a portfolio of enterprise-level customers, building strong relationships and understanding their unique business and technical requirements.
Act as an evangelist for the full portfolio of AWS platform capabilities and services and guide customers along the journey of cloud adoption and digital transformation to accelerate their business goals
Prepare and present strategic proposals to customer C-Suite executives and create commercial agreements and Statements of Work (SOWs)
Actively identify and pursue new professional services opportunities within your customer portfolio, contributing to the achievement of team and individual sales quotas and revenue targets
Orchestrate cross-functional teams of AWS technical specialists, solution architects, and project managers to deliver complex, multi-workstream engagements
Assist in the development of new service offerings and go-to-market strategies based on customer and market feedback
Stay up-to-date on the AWS service roadmap, new product launches, and emerging cloud trends to advise customers on strategic technology decisions
About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Bachelor's degree in business administration, finance, economics, computer science, data science, engineering, or other related field
Acknowledgement of country:
In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

IDE statement:
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected attributes.

Region: NSW- Sydney CBD, VIC- Melbourne CBD
Head of Deposit Portfolio Growth – Melbourne or Sydney based.
We’re leveraging our size to do positive things for customers.
Showcase your market presence and industry expertise to drive the success of this portfolio.
We win in the right way, which is always putting our customers first.
As the Head of Deposit Portfolio Growth, you will lead a broad cross-functional team to identify untapped household deposit opportunities in NAB’s back book. You will work closely with our data and analytics teams, marketing, distribution and product to identify these opportunities and define the approach to winning them.
As the Head of Deposit Portfolio Growth, you will
Defining the strategy and roadmap to realise untapped
household deposit opportunities in NAB’s back book.
Set up and lead a cross functional squad to systematically identify untapped household deposit opportunities.
Work across the value chain (distribution, marketing, data, change, product and pricing) define the strategy, roadmap and dependencies for realising these household deposit opportunities.
In conjunction with distribution and the Domains, deliver the untapped opportunities and associated performance reporting.
Drive a customer-obsessed culture, creating deposit propositions for target segments that delight customers.
Prioritise scope items for delivery in the roadmap.
Define success measures and report on performance.
Coach, develop and mentor members of your team.

10+ years' experience within Banking/Financial and/or Wealth services, with a focus on deposits and everyday banking, strategic planning and execution.
Strong stakeholder management skills across all levels of the organisation.
Business related degree and/or post-graduate professional qualification is preferred.
Analytics/Data Science background will be highly regarded.
A diverse and inclusive workplace works better for everyone

Job Description:
Product Owner - Customer
Job No.: 997097
Location: Melbourne - CBD & Inner
Job type: Full-Time
Country Road Group (CRG) is embarking on transformation to position itself for growth, leveraging our scale, capabilities and culture as a House of Brands. We are investing in new and existing capabilities and have a number of exciting opportunities available.
The Product Owner – Customer is responsible for overseeing the development and optimisation of Country Road Group’s marketing automation, loyalty programs, and customer identity resolution strategies. This role manages the Braze marketing automation platform, the Antavo loyalty platform, and will lead future identity resolution initiatives to improve personalised marketing, customer loyalty, and cross-channel consistency.
As the key owner of these systems, the Product Owner ensures that these technologies work seamlessly together to deliver targeted, personalised customer experiences that drive engagement, retention, and loyalty. The role involves close collaboration with marketing, data, analytics, IT, and other product teams to ensure that all customer-facing initiatives are data-driven and aligned with business objectives.
Key Accountabilities
Own the strategic roadmap and day-to-day management of Braze, ensuring the platform is optimised to support personalised and automated marketing campaigns.
Develop and implement marketing automation strategies that leverage customer data to deliver highly targeted and personalised messaging across channels (email, mobile, push notifications, etc.).
Oversee the development and optimisation of the Antavo loyalty platform, ensuring it supports customer retention and drives increased engagement through targeted rewards and loyalty initiatives.
Collaborate with the Product Owner – Engagement to align marketing automation with broader engagement and personalisation strategies.
Lead the implementation of new loyalty program features and enhancements, ensuring the platform evolves with customer needs and business goals.
Lead the strategy and implementation of identity resolution capabilities to ensure a unified, 360-degree view of the customer across all channels and touchpoints.
Manage and support the Business Analyst: Customer, who is responsible for running the experimentation stream for the loyalty program, including A/B testing and test-and-learn strategies to optimise customer engagement.
Key Capabilities
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
Certification in Product Management, Agile, or relevant project management methodologies is advantageous.
Professional membership in recognised industry bodies
Experience in a product owner or product management role, ideally within marketing automation, loyalty platforms, or customer data environments.
Proven experience managing marketing automation platforms like Braze, with a strong focus on building and optimising automated customer journeys.
Experience working with loyalty platforms (e.g., Antavo) to develop and optimise loyalty programs that drive customer retention and engagement.
Expertise in marketing automation platforms (e.g., Braze), with experience in building automated workflows and customer journeys.
Proficiency in loyalty platforms (e.g., Antavo), with knowledge of loyalty program design, management, and optimisation.
Strong understanding of identity resolution techniques and platforms, with experience in managing customer identity across multiple touchpoints.
Why work for CRG?
The Country Road Group is one of Australasia’s largest Lifestyle Brand Houses comprising of iconic brands such as Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Here are some of the great things we offer:
Generous employee discounts across our House of Brands
Seasonal clothing allowance
An additional day of leave for your birthday
An Industry leading Parental Leave Program
Flexible working arrangements to support work/life balance
Annual learning calendar to support the ongoing development of our team
Support community partnerships across our Corporate Social Responsibility Program
We are committed to operating ethically, sustainably, and responsibly.
Country Road Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.

Country Road Group prefers to manage all sourcing directly, please submit your applications to this role if you are interested. Please note introductions via agency will not be accepted.

Closing date: 26 Dec 2024 for applications

Job Description:
Description entreprise :
CLS, a subsidiary of CNES (the French spatial agency) and CNP (a Belgian investment fund), is an international company at the heart of the planet's challenges, and a pioneer in the provision of Earth observation and monitoring solutions.
Since 1986, CLS has operated the Argos satellite constellation, with more than 900 employees in 30 countries and an annual turnover of more than 150 million euros. CLS is a global leader in satellite services combining advanced space technologies with software engineering and data-science.
Would you like to join an agile and dynamic team on innovative and ambitious projects? Explore new technologies? Work on a variety of cross-functional projects in all five of CLS's business areas?
As a world leader in sustainable fisheries, CLS has driven industry change with innovative solutions and transformed the way that we manage our planet’s resources.
We believe in equitable fisheries; where fishermen, administrations and international organizations collaborate to ensure a sustainable future for our planet’s resources.
With our global experience (28 offices on 5 continents) and local presence (over 40 distributors, in all ocean basins), we understand our clients' needs and are ready and available.
The Sustainable Fisheries Management BU deploys its solutions in the following areas
Vessel Monitoring Systems (VMS), electronic logbooks, control centers
The fight against illegal, unreported, and unregulated fishing
Supporting artisanal fishing
Supporting industrial fishing operations
Description du poste :
Based within the "Solutions and Innovations" Team of the Sustainable Management of Fisheries Business Unit, the Fisheries Expertise team maps data of interest to various fisheries stakeholders (fishing authorities, industrial fishing vessels, artisanal fishermen, fisheries researchers, etc.). These exclusives data are made available to our industrial fishing customers through our fishing software CATSAT.
Within the framework of your functions, your main responsibilities will consist of:
Doing fishing recommendations each day for our customers (mainly tuna purse-seiners and industrial longliners)
Presenting our solutions to fishermen and training them on how to use our solutions in their daily work routine
Supporting their activity by answering any question related to our core expertise, the oceanography
During your first six months, you will be based in Toulouse (south of France). After this training period, you will be based in one of our subsidiaries either in Indonesia or Australia.
Profil recherché :
You have a master's degree in fisheries, or oceanography, and have proven experience in one of these fields.
Passionate about fisheries, curious and creative, you're keen to imagine tomorrow's solutions to the environmental and economic challenges facing the fishing industry.
Educationalist and able to share knowledge through trainings.
Fluency in English is required.
Fluency in either simplified Chinese or Korean is also required.

Your dynamism, rigor and method, autonomy, capacity for innovation and adaptation, and affinity for teamwork will be the assets for success in this position.
We are looking for enthusiastic, passionate, and curious people to join our teams. Open-mindedness, interpersonal skills, flexibility, autonomy, and analytical skills are expected.
Finally, if you have team spirit, the ability to meet deadlines, and flawless motivation, don’t hesitate to join us!!
Do you like challenges? Come and join the adventure.

Avantages :

Full time, Melbourne inner suburbs.
Access to public transport – the office is located 2 minutes from metro train station.
Probationary period of 6 months.

Job Description:
About us
Indicia Worldwide is an insight and technology-led communications agency with global production expertise.
Why we exist: we create new value
At Indicia Worldwide, our philosophy is one of ‘creating new value’. We create new value at every step of the journey that a brand takes to market, by driving an increase in marketing performance and reducing costs in marketing execution. For our clients and their customers, we are building mutually-beneficial partnerships. We see this proposition, built around the perfect balance of efficiency and effectiveness, as pioneering, entrepreneurial and, above all else, sustainable.
Our substantial investment in our technology and data science capability, and resource, provide our differentiation in the marketplace. Data insight and marketing technology allow us to measure our work, evidencing ROI as the most critical metric in today’s environment.
We see ROI where others don't. We are the only agency that combines creative, data and technology talent with production and procurement expertise to improve your marketing performance and efficiencies. We realise ROI for our clients by enabling them to deliver more engaging, cost-effective and sustainable customer experiences.
As a business we draw on a rich heritage from the worlds of print, creative production, retail, data, digital, tech and creative, bringing these disciplines together to support global brands with their omnichannel marketing activation needs.
We believe in what we do. We believe this proposition makes us unique. We have the capacity to redefine the way marketing is activated for our clients across the globe. Now, and well into the future.
The output: Improved client performance by engaging consumers with brand ideas better, faster and more cost-effectively, across every step of a brand's journey to market.

Purpose of the role
As an Account Director (AD), you will support and drive growth of the assigned accounts through balancing day to day operational support and leadership to the teams with a strategic approach to the client in order to enhance our service offering and overall performance.
Vision: The Account Director takes the lead in establishing and nurturing strategic client relationships/engagement across all their brands/markets
Mission: To activate the proposition of Indicia Worldwide through clients ensuring the best customer service, quality and value in line with our clients´ needs.
Approach: To establish excellence in client services and account management through our values - Collaborative, Entrepreneurial, Pioneering and Accountable
You will contribute to the strategic direction and growth of Indicia Worldwide proposition and will work with your teams and the rest of Client Services teams on client development activities and strategies. You will have a commercial focus and you will work closely with the Business Director/Client Partner/Managing Partner to ensure the contribution to forecasting and the accuracy of the budgeting process. You will also be able to support the strategic framework to secure additional work independently based on current services and work closely with the senior management to educate clients on the value of the entire Indicia proposition.

You will have accountability for your team´s accuracy, quality, timeliness and profitability of multiple campaigns and projects by coaching and training your direct reports (and any more junior Client Services individuals) on how to manage the briefing, scheduling and delivery process on behalf of the client. You will be expected to help your team to identify opportunities for growth and share them with your Business Director and/or Client Partner.
You will be leading by example in delivering Client Services excellence through the lens of our CAPE values. It is expected for the AD to also work collaboratively and constructively with our expert teams to ensure that our work is of the highest quality and that we harness all the expertise in our business to identify opportunities and offer solutions for our clients. You will be a brand ambassador and will enhance collaborative work between your team and the discipline experts. You will always take a cross-company view and you will demonstrate the ability to see the big picture.
Relationship Management
Develop strong global and local client relationships acting as a ‘go-to’ person and be seen as a trusted partner
Take responsibility for the client relationship and help them define the strategic direction of their marketing plans
Represent Indicia CAPE values and lead by example in ensuring that their direct team are also developing strong relationships with their client stakeholders and provide support whenever needed
Drive engagement through consistent and meaningful data driven interactions with the client
Address any issues immediately to ensure a mutually acceptable resolution and be responsible for ensuring that the delivery process runs smoothly, and all outputs are delivered to a high quality, on time and on budget
Support the Business Director/ Client Partner/ Managing Partner in ensuring appropriate resourcing to the account, building business cases to support staffing decision making and help address resource priorities
Support and facilitate development of the teams according to the feedback provided by the client and internal stakeholders
Lead by example, act as a mentor and embed the company’s values
Growth
Proactively develop and implement initiatives to expand Indicia Worldwide’s offering to the client while ensuring that the direction of all the work and deliverables reflect the client´s mission
Understand the client's industry sector, market position, company objectives, audience insights and use it to identify and drive forward opportunities client proposals & increased scope
Identify successors and ensure a plan is in place for short-, mid- and long-term succession
Build and facilitate such environment where the team feels empowered and engaged to thrive and deliver the company’s strategy
Ensure a balanced management for growth and client management to develop relationships
Lead QPMs, work closely with CP to create Client Development Plans and annual budget setting
Communication
Ensure that the team have a relevant and reliable flow of information on Indicia Worldwide’s capabilities, relevant client updates and internal ways of working
Communicate effectively with all relevant stakeholders – team & SMEs, client and senior leadership as well as any other support function in the business
Financial Accuracy and Analytical Skills
Ensure sound financial management and profitability of the assigned account
Deliver growth within the accounts for existing and new business and delivering increased profitability through a solid cost management
Ensure reliability of the forecasting process, taking full ownership of the financial process and promoting accountability within the team
Support the Business Director, Client Partner and Chief Client Officer in the yearly budgeting process
Strategic Thinking, Direction and Planning
Support the BD, CP and the CCO in bringing Indicia Worldwide´s vision and goals to life, by providing meaningful insights and relevant direction to ensure we are able to respond to all the needs of the client
Present, consult and discuss with clients independently regarding potential new opportunities or areas where Indicia could add further values and to seek support from your Business Director, Client Partner or other Subject Matter Experts whenever needed
Customer Focus
Leverage all aspects of the client’s relationship and utilise knowledge to have maximum impact on the client’s business
Build and deliver clients ‘quarterly business reviews’ including optimisation plans and proactive initiatives
Negotiation Skills
Diplomatically manage client and team conversations to find mutually beneficial outcomes, be it in terms of savings, value engineering, quality, design, strategy, etc…
Campaign Management
Support your team in the delivery of campaigns and projects by providing them with the right insights, tools and leadership style

Skills, knowledge, experience and exposure
Significant background in Account Management, ideally coming with an Account Director background from an integrated marketing communications agency, and/or Account Management teams leadership experience
Demonstrated high level of exposure to multisector and international environments and ability to effectively liaise with both internal and external stakeholders
Relevant experience in the marketing/client management industry: including Media, Technology, Retail,, FMCG and/or beverage
Relevant experience in an Agency environment is key
POSM/Print technical requirement
Full understanding of entire end-to-end marketing process, from client strategic requirement to deliver cross-channels
Clear passion for excellence in delivery drawing on experience to provide best in class briefs and exceed client expectations
Evidence of strategic and critical thinking to lead performance driven marketing programmes
Experience in managing client profitability, targets and generating income
Proven experience in developing and maintaining excellent inter-departmental working relationships and practices with internal teams
Proven ability to delegate and oversee multiple projects ensuring consistent delivery on time and budget
POSM Design, Production & Execution
Experience in ensuring major POSM campaigns are executed to the highest standards whilst achieving our collective KPIs
A clear knowledge of what is the latest and most advanced types of POSM, from print to digital
Full understanding of the entire end-to-end marketing process from client strategic requirements to delivery cross-channels
Data Experience (non-Data team)
Experience in working alongside data teams (analysts, data scientists) to deliver their role
A foundational understanding of key concepts, statistics, machine learning, databases, APIs
Understands where and when to leverage data. Understands which SME to engage depending on topic
Creative Experience
Experience in working within or with a creative agency
Deliver outstanding creative solutions - unique, single-minded and effective
Understand the needs of the client and ensure these are fully met by all the internal agency departments (Strategy, Creative, Design, Production)
Tech Experience (non-tech team)
Understanding of organization technologies available and how to use key systems
Ability in sourcing/capturing problem statement/client objectives
Pre-empts/identifies opportunities for technology

The mindset to navigate the role
Indicia Worldwide’s values (Collaborative, Accountable, Pioneering and Entrepreneurial) are the foundations of our culture and ways of thinking in the Company and everyone is expected to behave according to those principles, that shape a high performing environment.
The Account Director has the ability to strike balance between the immediate client management needs and the mid to long term growth opportunities. Continuous Improvement is at the heart of what they do and approaches every conflict and challenge as an opportunity to learn and improve, keeping always a solutions-focused approach and with a strong focus on development (self and others).
The Account Director is a ONE Indicia ambassador and is ready to activate plans to reach targets autonomously, keeping the relevant senior stakeholders engaged throughout the process and in a collaborative way, ensuring alignment between the client’s needs and Indicia Worldwide. At the same time, they hold a holistic understanding of Indicia Worldwide’s value proposition and offer and are ready to act as a first point of contact for the relevant senior client stakeholders.
They will be entrepreneurial and pioneering through creating the opportunity with the client to start conversations about growth and new services. They will also be able to keep a long-term view and manage pressure of the client and leadership, driving a culture that empowers their team members and facilitates accountability.
The Account Director is a people centered leader and will make their team a priority, finding always time to have meaningful interactions, quality time through 1:1’s and building a trusted relationship by providing and gathering feedback on a regular basis. They will proactively provide support to their teams and will feel accountable for the development of their direct teams.

Temperament for the role
The Account Director will have strong leadership and coaching skills, with a visible strength in active listening and will also perform with a high degree of resilience and ability to maintain a long-term view when facing immediate challenges, supporting a constructive and smooth resolution of issues. They will also be creative, positive, flexible and pioneering when providing solutions to challenges.
They will be capable of always keeping a respectful, constructive and intelligent communication style and will be great at conflict management skills, such as displaying patience, practicing empathy or keeping a positive attitude.
The Account Director will also show a high level of prioritisation skills and will be effective in delegating and managing workload through the team.

Role Requirements
The Account Director will be expected to spend a significant amount of their time on client interactions, with a preference to have them face to face, meaning that significant travel could be expected within the regional scope. Attendance to internal business meetings may result as well in travelling internationally.
The Account Director will be expected to deal with high level of complexity tasks and challenges with autonomy and ensuring alignment with company's strategy and directives.
They will be expected to perform in a flexible environment but ensuring delivery. In exceptional circumstances, overtime may be required to match client or internal deadlines.
The Account Director will be required to work regularly from the Client's office(s) and attend Indicia Worldwide's offices when needed. Some international travel will be required depending on client.

We are an equal opportunities employer and as such, will make any reasonable adjustments to accommodate the needs of all candidates. If you have any such needs or requirements in the context of your interview, please notify us so that we can make the appropriate arrangements.

Job Description:
Location: Canberra

Contract Type: Permanent
MinterEllison is one of Australia’s largest law firms, with nearly 200 years of business history. We're known for our legal and consulting expertise - and for our inclusive and authentic character.

Our purpose is to create sustainable value with our clients, people and communities. That means we have a proud history of providing excellence to clients, nurturing our people and giving back to the communities in which we live and work.

We value excellence, curiosity and collaboration. Clients rely on us for our responsive, commercial approach. Our clients include government departments and agencies, private and publicly listed companies, and small and large businesses in Australia and overseas.


MinterEllison's Consulting Services are leading strategic advisors ready to design, develop and operationalise with clients. Businesses need integrated capabilities to solve complex organisational problems. At MinterEllison, we've brought together an unmatched team of experts under one roof with deep industry knowledge and commercial experience who are focused on designing, developing and operationalising solutions in the service areas of Technology, Cyber Security, Risk & Regulatory, Legal Optimisation, Education and ESG.

As a highly valued employee we will also provide you with a wide range of benefits. To view our benefits, please copy this link into your browser www.minterellison.com/-/media//Minter-Ellison/Files/Careers/MinterEllison-Employee-Benefits-2024.ashx

More About You

We are currently looking for an experienced IT Financial and Pricing Analyst including Financial Management Consultants, with experience in technology, to assist our clients make smart decisions as they analyse, plan and optimise technology spend to support the growing economic and risk challenges.

We welcome applications from Senior Consultant to Manager level candidates who have demonstratable experience in:

Conducting pricing analysis, developing complex pricing models and advising on pricing best practice, including scenario modelling.
Financial modelling and consulting on the end-to-end costing of ICT projects and systems implementation.
Pricing analysis and normalisation of large complex supplier responses, forming inputs into evaluation and negotiations. Providing strategic financial advice to our clients on their return of value from an IT investment, including the establishment of benefits tracking practices.
Partnering with teams on budgeting, forecasting and market comparisons.
Reviewing the total cost of ICT and undertaking robust analysis to identify optimisation opportunities, in line with standard industry frameworks such as TBM.
Assuring financial cost and forecast models
Financial process re-design and automation

Professional background

At least 3 years’ experience working in a consulting environment or technology supplier focusing on financial management, commercial modelling and business analysis.
A deep understanding of technology finance and pricing mechanisms.

Skills

Advanced Excel modelling (including Power Query) and Power Point skills.
Attention to detail and time management.
Superior communication skills.
Ability to present large volumes of data to senior stakeholders
Data visualisation using tools such as Power BI

Qualifications

CA or CPA qualifications are highly desirable.
Undergraduate degree, within the following disciplines: Finance, Business Management / Commerce, Information Technology, Actuarial / Statistics, Computer / Data Science or Engineering.
Must hold Australian Citizenship and be able to obtain an Australian Government Security Clearance.

Why MinterEllison

We offer flexible working options to encourage balance, wellbeing and support for sustainable ways of working and a range of social, financial and health benefits, including free gym membership - all with no minimum tenure.

We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities, cultural backgrounds, genders (including trans or gender diverse), LGBTQ+ people and those with carer responsibilities. We particularly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.

How to apply

We prefer to connect with people directly, so please submit your CV by clicking on the 'Apply' button. We encourage all applications, including if you do not meet the criteria listed for the role. Your application will also enable us to consider you for other opportunities that may be available at MinterEllison.

If you are currently a MinterEllison employee, please apply through the internal careers page.

If you would like further information, require any adjustments throughout the recruitment process or for a confidential discussion, please contact Alexandra.Hussain@minterellison.com.

Job Description:
About Bjak
Bjak is focused on providing access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance portal in Southeast Asia. Our main portal, Bjak.com, helps millions find the insurance policy with the best value and highest coverage for them. Using technology, our team's core strengths are in problem solving and navigating the most complex regulations and environments, creating some of the most innovative products in the world. Our investments in technology such as Custom API, blockchain, trading systems and data science is to enable easy access to financial services that were previously inaccessible or difficult to understand.

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Solana Rust Developer to join our team, working on a cutting-edge stablecoin project. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining blockchain-based solutions that ensure stability, security, and scalability for our stablecoin ecosystem. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of blockchain and financial technology, contributing to the future of digital currencies.
Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and deploy smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps) to power our stablecoin infrastructure.
Build and maintain secure, efficient, and scalable blockchain solutions focused on stablecoin functionality.
Implement and manage smart contracts that ensure the stablecoin's price stability, including algorithms for collateral management and reserve protocols.
Collaborate with the product, finance, and compliance teams to integrate the stablecoin into financial ecosystems and payment networks.
Conduct thorough testing and audits of smart contracts to ensure security and compliance.
Develop tools and APIs to integrate the stablecoin with various decentralized and centralized platforms.
Research and implement emerging technologies and protocols in the stablecoin and DeFi space.
Optimize blockchain transaction speeds, minimize gas fees, and improve the user experience.
Monitor and enhance the security of the stablecoin network, including risk mitigation and incident response.
Participate in code reviews, contribute to architectural decisions, and mentor junior developers.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Extensive experience as a Software Engineer with a strong focus on blockchain technologies.
Deep expertise in blockchain platforms such as Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, or Layer 2 solutions.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Solidity or Rust.
Hands-on experience with Cairo for Starknet, Ton, or similar platforms.
Proven track record in smart contract development, testing, and deployment, particularly for stablecoin or DeFi projects.
In-depth knowledge of consensus algorithms, cryptography, and decentralized finance (DeFi) principles.
Experience with blockchain scaling techniques, including Layer 2 solutions and sidechains.
Strong understanding of economic models behind stablecoins, including both collateralized and algorithmic designs.
Familiarity with security best practices in smart contract development and blockchain systems.
Practical experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD tools.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with or developing stablecoin projects.
Knowledge of regulatory frameworks surrounding digital assets and stablecoins.
Familiarity with on-chain/off-chain oracles, liquidity pools, and cross-chain solutions.
Experience with decentralized governance models.
Contributions to open-source blockchain projects.
Benefits
Remote work
Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry!
Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
Attractive remuneration and performance incentives
Strong learning and development plans for your career growth
International work environment and flat organization
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours & arrangement

Job Description:
Employment Opportunity:
Postdoctoral Research Fellow or Senior Postdoctoral Research Fellow funded by the Snow Medical Research Foundation

Postdoctoral Research Fellow (Research Officer) or Senior Postdoctoral Research Fellow (Senior Research Officer) positions are available to join Snow Medical laboratories at leading Australian institutes in Sydney and Canberra.

About the Position

Opportunities are available for outstanding and motivated scientists funded by Snow Medical. As a Snow Postdoctoral Researcher, you will be part of an exceptional research team in the lab of a Snow Medical Research Foundation Fellow based at a leading Australian biomedical research institute (https://www.snowmedical.org.au/snow-fellowship/our-snow-fellows). You will be part of a unique network, have the opportunity to lead significant projects, and develop new skills in a supportive environment with a strong emphasis on scientific excellence and a focus on impactful questions.

Snow Postdoctoral Researchers (https://www.snowmedical.org.au/snow-fellowship/snow-postdoc-careers) will receive a competitive salary/package and investment into their leadership and professional development. Snow Postdoctoral Researchers are expected to show scientific leadership within the themes of the host laboratory and may be provided with the opportunity to manage a small team, depending on experience. The program will support career development through mentoring and leadership training, and provide networking opportunities.

Snow Postdoctoral Researchers will also be eligible and encouraged to participate in short-term placements in other Snow Fellow laboratories to gain expertise in new techniques, bring additional skills to the host laboratory or institution, and broaden their network.
We will provide:
A 2-3 year contract (with the possibility for longer-term employment)
Travel funds to attend international and/or national conferences
Relocation funds
Access to state-of-the-art facilities
Competitive salaries and additional entitlements
Mentoring and career development opportunities, including:
Postdoc leadership training
Opportunities for placements/collaborations with other Snow Fellows across Australia
Snow Fellow and Snow Postdoc meetings
Grant and fellowship writing support

Positions are available in the following lab :

Genetics and Epigenetics, Systems biology (experimental & computational)
Regulatory Systems Lab, Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute, Sydney
A/Prof Emily Wong, e.wong@victorchang.edu.au

What we are looking for:

We want to support postdoctoral researchers with the most potential to benefit.

A PhD in a relevant discipline for the appropriate Snow Medical laboratory, such as Biochemistry, Molecular and Cell Biology, Genomics, Computational Genomics, Functional Genomics, Epigenetics, Transcriptional Regulation, or Immunology.
Outstanding publication track record, with demonstrated ability to lead projects to completion
Expertise in methods and approaches relevant to specific Snow Medical programs, for example, spatial transcriptomics, comparative genomics, functional genomics, genetics and epigenetics, bulk & single-cell multi-omics, immunology, ioinformatics, quantitative and systems biology, developmental biology, and data science.
Excellent time management, communication (written and oral), and interpersonal skills.

How to apply:
To apply for this position, please submit your resume and application form. If you acnnot access the application form, please reach out to Henry Sham.
h.sham@victorchang.edu.au

The closing date is Friday 6th December 2024.

Job Description:
Create an impact as a CX And Channel Chapter Lead.

Your Role

The purpose of the role and your unique contribution is to lead an RIA Advanced analytics chapter, contributing to projects as a senior analyst, and upskilling the team in connecting analytics capability to the business domain.

Key responsibilities include:

Lead a team of currently 6 and eventually up to 10 people
Leverage your analytical expertise to enhance data and reporting roadmaps for improved reuse, rapid delivery, and time-to-value.

Act as a senior analyst on projects by developing analyses, building reports, and reviewing the contributions of junior team members.

Collaborate with business units, squad leads, and technical teams to understand their needs effectively.

Experience leading a team is an absolute must for this position

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. We’re also a tech and research facility, a hub for climate change experts and a centre of resilience design. Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.
Join us.

Team Introduction
The team is responsible for infrastructure systems, including Storage/Computing/DB. We aim to be the leading SRE team across the industry. In the SRE team, you will have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale, while using expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis, and large-scale system design. We embrace a culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, openness, and problem-solving. We also encourage ownership, self-governance and independence to work on various projects, and an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow as an engineer.

Responsibilities
Lead a team of engineers on the technical side committed to building and operating scalable and reliable AML Platform systems.
Be both technically hands-on and people manager.
Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your project peers.
Communicate cross-functionally across various teams, organizations and internal and external stakeholders to drive engineering efforts.
Lead the team's innovation efforts, bring in new ideas and technologies.
Qualifications
Expertise in analyzing and troubleshooting distributed systems.
Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field involving software development or systems engineering.
Experience programming in at least one of the following languages: Python or Golang
Preferred qualifications:
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally with data science and infrastructure teams.
Hands-on in designing, building, scaling, and troubleshooting platform solutions.
Strong understanding of code optimizing and routine tasks automation.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. Job Title: Technology Consultant Planning & Analytics- Melbourne/ Sydney/ Brisbane
Job Description:
We help the world run better
At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SUMMARY
Planning & Analytics is one of the fastest growing areas and this role requires using innovation and state-of-the-art software to help customers deploy cloud-based solutions. As we are strengthening our team in this exciting growth area, we are looking for a consultant who can bring an entrepreneur mindset and help our customers on their journey of innovation and digital transformation.
As a consultant in the Analytics & Insight Services team you will be responsible for the delivery of Analytics, Planning and Data Management solutions based on SAP’s Business Technology Platform.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
In this role, you will work directly with Line of Business, Industry and Technology experts to translate our customers business needs into outcome-based analytics solutions. The role will involve both functional and technical expertise to develop data & analytics skills to best address our customers needs.
Bring strong thought-leadership and cloud mindset around planning solutions with clear understanding of cloud concepts and cloud architecture to help SAP customers on their journey to the cloud.
Articulate and lead Planning & Analytics business use case discovery working with business users at all levels
Participate in the design, build and deployment of Planning & Analytics solutions for SAP customers
Maintain a comprehensive understanding of SAP Solutions for Planning & Analytics
Lead by example and coach others in the team
Work towards achieving a strong customer C-level relationship on strategic accounts and become a trusted advisor
Contribute to solution knowledge base with specific areas of expertise, develop and document enterprise knowledge in the form of technical articles, and best practices
Team player, proactive networking attributes, results and execution focused, self-starter
Willingness to participate in sales process, if needed, as a subject matter expert

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Master’s or Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Management, or related fields

PERSONAL SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS
Functional knowledge about financial and operational planning, budgeting, and forecasting is required.
Proficient in SAP Analytics Cloud planning, modelling and creating visual stories.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
Understanding of SAP HANA or SAP BW system environments is beneficial.
Good knowledge of SQL and related programming languages.
Proven experience in project management and team leadership.
Strong communication and presentation skills are necessary.
Familiarity with EPM, SAP BPC, and SAP Analysis for Office is beneficial.
Willingness and ability to learn quickly new cloud-based solutions for Data & Analytics, but also eager to stay on top of technology innovations and to continuously learn
Data science related skills like Machine Learning to drive predictive planning scenarios are a plus

CUSTOMER FACING SKILLS
Excellent interpersonal, strong verbal and written communication and solid presentation skills
Ability to inspire confidence and work with all levels of client and internal staff. Ability to deliver clear, concise presentations to non-technical audience.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and precise manner with non-technical audience
Ability to capture customer requirements and translate them into software specifications

Bring out your best
SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
We win with inclusion
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Job Description:
McLean Farms is in search for a Information Systems Manager to join our team.

McLean Farms Administration Pty Ltd is a diversified family-owned agri-business based in the Darling Downs, specialising in livestock and food production. The business is involved with a broad range of other agricultural enterprises such as grain, compost and feed mill operations. We are currently seeking an Information Systems Manager to join the team in a full-time capacity based in Pittsworth, QLD.

The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of a comprehensive information system framework tailored to the poultry agribusiness and manufacturing industry.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement an Information Management Framework aligned with business goals.
Establish a robust data governance framework to manage structured and unstructured data effectively.
Design and maintain a central data repository integrating multiple platforms for seamless reporting.
Manage and optimise McLean Farms’ central SQL data repository and reporting tools.
Collaborate with leadership to define and report on KPIs for data-driven decision-making.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with organisational and regulatory standards.
Lead IT projects, including system upgrades, integrations, and reporting enhancements.
Facilitate access to critical data for decision-making and plan for future data storage needs.
Provide technical support and training to staff to enhance data management capabilities.
Oversee and provide guidance to indirect reports, ensuring alignment with organisational objectives and fostering a collaborative environment for effective data management.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Advanced degrees or certifications in data management, data governance, or related disciplines are highly desirable.
Minimum 3-5 Years of Experience in Information Management, Reporting and Data Governance.
Proficiency in database management, SQL, Microsoft Power BI, and other information management tools.
Strong understanding of data integration, data governance frameworks, and ETL processes.
Experience with cloud-based solutions and automation tools such as Nintex.
Strong leadership and cross-functional collaboration abilities.
Ability to troubleshoot, resolve, and optimise data and system performance issues.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on data-driven decision-making.
Knowledge of industry regulations and standards for data privacy and security.

If you are looking for your next challenge, please apply with your resume and cover letter.

Please visit our website www.mcleanfarms.com.au to find out more about what we do.

You must not have any birds, pigs or poultry at your place of residence.

Please ensure that you have read the Bio-Security Document on the right hand side.

Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer in Sydney
Job Description:
Job Overview:
Are you passionate about machine learning and want to make a real-world impact? We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic Data Science team. You will have the opportunity to apply your expertise to solve challenging logistics problems by implementing innovative, advanced approaches. As a key player of our growing team, you will have the chance to transform creative ideas into reality in a stimulating and inclusive environment!
Company Overview:
WiseTech Global is a renowned Australian Software Development Company specializing in advanced solutions for the logistics industry. Our flagship product CargoWise One is a testament to our commitment to innovation. With a mission to enhance the efficiency of global supply chains, we offer a comprehensive platform that integrates all aspects of logistics from origin to destination. Over the last five years, we've invested over AUD 1 billion in product development, resulting in more than 5500 enhancements to our CargoWise platform.
By joining our teams, you'll have the autonomy to drive meaningful projects. We pride ourselves on our flat structure and collaborative culture.
Day-to-day Responsibilities:
Bring state-of-art machine learning models from ideas into production.
Take ownership of complex projects, and deliver well-structured, well-tested, production-ready solutions.
Take a leading role in designing and building innovative machine learning and other algorithmic solutions, API services and data pipelines.
Collaborate with multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders like product managers or software engineers.
Monitor, analyse and improve the quality of existing feature implementations using statistical methods.
Coach and support more junior colleagues.
Requirements:
BSc in Computer Science, other STEM subjects, or comparable work experience.
3-5 years of working experience in machine learning/AI in a commercial environment.
Strong programming skills in Python (additionally, experience with C# a plus).
Experience in building and evaluating production-ready machine learning models.
Experience working with PyTorch, Tensorflow or other machine learning frameworks.
Knowledge about transformers, Large Language Models and other SOTA models is highly desirable.
Experience building chatbots or other AI Agents is not essential, but a plus.
Excellent communication skills, in particular, ability to explain complex concepts to more junior colleagues and non-technical people.
Before you Apply:
From time to time, WiseTech Global may use external service providers to assist us with assessing applications, including background checks, on our behalf. Accordingly, by applying for this role and providing your personal information to WiseTech Global, you consent to WiseTech Global providing this information to our external service providers who are required to treat such information with strict confidentiality in line with privacy and data protection laws and regulations.

Job Description:
About CTM
CTM is an award-winning provider of innovative and cost-effective travel management solutions to the corporate, events, leisure and loyalty travel markets. CTM provides personalised service excellence with client-facing technology solutions in offices all around the world, including New Zealand, Australia, Asia, North America and Europe with over 3000 employees and growing.

At CTM, our people are our greatest asset. We are a team of collaborative, innovative and future-focused professionals we work with the company's values in mind; Connect, Deliver and Evolve.

About the role
We're seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer with strong Python and React expertise to build scalable web applications and data-driven solutions. This role combines frontend development, backend systems design, and machine learning integration to drive technological innovation across our global organization.

This position combines hands-on technical development with strategic thinking, offering the right candidate an opportunity to make a significant impact on our organization's digital transformation journey.

Core Responsibilities
Design and develop full-stack applications using React and Python
Build responsive, performant frontend interfaces using React, TypeScript, and modern web technologies
Develop scalable backend systems and RESTful APIs using Python
Integrate and optimize machine learning solutions within web applications
Implement data visualization and analytics features
Design and maintain database schemas and data pipelines
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions
Present insights and solutions to stakeholders across all organizational levels
Required Qualifications
Frontend: Expert-level React JS, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3, Webpack
Backend: Expert-level Python, RESTful APIs, GraphQL
Database: Strong background in SQL and NoSQL databases

Testing: Jest, React Testing Library, Python unittest
Skills & Experience
Natural Language Processing (NLP) for text analysis and chatbot development
Time series analysis and forecasting
Computer vision and image processing
Experience with cloud platforms – Azure (preferred) , AWS, or GCP
Data visualization and BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau, or equivalent)
DevOps practices including containerization (Docker) and CI/CD pipeline
Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or related technical field
Bachelor's degree with additional years of relevant experience may be considered
Minimum 5+ years of professional experience in software development with Python
Minimum 3+ years of hands-on experience implementing machine learning solutions in production environments
Demonstrated track record of successful ML project delivery from conception to deployment
Published research or significant contributions to open-source ML projects is a plus
Why CTM?
CTM offer a strong, established, and sustainable work environment which will support your career development and wellbeing.
As a global organization CTM offers a range of employee benefits that you can access, including;
Travel discounts
Perkbox - Retail, Lifestyle, Entertainment and Health and Wellness discounts & benefits
Training and Development opportunities
Annual Volunteer Day
x2 Wellness/Chillout Days
Blended work arrangements with hybrid WFH flexibility
2 Weeks extra leave - Purchase Leave
