Job Description:
Description

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.

Founded in Australia and with multiple recent fundraises (backed by EVP) we are growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.

We have a hybrid work environment and this role is to be Sydney based to allow for semi-regular in-person time with the team. A few days a week in the office in Sydney will be required for this role.

We value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.

The role

Working on our core product, GrowthOS, you'll be part of a cross functional team to build features and experiences that help our customers manage their marketing data and make better decisions with that data.

We're a growing startup with a small team, which means this is a very hands-on role and you’ll get to help establish processes and embed best practice into how we work. You'd want to be comfortable and enjoy coming into early stages companies and products and contributing to those things, and be self aware that you don't need those things given to you to succeed and enjoy what you're doing.

You’ll need to get to know our customers and their needs, create a solid product strategy and roadmap, work with Data Science, Engineering and Design to deliver that roadmap, then collaborate with Marketing Science and Account Management to unlock the business value for our customers.

What does the first 30-90 days look like?

You'll learn about our product and the sector we are in, to understand the fundamentals of MMM so you can best understand the problems you are trying to solve for our customers.

After that, you will start to scope features and refine product processes and roadmaps, while building relationships with the Engineering and Data teams, and Customer squads.

When quarterly planning time rolls around, you’ll collaborate with product leadership to set objectives, define metrics and build out the roadmap.

How success will be measured?

Having positive impacts on key product metrics and customer outcomes, contributions to refining or creating product processes and increasing our momentum to delivery.

What we are looking for

Must haves:

Senior Product Management experience in either SaaS, startups, PLGs or on data centric products/platforms. You could be a top-of-your-game Senior looking to step up or a Lead looking for a change.
The ability to (and enjoy doing) end- to-end product strategy and delivery – you’ll be on the tools and wearing a few hats.
Strong analytical ability – there's a lot of data here so being able to look in the right places, identify key insights and turn those insights into decisions and action is needed.
Proven success in the 0-1 stage of product development. We’re not optimising and building small features, we’re innovating and leading the market.
You will need to have exposure to technical or data-led products in the past. Bonus points if you have a solid understanding of statistics and probability theory

Nice to have:

Previous experience working with data-centric products. Data is a core of our product and company so it's ideal if you can understand our Data Scientists, Engineers, Marketing Scientists and customers.

About Mutinex
We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.

Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.

We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.

Founded in Australia, we've hit millions in ARR & have seed funding ($5 million in May 2023 & $9.5 million in October 2023 backed by EVP) that we'll use for growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.

We have a hybrid work environment with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and expanding into the US.

With a team of around 60 people we value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.

Equity (ESOP) is offered to all staff on top of their salary and we also offer additional annual leave after 1 year of tenure (from 20 to 25 days a year) that continues to grow another day each year of service until you max out at 30 days per year.

Job Title: Full Stack Engineer, Visa Managed Services, Sydney – 12-month fixed term contract
Job Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

Team Summary
Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) Australia, New Zealand, and South Pacific (AUNZSP) is Visa's advisory division, working with Visa's clients (including card issuers, acquirers, and merchants) on a broad range of key business initiatives including strategy, proposition development, loyalty, operational optimisation, customer engagement and overall business profitability.
VCA is made up of three services lines - Advisory, Data Science and Managed Services, the latter being the execution arm of VCA. Our Managed Services teams (also known as squads) are embedded on client sites leading long-term engagements and delivering value primarily through implementation and execution services. We deliver objectives from a shared value agenda but are also closely connected to the broader VCA team, sharing knowledge, and bringing the best of Visa to the client.
We are looking for a dedicated Engineer to join the client's team for a 12-month fixed-term contract. This role will be embedded with a key strategic client's Business Banking team and will be part of a Tech Squad working on cutting edge technology to drive advancement in the bank's leading engineering practices, focusing on building a new card product. You will lead by example and coach others to develop and automate the testing of robust[SH1] [AN2] , adaptable code that is always production ready. Through collaboration with other developers, your work will improve the banking experience for our client’s customers.
Why Work with Us:
Visa Managed Services is our fastest growing team in AUNZSP – we’ve grown 10x in less than 3 years – and always have fun projects on the horizon to sink our teeth into.
We get to work with incredible people every day. We’re a team of intrapreneurs who work hard, have fun, and get stuff done.
We are a people business where the people are our product. As a result, all our people leaders are 100% dedicated to ensuring a positive employee experience. We attract top talent and are manically focused on developing that talent – even for short-term contracts.
We are committed to building a diverse team with an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we work in.
We support flexible working options.
Full-stack Engineer Responsibilities:
Proficiency in collaborating with teams and technology vendors to support the integration of technologies, ensuring the implementation of robust and scalable systems according to established standards and guidelines.
Ability to define system integrations, design patterns, and development standards to support cross-functional, multi-system solutions that are scalable and adaptable to meet the organization's current and future needs.
Experience in creating and updating standard operating procedures and reporting in partnership with the Operations team.
Expertise in coaching and mentoring engineers and team members to increase their technical capabilities and enhance the performance of scrum teams and the organization.
Strong project management skills to deliver projects as per the plan and schedule.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to operate effectively in ambiguous situations.
Develop comprehensive solutions using front-end technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular) and back-end technologies (e.g., C#/.NET development, Node.js, Python, Java, Ruby).
Experience with database technologies (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL).
Design and implement RESTful APIs and microservices architecture to ensure system robustness and scalability.
Foster effective collaboration with cross-functional teams to achieve project goals
This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

Key competencies
Solution-mind set – Applying creative problem-solving techniques and championing a client-first approach to solutioning when opportunities and challenges arise to meet specific business objectives. Employs a structured approach to a problem with a holistic view. Strives to research and investigate to ensure the solution is future proof.
Business-Technical Translator – Translates complex technical specifications into well-defined business concepts, showcasing the impacts and implementation considerations to develop and deliver solutions for the client.
Driving Execution - Translates requirements into actions by determining action steps and milestones required to implement a specific business initiative, adjusts activities or timelines as circumstances warrant. Uses the tools and processes to optimally drive the desired outcomes meeting client’s and visa’s objectives.
High-Impact Communication - Clearly and succinctly conveying information and ideas to individuals and groups in a variety of situations, communicating in a focused and compelling way that drives others thoughts and actions.
Building Strategic Work Relationships: Developing and using collaborative relationships to achieve work goals. Uses good interpersonal relationships by helping people feel valued, appreciated, and included in discussions (enhances self-esteem, empathizes, involves, discloses, supports).
What will also help:
Bachelor's Degree
5+ years related work experience in relevant role in the financial services industry
Passion for designing, developing, & deploying high quality solutions and enjoy spending time being hands-on assisting the team in delivery objectives.
Experience in designing and operating highly available systems in cloud environment – AWS preferred
Experience with Full-Cycle development and delivery using Agile practices with a specific focus on developing Web applications, RESTful API’s, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
An understanding on testing principles.
Proficient in designing scalable and secure enterprise applications that can handle high traffic.
An expert at managing multiple projects and solving complex problem.
Card Payments experience is highly desirable
By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where your contributions will have a direct impact on our business operations and customer satisfaction. If you are passionate about financial services and eager to drive product success, we would love to hear from you.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Job Title: NAPAC Finance, Business Development, Strategy and Operations Manager
Job Description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
POSITION RESPONSIBILTIES
Act as a Business Partner for the NAPAC hub with advice, analysis, and strategy for reporting, planning and throughout the Business Plan/Forecasting process.
Support operation with current Business Development partners and new BD projects.
Support NAPAC GM, CFO and other lead team members on strategic projects and operational / governance duties.
Proactively carryout value-added analysis on financial and operational data as well as competitive insights, supporting and testing information provided by global, regional and local teams internally and externally.
Prepare effective and high-quality presentations to illustrate the findings and recommendations as well as documentation of analysis completed and job aides where appropriate.
Build strong relationships with the hub business teams to provide effective support.
Coordinate closely with pricing and access team, business analytics team, and marketing team across the hub to perform analysis and provide recommendations.
Assist regional affiliates in planning and execution of operational strategies to ensure effective governance, enhance profitability and improve process efficiency, and identify / pull-through simplification initiatives across the hub.
Identify and drive best practices and implement business process improvements, support business improvement opportunities and ad hoc projects as they arise.
KEY COMPETENCIES & SELECTION CRITERIA
Degree in Business/Commerce/Accounting (MBA preferred)
Minimum 2 years’ experience in financial analysis, consulting, or other data science
Excellent teamwork and ability to work proactive with a sense of urgency
Excel in cross functional collaboration, leading without authority and ability to influence cross functions/cultures
Strong Learning Agility: Ability to thrive in a high pressure and ambiguous environment
Superior analytical, planning and organising skills.
Continuous learning and improvement mindset
Must be able to inspire and engage diverse group of people across multiple stakeholders by being able to simplify complexity
Desire and ability to think strategically about the business and identify opportunities to add value to current processes and structures
Detail oriented with the ability to see the bigger picture and a high level of initiative
Ability to effectively navigate change and work under stress, independently while maintaining a positive attitude
Strong problem-solving skills, and planning/organizational skills – with ability to prioritize
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, databases, MS Office, SAP (preferred)
Excellent presentation, reporting and communication/interpersonal skills
High business acumen, understanding of financial concepts and enterprise mindset – recognition that maximizing the outcome for the local business might sometimes differ from the best decision for the broader company, shareholders and patients globally.

Job Title: Senior Consultant or Manager - Actuarial - Government and Public Sector
Job Description:
Senior Consultant or Manager – Actuarial – Government and Public Sector - Financial Services

If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

What’s in it for you?

As our Senior Consultant or Manager within the Actuarial team, you’ll be at the forefront of solving complex business challenges, leveraging your actuarial expertise to drive strategic initiatives and deliver impactful solutions to our Government and Public Sector clients in Canberra.

Our Canberra-based team collaborates with EY actuaries across Australia and New Zealand to drive positive change, helping governments improve their operations and create a better working world, particularly for those in need.

We offer fulfilling careers where you can apply your analytical skills innovatively in non-traditional fields. You might work with health professionals to model health-seeking behaviors and inform community activation strategies for early diagnosis of chronic diseases or analyse big datasets to develop metrics that indicate the wellbeing of Veterans.

Collaborate in dynamic, multi-disciplinary teams to create innovative solutions that drive client success.
Forge strategic partnerships within the government, health, human services, and social sectors to enhance community well-being.
Analyse and interpret data to uncover critical insights, driving informed decision-making on key issues.

What we’re looking for

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.

Completed, or progressing towards completing, actuarial qualification (FIAA) with 3 to 5 years of professional experience in an actuarial role.
Possess strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a background in actuarial science, data science, statistics, physics, or other quantitative fields, including experience in modeling and coding.
Demonstrate strong technical actuarial skills, proficient in actuarial software and programming languages such as SAS, R, and Python.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of presenting complex information clearly and confidently to non-specialists.
Driven by a desire to innovate and make a meaningful difference.
Australian citizenship (to achieve security clearance for some government clients)

Ideally, You'll Also Have:

Experience in consultancy or a client-facing role
Experience in health, aged care, human services (e.g. disability, justice, child protection) or government insurance schemes

Please note that this position is located in Canberra and is best suited for individuals already residing in Canberra or those open to relocating.

Our roles can be adjusted to work flexibly with the potential of reduced hours to balance your time between the home and office. Please speak with us about potential options.

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

We hold a collective commitment to continue to drive an environment where all differences are valued, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging— where people are inspired to team and lead inclusively in their interactions every day. In addition, you will support the execution of Bluetree’s business plan, developing business opportunities with existing and new clients and supporting in client service delivery.

Plus a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a professional service delivery or project manager using technologies such as SAP Reporting, SQL Server and demonstrated experience in Analytics such as Tableau, Qlik and Power BI
Other key considerations include:
· Strong Data Analytics and general client consulting skills,
· Knowledge of process improvement mapping and improvement methodology,

· Strong current hands-on configuration and design skills;
· Flexibility to travel.
Key behavioural competencies important in this role include
· Excellent oral & written communication
· Stakeholder and relationship management
· People person able to work autonomously
· Good organisational & time management skills
· Strong Business Acumen
· Takes pride & ownership of client relationships & project goals.
Benefits and Perks

Full-Time position with a salary of $100,000 to $110,000 + Superannuation

Job Description:
May 24, 2024
1:51 pm
Senior Structural Engineer – Buildings
Sydney
The Opportunity
Due to recent project wins, we have an opportunity for a Senior Structural Engineer with building design experience to join our team in North Sydney. You will support new and existing projects, including the structural design of several tall tower projects in Sydney and interstate.
Duties
We are looking for someone who is:
Proactive toward career development and continuous learning
Committed to quality and agile in project delivery
Technically astute who has engineering experience delivering projects such as mixed use, commercial, infrastructure, heritage refurbishment or industrial buildings.
The successful applicant will have:
6-8 years’ post qualification experience in an engineering design consultancy
Mid-high rise building sector design focus. Infrastructure experience is also valuable.
Concrete design experience with exposure to columns, foundations, reinforced concrete slabs and beams, post tension slabs and beams, lateral design, and shoring design/basement structures
Steel and timber design desirable
The ability to work independently and be client-facing
Excellent communication skills with a proactive approach
Experience in software such as ETABS, SPACE GASS, Microstran, RAPT, RAM Concept and Strand7 is desirable
CPEng with a solid understanding of AU standards
We are a highly motivated, technically skilled, and proactive team. If you are seeking engineering career challenges, a variety of work, recognition for achievement and a collaborative continuous learning working environment, we want to hear from you!
Robert Bird Group is an equal employment opportunity employer.
This role does not require agency input. Please do not forward resumes directly to RBG’s employees/managers. We do not accept unsolicited resumes and are not responsible for any associated fees.
About Us
Robert Bird Group is a global engineering consulting firm committed to delivering each client’s vision through ‘the relentless pursuit of engineering excellence’ across all projects. We strive for ‘good to a great design’ by transforming inspiring concepts into buildable designs using our innovative, collaborative, and proactive ideas.
We deliver proven ‘design for delivery’ results, providing unique engineering solutions for complex construction challenges for some of the world’s largest, highest-profile, and most complex built-form projects.
Our Sydney team has engineered iconic projects such as the Crown Sydney, One Sydney Harbour, One Central Park, One Circular Quay, Sydney Football Stadium, International Convention Centre, and various Sydney Metro stations.
Investing in the future of engineering:
We are investing heavily in new forms of engineering delivery, to include 4D BIM digital rehearsals using our Unity-based Reveal platform. Integrated with our BIM, analysis, and Synchro programming tools, this is redefining the way clients and contractors plan and deliver their projects.
Created in-house by our own coding and programming teams, and in keeping with our desire to be at the forefront of the industry, we also offer opportunities to engineers wishing to use their existing experience – or upskill in the fields of parametric design, data science, coding, and programming.
We are also committed to fostering exceptional engineering talent who share our dedication to environmentally responsible design.
Why work with us?
RBG provides frequent opportunities for professional development and the chance to learn directly from our dedicated team of leaders, technical experts, and the specialist engineers of our global business.
If you enjoy engineering complexity, we will have the project challenges to engage your technical expertise.
We offer structural training and ongoing development, various paid leave, financial and health/well-being benefits, recognition awards, dynamic leadership, and a collaborative team environment.

Mid-Level

Job Title: Responsible AI – Fraud and Scams Senior Manager
Job Description:
We are:
Accenture’s Global Responsible AI team within the Global Data & AI Practice. AI is becoming more pervasive, more powerful, and more accessible. With these new opportunities come increased risks. We work with leading organizations to ensure AI is designed, built, and deployed in a manner that engenders trust and adheres to laws, regulations and ethical norms. Our Responsible AI strategy will enable us to embed responsibility into all of Accenture’s data and AI activities. We’re developing and deploying differentiated IP and Responsible AI solutions with our ecosystem partners. We’ll be engaging regulators to help shape the policy agenda, conducting pioneering research with academia and offer training and resources to our clients through the Responsible AI Academy. The risks of AI are real and well-known. Let’s help our clients turn those risks into opportunities.
You are:
We’re looking to grow our Responsible AI team and if you’re experienced in Fraud and Scams Risk Management with a Responsible AI background, we’d love to hear from you.

As a Responsible AI Fraud & Scams professional, you’ll be experienced in ensuring that AI systems for fraud detection and mitigation are developed, implemented, and maintained in a way that mitigates risks associated with AI, along with focus on information and data security. But you’ll also have at least a year’s experience looking at responsible aspects such as AI model Fairness, Transparency, Explainability, Robustness, Soundness and Privacy – preferably gained in a client-facing environment (if in the markets. Review if ATCi).
You’ll bring diverse expertise in deploying and monitoring AI systems, machine learning model risk management, and applying regulatory requirements to frameworks and technical tools. You’ll be an outstanding technical specialist with the strong communication skills needed to liaise with your clients and your colleagues.
At the forefront of the industry, you’ll help make our Responsible AI vision a reality for clients looking to better serve their customers and operate always-on enterprises. We’re not just focused on increasing revenues – our technologies and innovations are making millions of lives easier and more comfortable. But above all, we’re doing this responsibly and inclusively – to make sure AI technology is used equitably and in a way that is both ethically and technically sound.
The work:
You’ll be a key player helping to deliver outstanding work for our Responsible AI clients. Some of the areas you’ll be working in include:
Configuring, deploying and monitoring AI systems on cloud and on-premise environments
Focusing on considerations for fraud and scam detection using AI systems while being able to identify and mitigate responsible AI dimensions like – bias, fairness, robustness, model security, data security etc.
Working with cyber and information security teams, considering internal and external obligations required for solutions focused on mitigating fraud and scams
Facilitating communication between technical and non-technical stakeholders regarding AI projects and their impact on fraud and scams detection and mitigation
Designing, developing, and deploying AI Operations tools and frameworks – MLOps, LLMOps and DevOps
Setting up systems to detect the RAI related anomalies in data or AI; monitor and send alerts as needed.
Optimizing and maintaining existing AI systems to follow local RAI laws, regulations and technical guidelines
Working with the functional teams to convert the business meaning of RAI laws, regulations and ethical standards to technology
Contributing to the development of internal guidelines and best practices for responsible AI deployment and monitoring
Staying updated with current AI trends, ethical considerations, evolving frauds and scams, and technological advancements in the space
Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.
Here’s What You Need:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or related technical fields
Manager experience: 6-8 years
Senior Manager: 8-10 years
Experience in designing, developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions. Knowledge of model risk and experience in Model Risk Management.
Experience in fraud and scams detection frameworks and systems, including ability to work with complex datasets and perform data preprocessing and analysis.
Experience in working on cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) and on Data & AI technologies.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java.
Knowledge of standard IT operations including MLOps, LLMOps and DevOps.
Familiarity with cloud deployment (infrastructure as code) and monitoring functions (ex: Cloud watch on AWS).
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively with team members. Ability to independently prioritize efforts based on situational awareness.
Commitment to ethical AI development and continuous learning in the field.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent documentation and presentation skills for technical and non-technical audiences.
Bonus Points If You Have:
Strong focus on courses or training in areas related to responsible AI, ethics in technology, or similar fields are beneficial.
Certifications in AI, machine learning, risk & compliance or data science.
Business background on RAI principles, Ethical AI, laws and regulations
Prior experience in projects focused on ethical AI or AI for social good.
Knowledge of RAI laws, regulations and the ability to interpret and apply using technologies.
Knowledge of AI ethics, data privacy, and regulatory frameworks.
Experience with AI model interpretability and explainability tools.
Linguistic proficiency (to a reasonable business level) in a language other than English
Benefits of working at Accenture:
18 weeks paid parental leave
Structured career development program
Local and international career opportunities.
Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™
Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people.
We are proud to be in the top 3 of last year’s Diversity & Inclusion Index!
Please refer to this link - Employee Benefits | Accenture for a detailed description of the benefits
Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world's leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent- and innovation-led company with 742,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world's leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology and leadership in cloud, data and Al with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients reinvent and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement for Australia:
At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.
Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. Job Description:
Role overview:
Finity is the market leading actuarial consulting and strategic analytics firm in Australia and New Zealand.
We are looking for:
About Finity
Finity is the market leading actuarial consulting and strategic analytics firm in Australia and New Zealand. We are proud to have been recently acknowledged as ANZIIF Professional Services Firm of the Year for 2024. At Finity, we combine industry knowledge with technical analysis to offer innovative solutions and practical advice to our large client base. Our clients range from tech starts up through to large scale organisations across insurance, finance and government.

Our team of over 270 experts cover a diverse range of skills including; actuarial, analytics, technology, management consulting and support staff. Our consultants assist our clients with a wide range of banking & finance services including; pricing and customer & product insights, automation, risk & capital allocation, financial management, compliance & regulation and data science and analytics. Alongside our consulting work, we also develop a range of software products, offering our clients leading technology to navigate business challenges.

Employment opportunities
As a Senior Software Developer at Finity you will be working within our practice to deliver innovative full stack solutions. You will support and work closely with our product leads and the wider product teams to design and develop full stack technology products, core to its Technology Strategy. The role will work with multiple teams across our offices in Sydney and Melbourne.

Position Summary – key responsibilities
Involved in designing and building our software products and capabilities, as directed by the CTO to meet the company requirements
Work with C# .NET Core / Typescript / NodeJS technologies
A true full stack role, involving development in all layers - back-end, front-end and database
Works flexibly to deliver innovative solutions on diverse technology challenges
Works on a wide variety of technology products and projects
Works collaboratively, and at times remotely, with our engineering and product teams on varying technology solutions
Strong ability to understand/communicate clients needs at a product level
Develops and maintains strong relationships with internal stakeholder
Training and Qualifications
A tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related qualification is essential, post-graduate qualifications will be highly regarded. You will have proven software engineering experience in a commercial environment.

Key Selection Criteria
Proven software engineering experience in a commercial environment at a senior level
Understanding of a range of Full-Stack technologies
C# .NET (Core)
Angular.js (or relevant React / Vue experience)
SQL (Postgres, MSSQL)
Git
NodeJS (advantageous)
Solid understanding of Linux and familiarity with a shell scripting language – e.g. bash
Solid understanding of container / automation technologies

Kubernetes
Ansible (advantageous)
Understanding of one or more agile methodologies
Exposure to Cloud SDKs
Azure (preferred)
AWS
Google Cloud Platform
Some exposure to projects / products using data science languages & tools (desired)
R
Python
Ability to work in teams, including those across multiple locations
Desire to mentor juniors
Sound interpersonal skills
Well-developed communication skills
Pro-active and self-driven approach / can do attitude / a passion for development

Job Description:
Who is Altis Consulting?
An Australian-owned industry leader who continues to “Do more with data than you imagined possible”.

Altis Consulting is a market leader with over 25 years experience providing a deep understanding of the data and analytics landscape. From both a technical and business perspective, we combine commercial expertise, technical agnostic capabilities, and long-standing relationships to support our clients and deliver high-quality solutions.

As we continually foster an environment of lifelong learning, high performance, and ongoing relationships, our values of "Lead With Heart, Find a Way, Own It, and Be Curious" drive our team to continually deliver solutions that make us stand out and remain unique in our approach.

About The Team
Our team at Altis is the foundation of our ongoing success!
Comprised of a diverse group of immensely talented individuals, we consistently make a significant impact in the Data and Analytics Industry. We place great emphasis on supporting our team members by providing continuous learning opportunities and fostering their professional development. By nurturing a culture of growth, we empower our team to unlock doors and achieve their full potential, surpassing their own expectations. We believe in enabling our people to reach heights they may have never imagined possible.

About the Role:
In this role you will bring your initiative, experience, technical knowledge and strong oral and written communication skills to provide advice and solutions that make a tangible difference to clients. You will use your in-depth of understanding of Data, Information Management and Analytics to develop clear strategies and roadmaps to guide our clients on their data value journey. You'll be responsible for the end-to-end delivery and technical leadership of high quality business solutions and other projects to solve issues, bring value and improve business performance.

You will bring:

Knowledge providing strategic advice to organisations to help maximise the value from their data and information.
Project experience through all phases of the project life cycle from strategy and advisory, scoping and planning, requirements, design, development, testing and deployment.
Excellent ETL knowledge.
Be up to date with new technology such as Data Science, Big Data and Cloud Computing.

Please note this role will require you to be an Australian Citizen

Your skills and experience
Experience linking and translating business requirements into Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence, and Analytics solutions.
Data integration with a variety of data sources and tools to extract, transform, and load data
Good skills in data modelling, data ingestion, and ETL design
A thorough technical understanding of leading-edge data and analytics technologies and development techniques.
A background in consulting and professional services.
Experience in AWS or Microsoft Azure is highly desirable
Working closely with business users to design powerful visualisations and business intelligence reporting solutions.

Qualifications/ Education
Tertiary qualification in an IT-related subject, or relevant work experience
5-7 years of consulting and implementation experience
5 – 7 years broad IT experience
5+ years experience of leading data & analytics tools
5+ years delivering projects in a client facing environment
Experience in end-to-end solution delivery

Why Altis?
Our Commitment to you.
We will support your needs by giving you the tools to deliver your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work and we will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can.

Culture
As a team, we celebrate enjoyment and fun in our work environment. We believe that fostering a positive and enjoyable atmosphere enhances collaboration and productivity. We also value knowledge sharing and continuous learning, recognizing that knowledge sharing is essential for personal and professional growth. We do all this whilst having great team events and celebrations along the way.

We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our people are from a variety of backgrounds, gender identities, learning and thinking styles, different experiences, and capabilities. We unite through understanding and empower through inclusion. We are passionate about our people and our Diversity and Inclusion Council aims to cultivate an environment where our people feel supported.

What we offer
As an employee of Altis you will have access to:
We offer a hybrid working model
Competitive Salary Package dependent on skills and experience, along with a bi-annual bonus scheme
Training and development to help propel your career both in technical and soft skills
Generous paid parental leave up to 14 weeks, eligible after 6 months
Health and Wellness Program, including access to an Employee Assistance Program for our employees and your family
Reward and Recognition scheme with an awesome referral bonus $$$

Next Steps

Apply Now! We would love to hear from you. Please note this role will require you to be an Australian Citizen

At the core of our values, we place a high priority on respect, fairness, development, and well-being. We strive to create an inclusive and diverse culture where individuals from all backgrounds are welcomed and celebrated. We believe in equal opportunities for all qualified applicants, regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability, or thinking style. If you require assistance or accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons, we are readily available to accommodate your needs upon request.

Job Description:
Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at:
http://www.WabtecCorp.com
.

It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.
What are we offering you?
Permanent full-time position with competitive remuneration
Rewards & Recognition Program
Discounted health insurance with Medibank
Lifestyle discounts with Woolworths, Coles, Avis, Quest, Accor Hotels etc
Access to our Employee Assistance Program
Who will you be working with? This role reports to the Engineering Leader
Where is the position located? This is a full-time role based anywhere in Australia
The position specifically focused on the ongoing engineering, support and project delivery of the Wabtec portfolio of products.
With broad recognition as a leader in condition monitoring systems and associated technologies, Wabtec systems are installed on freight, heavy haul and passenger rail networks across 20+ countries and 6 continents. Our IoT systems use leading edge sensor technologies to acquire data from passing trains. Valuable insights on asset health are then extracted from the data using a combination of edge computing, signal processing, and artificial intelligence (AI) methods.
What will your typical day look like?
Conceptualize, develop, test and implement new features in the data acquisition, processing and reporting software.
Define, develop and document system level test plans and procedures.
Contribute to the creation and upkeep of product documentation – design, engineering calculations, analysis and generating useful insights.
Lead technical discussions with potential and existing customers to extract user requirements and drive new product initiatives and product enhancements.
Provide detailed engineering design reviews for software disciplines.
Prepare carefully considered customer facing responses to technical queries arising through projects and ongoing support agreements.
Handle customer technical requests requiring in-depth data analysis, data science techniques, (L3 support escalations).
Provide advanced troubleshooting and fault resolution on our deployed systems requiring a detailed understanding of our data acquisition and processing pipelines.
Work to improve automated system diagnostics and implement improved diagnostic reporting from our products.
Ensure compliance of our products to relevant local and international standards.
Help define, implement, and drive our product roadmaps, and critically review the integration of new technologies into our product portfolio.
Work with the service and support team to provide our customers with timely support and responses to their queries.
Work with the Business Development team to support activities related to tendering, including technical assessment of tenders, preparation of tender responses and supporting presentations, as required.
Help instill a culture throughout the Track IQ business in line with the Wabtec values of Safety, Customer Focus, Continuous Improvement, performance optimization, Teamwork and Leadership
Help establish, improve and maintain quality control processes, systems and documentation.
Support the Services /Support Manager and Customer Managers to resolve customer issues / queries in a timely and professional manner.
Support Business Development Managers with technical inputs to tender responses and proposals
Support Product Managers with technical inputs to product road maps and new product initiatives
What do we want to know about you?
PhD/Masters/ Bachelors in Computer Science /ECE/IT.., engineering or equivalent proven industry experience in Data Acquisition and signal processing
12+ years of relevant industry experience and domain expertise
Detailed, in-depth understanding of SDLC
Strong data analytics and signal processing expertise
Advanced skills in the MATLAB programming platform
Expertise and in-depth understanding in sensor/technology selection, Data acquisition systems, advanced signal processing, statistical data analysis software and methods
Working knowledge - Conceptualize, develop, test and implement new features in the data acquisition, processing and reporting software.
IOT concepts and E2E solutions
Experience in HLDs, LLDs level design, including the design of data acquisition systems and the selection and integration of appropriate sensors.
Proficiency in coding /programming skills to conduct data analysis.
Good hands-on and working experience (development of algorithms..,) through AI -ML/DL techniques.
Broad multi-discipline engineering knowledge and expertise
Experience working with electromechanical and software systems.
Experience working in the rail industry - asset condition monitoring, preventive and predictive maintenance knowledge
Experience in customer facing roles.
Clear, effective communication and English language skills, both written and oral
Good personal management, organisational and interpersonal skills
Negotiation and stakeholder management skills
Competency in the installation, setup, maintenance and troubleshooting of software, electronic and mechanical systems.
Competency in the use of Microsoft Windows operating system and the Microsoft Office suite of products
Ability to create formal documentation: e.g. information request responses, quotations, work instructions, product documentation
The ability to work under pressures of weekly, monthly and project deadlines.
Customer focus – a work ethic where the customer is put first and responses to customer queries, issues and support needs are focused on
Organisation – dedication to planning, implementing, following and enforcing quality processes
Relationship building – ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships
An enthusiastic attitude to hard work, learning new skills, and going above and beyond to achieve customer satisfaction
Strong problem solving, troubleshooting, fault resolution
Awareness and knowledge of latest updates on related technology advances, industry regulations
We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Job Description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.
Our enterprise sales team is expanding, and we seek a seasoned, outcomes-focused acquisition account executive. The right candidate must be experienced in selling to business and technology stakeholders and have quantifiable C-level relationships within the top Enterprise and Public Sector accounts in Western Australia. In this role, you will use your disciplined and business-aligned prospecting skills to strategically pursue new businesses and land new logos in WA.
Your role will encompass prospecting, developing, and closing business in a timely manner while focusing on solving the prospect's business pain points and key challenges and delivering on agreed-upon business value-driven use cases.
This role is a unique opportunity to enable our customers to deliver high-visibility, high-impact projects that impact organisational growth and strategic business value. You will be successful in this role if you can act with autonomy, take accountability, and be open to new perspectives and ideas. Our team has a deep curiosity to learn and is always looking for innovative ways to meet and exceed our customers' needs.
AS AN ACQUISITION ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:
Understand Snowflake’s product and ecosystem, conduct discovery calls, facilitate customised demos, and presentations to prospective customers.
Be a multi-threaded, trusted advisor to the customer by understanding their existing and future Business and IT roadmap to drive the Snowflake adoption within their organisation.
Work intimately with Snowflake partners and service providers within the Western Australian market to deliver value to net new customers and accelerate customer value realisation.
Qualify prospects and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams.
Land, adopt, expand, and deepen sales opportunities with accounts in your region.
Achieve sales quotas for allocated accounts and/or territory on a quarterly and annual basis by developing a sales strategy in the assigned territory with a target prospect list and a regional sales plan.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales leadership, engineering, professional services, marketing, legal and finance.
Have experience and expertise in MEDDPICC or similar methodology
ON DAY ONE, WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
6+ years of sales experience with consistent success in meeting or exceeding sales objectives, selling technical solutions and SaaS into the enterprise market.
Demonstrable experience executing enterprise complex sales strategies and tactics within one of the following spaces: Public Cloud, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Science or AI/ML
Familiarity with a solution-based approach to selling, experience managing a complex sales process, excellent presentation and listening skills, and organisation and contact management capabilities.
The ability to build our brand and company like it’s your own, explicitly defining and executing sales plans to meet strategic & financial targets, leveraging industry, partner & Go-to-Market knowledge.
This ability to provide open, honest and respectful feedback creates an inclusive work environment.
A reputation and examples of how you align with our core company values.
Proven experience winning large, complex, new logos in the Enterprise market in Western Australia.
Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

Job Description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Digital Analytics & Optimisation Manager to join our Ticketek team based in Sydney.
About Ticketek
Ticketek has over 40 years' experience ticketing the biggest live events and venues in Australia. Ticketek sells over 23 million tickets to more than 20,000 events each year, including concerts, sports, theatre, musicals, festivals, exhibitions, experience and family events. A truly digital company, Ticketek is Australia’s number one entertainment events website, and a global leader in ticketing solutions.
The Role
Ticketek operates one of the most advanced ecommerce platforms in Australia, underpinned by one of the largest 1st party data sets. In addition, the latest marketing technology, and an advanced data science and analytics team, have seen us deliver hyper personalisation and machine learning capabilities.
We are now seeking an experienced Digital Analytics & Optimisation Manager. This individual will analyse website and sales data to identify trends, optimise customer experience, and maximize revenue growth. By providing actionable insights, the Digital Analytics Manager contributes to the overall digital strategy and helps steer initiatives aimed at improving conversion, retention, and user engagement.
Requirements
The Person
As the Digital Analytics Manager you will be responsible for:
Performance Analysis & Insights
Collect, analyse, and interpret data across Ticketek’s ecommerce platforms (e.g., website, app, marketing channels) to uncover trends and key insights that inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards to track KPIs, including traffic, conversion rates, cart abandonment, funnel analysis, and other performance metrics.
Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify areas for optimisation in the online customer journey.
Derive and circulate data-driven insights to inform UX and digital development streams
Action insights from our DX Intelligence platform to reduce customer friction points and prioritise our optimisation efforts
Performance Reporting
Provide regular performance reports and presentations to key stakeholders, including sales performance, customer behaviour insights, and campaign effectiveness.
Work with cross-functional teams to set and track goals, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.
Implement performance tracking of new products to understand customer impact
Customer Experience Optimization:
Collaborate with UX, digital marketing, and product teams to enhance the online research and buying experience and increase conversion rates.
Work closely with the Product Owner of our UX stream to test and inform future state UI and UX
Utilize A/B testing and multivariate testing to determine the impact of various design, content, and product placement changes on user behaviour.
Identify pain points in the user journey and recommend strategies to improve customer engagement, retention, and overall satisfaction.
Market and Competitor Analysis:
Monitor ecommerce trends and competitive landscape to keep the team informed of best practices, emerging tools, and potential opportunities.
Provide actionable recommendations based on market analysis to maintain a competitive edge.
Team Collaboration & Stakeholder Management:
Work closely with marketing, product, IT, and customer support teams to ensure a seamless, data-informed approach to customer engagement.
Manage the relationship with our external analytics and CRO agencies

Essential experiences & skills
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, Marketing, or a related field; advanced degree a plus.
4+ years of experience in analytics within an ecommerce or digital marketing environment.
Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Fullstory) and data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical skills, with experience in SQL, Python, or R preferred.
Proven track record of using data to drive business growth and customer experience improvements.
Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex data insights to a non-technical audience.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, and meet tight deadlines.
Benefits
Here’s a taste of what Ticketek offers:
Complimentary tickets to selected events
Birthday Leave
Volunteering Leave
Access to wellbeing discounts
Flu Vaccinations
Company Paid Parental Leave
Free Advice and Support (EAP)
What you can expect?
Global Reward and Recognition Program
Supportive and exciting Learning and Development Opportunities
Career Pathways
A commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
Great team members!
About TEG
TEG is a global leader in Live Entertainment, Ticketing and Technology. Every day TEG connects fans to experiences and customers with brands. We are proud partners of some of the world’s largest and most iconic venues as well as leading event promoters globally. TEG operates worldwide out of seven country offices and includes Ticketek, Ticketek Marketplace, Ticketek UK, Ticketek New Zealand, Ticketek Malaysia, Ticketek Philippines, Softix, TEG Live, TEG Dainty, TEG Sport, TEG Van Egmond, Laneway Festival, Handsome Tours, SXSW Sydney, TEG Theatrical, MJR Presents, TEG Lifelike Touring, TEG TES Live, Brickman, Rugby Live, TEG Europe, TEG USA, Qudos Bank Arena, FAN+, VIP NOW and Ovation.
For more information about TEG please go to http://www.teg.com.au/
TEG is an equal opportunity employer committed to embrace diversity, respect, and care for our people and communities.
If there are any adjustments that need to be made to ensure you have a fair and equitable experience in our recruitment process, please advise us when scheduling your interview.

Job Title: Senior Project Manager - Software Solutions- 12 Months Fixed Term Contract- Hybrid
Job Description:
Company Description

Ready to make a difference? Experian has evolved into a global tech company and leader in data and analytics. We're passionate about unlocking the power of data in order to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We're a member of the FTSE 30 and for more than 125 years we've helped economies and communities flourish – and we're not done.
Discover the Unexpected - Our 22k amazing employees in 30+ countries believe the possibilities for you, and the world, are growing. We're investing in the future, through new technologies, accomplished people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Job Description

We are currently looking for an experienced Senior Project Manager to join our Experian Software Solutions team. This role offers an exceptional opportunity to lead and manage a diverse portfolio of projects for our market leading clients. You will be stepping into this role as a leader and mentor, working closely with a team of senior consultants to ensure the successful delivery of project outcomes.

What you'll need to bring to the role & Experian
Advanced knowledge of program/project planning/PMO processes
Experience with project delivery in large and complex organisations with extensive Project Management experience, including knowledge of managing major, cross divisional projects
Proven track record of successful delivery of software delivery programs and projects from initiation through to full project acceptance
Experience of managing multiple stakeholder groups ranging from senior business and technology stakeholders to product owners / delivery leads
Proven experience delivering projects using both Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies

Work that matters - What you'll be doing
Leading Experian Software Solutions Projects to deliver real change for clients
o Fostering a culture of success
o Delivering and managing large Software Solutions programs/projects in line with Experian the project management methodology
o Day to day management of projects to ensure milestones and key indicators are met; managing project risks and issues, identifying solutions to meet productivity, quality and customer goals
o Monitor and track project financials
o Take accountability for project quality and identify opportunities to improve project delivery
o Clearly communicating expectations to clients' team members and stakeholder
o Troubleshooting and resolving conflicts; and creating lasting, productive partnerships with stakeholders (internal and external) at all levels.

Qualifications

More about you
Advanced knowledge of program/project planning/PMO processes
o Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively work with stakeholders at all levels
o Extensive negotiating and influencing skills
o Strong ability to facilitate change and influence a wide variety of stakeholders
o Previous experience of working in a financial services environment is desirable.
o Ideally you will have previous experience in credit decisioning and / or collections projects
o You are comfortable owning the overall delivery plan, problem solving where required and driving the project through to successful completion

Additional Information

Culture at Experian
Our uniqueness is that we truly value yours.
Experian Asia Pacific's culture, people, flexibility and environments are main differentiators. We take our people and equal opportunity agenda very seriously. We focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. We're an award-winning organisation due to our people focus (Great Place To Work, Top Employer and Employer of Choice).
Experian Asia Pacific uses cutting edge data science, inclusion and start-up mindsets to build tomorrow's credit solutions. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices. As is our diverse workforce, which drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Job Description:
Join a powerhouse of brands that connect customers, businesses and communities
Bring your boldness and stand out in an organisation that supports you to shine
Feel proud to do work that really matters and genuinely impacts communities

Bring your ‘you’ to TPG Telecom, and help us build meaningful relationships and support vibrant, connected communities. We’re better and bolder together.
TPG Telecom started with a belief that we can make things better for Australians. We believe in the power of meaningful relationships to support vibrant, connected communities where everyone belongs. It’s our why; our reason to exist. Now, we’re proud to be one of Australia’s leading mobile and internet providers. We’re not just redefining telco, we’re changing its course. And you play a role in that. A big one. The opportunities are plenty for those who are ready to accept the challenge.
Could that be you?
Your opportunity:
As the Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you will lead the Lifecycle Marketing Strategy across the entire customer journey, from onboarding to retention. You will also spearhead the transformation agenda across our marketing automation stack. Develop and execute data-driven strategies to optimise customer engagement, retention, and revenue growth. Your strong understanding of customer behaviour, ability to analyse data, effective communication skills, and robust partner and project management skills will be crucial. Additionally, your solid experience in driving marketing capability enhancements and transformation programs will be essential.
You’ll make an impact by:
Leading the development of the overarching CLM strategy and annual lifecycle marketing plan.
Developing best-in-class customer lifecycle strategies to protect, retain, and grow the customer base and maximize customer lifetime value.
Using data analysis to identify key trends and insights to drive decision-making in the development of customer lifecycle strategies.
Identifying, building, and executing complex customer journeys and targeted marketing campaigns to drive customer engagement, retention, and incremental sales.
Leading data-science partners and leveraging advanced decision science skills and CRM experience to deliver effective 1:1 campaigns with our customers.
Continuously measuring, monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on key performance indicators.
Leading the transformation of marketing automation capabilities.
Building and owning the transformational roadmap to align and enhance customer engagement.
Leading the implementation of new marketing automation capabilities, including the migration of existing “always on” campaigns.
Gaining a deep understanding of the mobile base to identify cohorts of customers who are more likely to disconnect or purchase additional services, designing treatments and offers to meet commercial outcomes while delivering great customer experiences.
Developing business cases to seek commercial approval of offers required to meet customer expectations and achieve commercial targets.
What you’ll bring:
Significant experience in data-driven marketing, customer lifecycle management. preferably in the telecommunications, financial, or membership-based industries.
Exceptional communication, influencing, persuasion, presentation and interpersonal skills
Strong independent and collaborative problem solver, a lateral thinker capable of translating creative thoughts to impactful executions.
Advanced knowledge and experience using data to enable marketing automation platforms such as Braze, Salesforce, Adobe Marketing Cloud, Marketo or Pega.
Experience working in an Agile approach and using Jira and Confluence are a plus.
Data-mining skills, with experience using SQL, R, or similar tools are a bonus.
Strong ability to work independently at pace, managing multiple projects at once
Demonstratable ability to deliver commercial outcomes from ideation to execution, including business case
Significant experience leading and delivering personalisation and customisation of marketing messages
What's in it for you?
Flexible hybrid way of working (from home and office)
‘Stay Connected Mobile’ – Access to a free mobile plan
‘Stay Connected NBN’ – Access to a free NBN 100 plan
‘Your Leave’ - an additional 4 days of leave to be used whenever you like - every year
Access to TPG Learning Hub platform and internal development opportunities
Access to Corporate Partner Discounts
Come join us and build a better future. Apply today.
We’re a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to responding to every applicant.
Don’t meet every single requirement? That’s OK! At TPG Telecom, we’re all about creating an accessible workplace where everybody feels safe to bring their authentic self to work - regardless of background. If you think this role is a great fit for you but some of the qualifications don’t align with your experience, we still encourage you to apply - you might just be the perfect candidate for a similar role with us! Job Description:
At Downer Professional Services, you’ll find purpose, impact and huge opportunity. Join us and help make it happen.
A real endeavour, achieved with you
As Australia’s multi-disciplinary advisory and business partner of choice for clients in defence, government and infrastructure, we deliver complex things that matter. It's not always an easy task, but anything worthwhile seldom is. Great things are rarely accomplished alone. We’re building something remarkable. Now we just need you.
A real endeavour, shaped by you
As a Mission Engineering Engineer, you will use digital engineering and mission engineering methodologies to enhance mission effectiveness across the capability lifecycle.
To succeed in this endeavour, you will:
Develop mission architectures integrating various systems and capabilities to achieve operational outcomes aligned with warfighter needs.
Define and articulate operational needs and business requirements in collaboration with Defence stakeholders.
Analyse requirements and system designs using systems engineering, DE tools and ME methodologies, ensuring alignment with Defence requirements and standards.
Conduct qualitative and quantitative trade space analysis to evaluate and compare alternative system-of-systems architectures, ensuring optimal mission performance.
Preparing and deliver technical reports, presentations, and recommendations based on comprehensive analyses and modelling outcomes.
Document ME processes and outcomes for continuous improvement.
A real endeavour, driven by you
Our work is highly complex and confidential, so there are some things you must have to fulfil this role:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical discipline (engineering, physics, mathematics, data science preferred)
Proven experience delivering technical solutions within Defence or Defence Industry, with a focus on engineering analysis, support, or technical consulting.
An understanding of systems engineering tools and methodologies, with experience in analysing system requirements and supporting system design activities.
Experience evaluating and comparing alternative system of systems architectures using qualitative and quantitative trade space analysis techniques.
Ability to adapt to complex, multi-disciplinary, and ambiguous situations.
Proven ability to present complex information to a variety of audiences.
You must have the ability to obtain and maintain an NV1 clearance.
More than anything, you’ll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude and a drive to manage critical projects and programs that build sovereign capability and deliver complex things that matter.
Why Downer Professional Services?
At Downer Professional Services, you’ll find the opportunity to build something remarkable. Here are some of the reasons why our people love working here:
Work with purpose. You’ll deliver or enable critical defence projects and programs in Australia, for Australia. Your expertise will help build sovereign capability.
Great projects, influence and impact. You might join us for the projects, but we think you’ll stay for the impact you can have. With high project ownership, agile problem solving and accessible leaders, you can go further at Downer Professional Services.
Your opportunity to build something remarkable. We’re proud of all we’ve achieved. But there’s much more to do. Together, we’re building a better, stronger, more agile Downer Professional Services. From process and systems to culture and communications, we're working hard to enable our teams to do their best work, whoever and wherever they are.
We encourage you to join us on our greatest endeavour. We’ll support and recognise your contribution, and you’ll also enjoy a range of benefits including:
Veteran support initiatives and policies, including up to 20 days of Reservist Leave for veterans to remain connected as they transition out of active service
An Employee Assistance Program providing access to professionals to support you (and your family) to achieve your personal or professional goals through wellbeing coaching, counselling, financial advice, legal advice and more.
Affordable healthcare covers, discounted car purchase and rental (with selected brands), and other retail discounts.
To learn more about why our people choose Downer Professional Services, read some of the stories of incredible people on our website.
Ready to join us on our biggest endeavour?
Take your career to the next level. Apply for this position by:
Clicking ‘Apply’ to complete a short form and attach your CV.
Downer Group is an employer that acknowledges and embraces the importance of our people's diverse experiences, talents, and cultures. As an inclusive employer, we welcome applications from everyone.
