Job Description:
Our Company
Seer Data is an Australian technology company helping turn data into action for people creating a better world. We democratise data access, sharing and storytelling for better decision making, impact measurement, monitoring and reporting, and aim to support improved outcomes to benefit Australian society.
The Seer Data platform is a data access, sharing, storytelling and reporting platform. It is the first and only data technology platform co-designed with hundreds of Not-for-profits, community organisations, philanthropic foundations, corporates and governments across Australia. The platform is designed to be user-friendly, enabling people of all skillsets and backgrounds to do data work themselves.
The Role
As a Seer Data Analyst, you'll play a vital role in collecting, analyzing and interpreting data to uncover insights that drive positive changes in communities for our customers. You’ll be able to meet community where they are at and help them make sense and meaning from data. Your main responsibility will be to complete customer projects according to the agreed project charter. This will involve building close working relationships with customers with varying levels of data literacy, collecting and ingesting data into the Seer Data platform, analyzing data, identifying trends, and presenting findings in a clear and actionable manner to support the needs and decisions of our customers. You’ll be a detail-oriented individual with strong communication skills and a passion for making a meaningful impact on society through data-driven insights.
Your Responsibilities
Collaborating with customers (primarily via video) to understand the problems they are trying to solve and devising data-driven solutions to assist
Building the data capability and data literacy of our customers so that they can do data themselves with the Seer Data platform and products
Contributing to the development and delivery of training courses and modules for the Seer Learning Lab and customers
Identifying, understanding and sourcing data sources and frameworks that support our customers, and engaging data custodians where required
Creating data storytelling suitcases, insights and dashboards for customers using Open and Private Data on the Seer Data platform, made up of tables, charts, summary observations and commentary and multi-media content where applicable
Creating data schema templates for customers to populate their own data, in line with Seer Data conventions and standards
Design and development of data products and solutions for the Seer Data platform and customers.
Develop and maintain databases, spreadsheets, project management software, and other tools for efficient and effective project and data management.
Data engineering and data ingestion for Open and Private data into the Seer Data Platform using python
Design of data frameworks, templates and collection for impact measurement for Seer Data and our customers
Keeping up to date with the data collections on Seer Data and seek to understand and improve the data contained
Staying informed about industry trends, data analysis and visualisation techniques, and best practices.
Your Behaviours
Detail-Oriented: Demonstrate a meticulous approach to data and its use.
Communication: Clearly and confidently convey complex data questions and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborative: Work effectively and transparently with team members and communities to achieve common goals.
Curiosity: Exhibit a keen interest in exploring data to uncover meaningful insights for communities.
Adaptability: Thrive in a complex environment, adjusting to evolving requirements and challenges.
Ethical Conduct: Uphold the highest standards of integrity and confidentiality in handling sensitive data.
Your Capabilities
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills to articulate findings and insights, tell data stories and build capacity in community.
Analytical Skills: Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques, particularly working with python, with a strong ability to interpret and explain results.
Thought leadership: Capacity to develop and explain recommendations based on analysis.
Problem-Solving: Ability to identify and address data-related issues effectively.
Project Management: Prioritize and manage tasks efficiently to meet project deadlines.
Continuous Learning: Willingness to stay updated on emerging trends in data analysis, data visualisation, data storytelling and related fields.
Your Qualifications
A qualification in a data-related field and working capability in coding is essential.
Python is the preferred coding language, however demonstrated proficiency in alternative languages and a willingness to learn python will also be considered.
Our Values
To be in Service: We love our customers; without them we don’t exist. We always seek to solve our customers’ problems, listen and do our best to meet their needs.
Have fun: We want work to be fun and have fun doing it. We also want our customers to have fun working with Seer and the Platform.
Inspire others: We are inspired! We are inspired by the work of our customers, by each other and by our vision for how we each want to change the world for the better.
Communicate openly: Everyone in the team is safe to contribute their ideas and thoughts so that we can be the best team we can be for each other and our customers.
Solve problems: We love to solve problems. Some of problems are hard to solve, and we work diligently and creatively to solve them.
Understand roles: We each have a unique and important role to play in our success and the success of our customers. We clearly understand our role and how our individual contribution is a valuable part of the entire team’s mission. We take responsibility for our role.
Achieve goals: We want to achieve our goals. We recognise and appreciate experimentation is part of the journey toward doing great things in the world.
Equal opportunity
Seer Data is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Seer Data is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don’t regard colour, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status when making our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Glebe, NSW 2037

Job Description:
The International Institute of Data & Analytics (IDA) is a not-for-profit hi-tech organization with foci on data science and big data analytics innovation, education and training, and commercialization and services. IDA offers unique experiences and engagement models for bridging the gaps between academia and business, enabling industry and government `easy to do business with’ leading scientists and specialists in data & analytics, and building a platform for engagements and collaborations between outstanding researchers, practitioners and educators.
In data science and big data analytics, the IDA creates enablers for:
Leading the field of data science and analytics innovation, training and services by building think-tank and thought leadership, and next-generation of data scientists and professionals;
transforming excellent research and innovation outcomes to actionable data science and analytics systems, tools, services and training for industry innovation and transformation; and
building a flexible and engaging culture and platform to connect local, regional and global resources in data & analytics research and business towards developing world-class centre of excellence and research networks.
You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with team leader and senior data scientists, as well as clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, problems and objectives.
Understand data structures and business and extract and integrate required data sources for analysis according to business requirements.
Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions, including undertaking data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, evaluation, deployment, and maintenance.
Collaborate with senior data scientists and team leader and clients to productise and pilot analytical models for production and insight per clients required.
Undertake cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders.
Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes.

Qualifications
Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field.
Experienced in data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms.
Demonstrated capabilities to develop and evaluate statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains.
Demonstrated knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R).
Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams.
Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member of a data science project team.
Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services.
Contact: Jinjiu.Li@idawise.com

Job Description:
Req ID: 82306
Department: AR Strategic Delivery Australia Data
Division: Australia Retail
Location: Melbourne
About Us

At ANZ, we're applying new ways technology and data can be harnessed as we work towards a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.

About the Role

As a Data Analyst within the Data Portfolio, you’ll play a key role in helping the CRR&A Data initiatives. You will collaborate closely with a team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Data Analysts, as well as business teams within the CRR&A portfolio.

Banking is changing and we’re changing with it, giving our people great opportunities to try new things, learn and grow. Whatever your role at ANZ, you’ll be building your future, while helping to build ours.

Role Type: 6 month opportunity
Role Location: Melbourne
Work Hours: Full time

What will your day look like?

This role will help the CRR&A Data team accelerate the closure of events in the backlog of our risk management system NFR Hub through a program of work designed to provide insights and improve event management processes.

As a member of the Retail Analytics CRR&A Data team, you bring advanced data analysis expertise and a passion for leveraging data to enhance our responses to regulatory requirements.

As a Data Analyst, your key accountabilities will include:
Developing management dashboards and the supporting data pipelines that contribute to regulatory reporting.
Developing standard Python/SQL queries and procedures to assist with the process optimisation.
Automating new and existing procedures and reporting workflows using Python or other scripting languages.
Providing data initiative support and expertise to product teams in Aus Retail and business teams within the CRR&A portfolio.
Developing insights and progress reporting for stakeholders.
What will you bring?

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Recent and extensive experience in a Data Analyst or Data Engineering role.
Extensive knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis, data manipulation and presentation (e.g., Python, SQL, Tableau, QlikSense).
Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced.
Strong ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations.
Strong data visualisation skills.
Ability to effectively communicate to all stakeholders (technical and non-technical).
Data engineering tools (e.g., dbt, Spark, Airflow)
Experience with Big Data/Cloud platforms and technologies (Hadoop, Kubernetes)
Knowledge Management platforms and practices (GitHub, Confluence)
Degree qualifications in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent industry experience in data analysis, engineering, or related fields.

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So why join us?

From the moment you join ANZ, you'll be doing meaningful work that will shape a world where people and communities thrive.

But it's not just our customers who'll feel your impact. You'll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you'll have the resources, opportunities, and support you need to take the next big step in your career.

We're a diverse bunch at ANZ in different roles, different locations, doing different things. That's why we have a range of flexible working arrangements, so our people can 'make work, work for them'. We also provide a range of benefits including access to health and wellbeing services and discounts on selected products and services from ANZ and more.

At ANZ, you'll be part of an organisation where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. That's because we're committed to building a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We welcome applications from everyone and encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you're a candidate with a disability or access requirement, and have an enquiry about the support provided, please let us know on your application or visit ANZ Accessibility and Inclusion Programs for alternate contact methods.

. You can apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 82306 .

10/12/2024 , 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

Job Description:
Why join us?

\uD83D\uDC9C Do work that matters. We’re pioneering AI software that will help diagnose medical images and raise the standard of healthcare for millions of people every day.
\uD83C\uDF0F Well-funded and global. Annalise.ai has a global presence across APAC, EU and US regions. We’re powered by Harrison.ai (raised Australia’s largest Series B of $129m in 2021).
\uD83C\uDF1F Work with a bunch of awesome, genuine people who are passionate about what they do.
\uD83D\uDCBB Flexible and remote-friendly working.
\uD83D\uDE80 Make an impact. You won’t be another ‘cog in the wheel’ here. We give full trust and autonomy for you to be heard, to work on big & complex projects – and to make a real difference.
\uD83C\uDF31 Grow your career with us. We’re big believers in lifelong learning. You’ll be given a $1000 personal L&D budget, access to LinkedIn Learning, plus opportunities for internal mobility and leadership training to fast-track your career.
\uD83D\uDE4C Generous parental support including 16 weeks gender-neutral paid parental leave and $10,000 support for egg or sperm freezing.

About Your Role

As a Data Analyst at Annalise.ai/Harrison.ai, you’ll be at the forefront of our data-driven decision-making process. Your insights will directly shape our product development and enhance customer experiences, making you a key player in our mission to scale global healthcare capacity using AI automation.
Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work within a small team of data and analytics professionals, utilising your strong analytical skills and interpersonal abilities to generate data-driven insights for internal and external stakeholders across customer, commercial, and product domains.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset coupled with exceptional interpersonal skills. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques is essential, along with the ability to translate findings into actionable insights.
What You'll Do:
Generate actionable insights to support decision-making across the organisation,
Investigate and troubleshoot issues at customer deployments,
Develop and maintain regular reports and dashboards for key stakeholders,
Assist in the collection, cleaning, and organisation of data from various sources, and
Present findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences.
What You Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, information systems, economics, engineering, or a related quantitative field,
Proven experience in data analysis and visualisation e.g. Tableau, Power BI or similar,
Proficiency coding in either SQL, Python or R for data manipulation and analysis,
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, and
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Nice To Haves:
Previous experience working in a medical device environment or other highly regulated field, and
Previous experience working with data from a health domain
What we’re about
We're problem solvers, redefining what’s possible in medical imaging through AI Technology. Our mission is to raise the standard of healthcare for millions of patients every day.

Yes, we’re a technology company and yes, we’re leveraging the latest AI technologies, but people are at the heart of everything we do.

Annalise.ai was formed in early 2019, powered by Harrison.ai. Since then, we’ve scaled rapidly and we’re focused on creating AI solutions that help radiologists diagnose medical images.

Our first product, the world's most comprehensive AI clinical decision-support solution for chest x-rays, is already in made available to 1 in 4 radiologists in Australia and rolling out to hundreds more, globally. This solution is capable of detecting 124 findings and was recently featured in a peer-reviewed publication, Lancet Digital Health journal.

And we’re just getting started.

Help us shape the future of AI in medical imaging. And most importantly, help us make a real difference in people’s lives.

What’s next?
If you’re inspired by what we're up to, please apply now and we'll be in touch soon.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity’s not a buzzword here, it’s in our DNA. Diverse perspectives shape our culture and make our work better. That’s why we’re committed to building inclusive teams that represent a variety of backgrounds and skills. If you need any reasonable adjustments, accessibility assistance or would like to note which pronouns you use at any stage of our hiring process, just contact us at accommodations: people@annalise.ai. We look forward to hearing from you.

Job Description:
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?
Responsibilities
Work across all aspects of data from engineering to building sophisticated visualisations, machine learning models and experiments
Analyze and interpret large (PB-scale) volumes of transactional, operational and customer data using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits
Translate complex findings into simple visualisations and recommendations for execution by operational teams and executives
Be part of a fast-paced industry and organisation where time to market is critical
Requirements
Undergraduate in a quantitative discipline, such as Mathematics/Statistics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering, or Life Sciences
Relevant work experience in an Analytics or Data Science role will be a plus
Experience with common analysis tools such as SQL, R, and Python
Experience with at least one data visualization tool (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, etc.)
A self-driven team player with the ability to quickly learn and apply new tools and techniques such as proprietary analytical software, data models and programming languages
A natural curiosity to identify, investigate and explain trends and patterns in data and an ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication
A passion for Emerging Technologies related to Blockchain, Machine Learning and AI
(Good to have) Experience and understanding of Blockchain concepts and mechanics (Defi, NFT, Metaverse, etc..)

Job Description:
About Bottrell Business Consultants
Bottrell Business Consultants is a premier provider of accounting, tax, business advisory, and financial planning services across Newcastle and Maitland. Our team is dedicated to supporting client success with data-driven insights and strategies, and we are looking to expand with a Data Analyst who can turn complex data into actionable business insights.
The Role
We are seeking an analytical and results-oriented Data Analyst to support our advisory and accounting services. In this role, you will gather, analyze, and interpret financial and operational data, providing insights that drive strategic client decisions. You’ll work closely with our accounting and advisory teams, helping clients understand key metrics and optimize their financial and business performance.
Key Responsibilities
Data Collection & Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze financial and operational data from client accounts and internal sources.
Financial Reporting: Prepare and present reports on key performance indicators (KPIs), financial metrics, and business trends.
Business Insights: Provide actionable insights and recommendations to clients, supporting strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.
Forecasting & Modeling: Develop financial forecasts, trend analyses, and predictive models to assist clients with planning and growth.
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards for data visualization, making complex information easily accessible to clients.
Collaborative Support: Work closely with accountants and business advisors to align data insights with client objectives.
Candidate Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
Proven experience in a data analysis role, preferably within an accounting or business advisory environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau) and accounting software is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and communicate complex data.
Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team, supporting a client-focused approach.
Why Join Bottrell Business Consultants?
At Bottrell Business Consultants, we provide a supportive work environment with opportunities for professional development. With offices in Newcastle and East Maitland, you’ll be part of a team that values innovation, client success, and data-driven decision-making.
Apply Today
If you’re a data-driven professional ready to contribute to meaningful client outcomes, we encourage you to apply. For questions, please contact office@bottrellbusiness.com.au or (02) 4933 6888.
#DataAnalyst #BusinessAnalytics #NewcastleJobs #MaitlandJobs #BottrellBusinessConsultants #FinanceData #CareerInData #NSWFinanceRoles
Skills: Skills: Power BI, Microsoft Excel, Data analysis skills, Tableau, SQL

Job Description:
At BAE Systems Australia
Do interesting work that MATTERS
ENJOY what you do
GROW your career
Be YOU
We work in a thriving sector - one that puts us at the forefront of exciting and meaningful work. Every day we push boundaries to produce some of the world's most innovative and ground breaking technology. Individually we all contribute to our success. Collectively we make the impossible possible.
Recognised for delivering projects of global and national significance that help keep Australia safe, it is our shared passion that shapes our culture, and our people that make it a great place to work.
About the OPPORTUNITY
We currently have an exciting new opportunity to join us a Delivery Data Analyst where you will be part of Australia's premier defence project! Supporting the Hunter Class Frigate Program.
Reporting to the Detailed Design Delivery Lead, you will be responsible for developing schedules and task tracking lists, providing actionable insights through data analysis, and creating automated solutions to streamline processes and improve efficiency. The role requires close collaboration with cross-functional teams, particularly engineering and CAD teams, to ensure seamless data flow, accurate task tracking, and optimized data governance practices.
This role will be based out of our Osborne Shipyard office. We embrace flexible work arrangements at BAE Systems Australia, such as working a 9-day fortnight.
Visit this link to if you want to know more about the Hunter Class Frigate program: https://www.baesystems.com/en-aus/what-we-do/hunter
Key responsibilities will include:
Maintain and update Product Lifecycle Management data within scheduling and reporting tools, ensuring high standards of data integrity and consistency.
Ensure CAD drawings and task data are integrated accurately across reporting databases and schedules
Track and analyse task progress, resource allocation, and delivery milestones to support project management goals.
Facilitate real-time data synchronization between CAD models and scheduling systems to ensure current information is available for production planning.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools e.g., Tableau, Power BI to support Earned Value Management (EVM), monitor resource usage, and provide forecast insights.
Identify and implement process improvements for data management and integration to increase efficiency and reduce errors in reporting.
About YOU
You'll have:
Relevant qualification related to Computer Science, Business Analysis, Data Analytics or similar
Proficient in analysing in data analysis management tools, including Python, SQL and Excel
Proficient in analysing complex datasets and integrating data from various systems
A strong focus on process optimisation and workflow automation
A background working with engineering and CAD designers is highly preferred
Familiarity with PLM Systems (e.g. Windchil) and CAD software's (e.g. AutoCAD, SolidWorks or Think Design) is preferred
We believe in hiring for potential, we know that some candidate hesitate if they don't tick all the boxes. If this role interests you, but you don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply.
About US
You will joining a workplace that truly cares about your wellbeing.
Our people are diverse and we value the variety of perspectives this brings, we know that a culture that is inclusive and fosters a sense of belonging is a place we can all make the most of our unique talents and be our best.
As Australia's largest defence company in a rapidly growing sector, you will be connected into a global team and encouraged to explore where your career might take you whether that is a traditional career path or squiggly one, there are infinite possibilities for you at BAE Systems Australia.
We welcome applicants from all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, pregnancy, age, or other lived experience; and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all positions.
We are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice for women by WORK180.
As a member of the Circle Back Initiative we commit to respond to every applicant
To learn more about our competitive employee benefits, flexibility, other employment opportunities and what to expect from our recruitment process please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au
Clearances
As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and either possess or be eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearances.
Further information regarding security clearances.
International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

Job Description:
About the job Data Analyst
JD for Data Insights & Analytics Analyst role:
As a Data Insights & Analytics Analyst, you are an important contributor to analysing business
problems and recommending solutions which drive data decision making within our organisation.

You will also be working closely with Data Engineering & Data Science teammates and the Product

Owner on identifying and documenting technical and business requirements to facilitate the

development of new data solutions. To be successful in this role, you will ideally be experienced in

working with Data warehouse solutions for a large organisation coupled with Business Analyst skills.

You will be responsible for:
Probe, source and manipulate large data sets to resolve issues or develop a solution to enable
business decisions
Defining business Problems, assist with the development of hypothesis, undertake relevant

reporting, summarise insights and make recommendations for actions.

Investigating and analysing large datasets to help resolve business problems or develop a

solution to enable business decisions.

Visualising data using Power BI, and creating dashboards that integrate data from multiple

source systems to analyse, track and report on different Metrics.

Identify stakeholder pain points, provide insights reporting and root cause analysis to

support Product Owners.

Breaking down the business requirements in epics and user stories, elaborating and handing

over to the technical team for development.

Supporting the technical team with their queries.



To be successful in this role, you need to have:

Knowledge in business requirements gathering, data profiling, and data analysis.

Good knowledge of SQL to extract, join and transform data.

Data visualisation including working with an enterprise data visualisation platform such as

Tableau or Power BI.

Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

A proactive and self-motivated approach with customer / stakeholder centric mindset.

Exposure to workday data and People Analytics will be a plus.

Relevant Tertiary qualification or equivalent experience on computer science or data science.

Familiarity of Agile working model.

Experience in agile tools such as Jira, Confluence etc

Job Description:
Working at Transurban is different; it’s a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions—building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads—to solve pressing transport challenges that are slowing cities down.

About the role

Sitting at the intersection of data engineering and business analytics, this role bridges the gap by transforming raw data into structured, accessible, and reliable formats that drive decision-making. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Insights team, you’ll focus on building data pipelines, cataloging, purging outdated information, and structuring data for optimal use, while maintaining a deep understanding of its business context. By enabling seamless data workflows and connecting technical processes with strategic needs, you’ll play a critical role in empowering teams to derive meaningful insights and enhance customer outcomes.

This role is perfect for someone passionate about shaping data systems and ensuring their accuracy and reliability to support business success.

As our Data Analyst you’ll contribute to lasting and positive changes that shape the future of our cities and communities. It’s meaningful, challenging and exciting work.

Day-to-day, you will:

Manipulate, transform, and analyse large datasets to uncover key insights and opportunities.
Build and maintain data pipelines and models to ensure optimal access to customer data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align on data-driven decision-making.
Present insights and recommendations to influence strategic business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and reliability through robust quality assurance processes.
Streamline data workflows and propose enhancements for greater efficiency.
Develop tools and techniques to improve reporting and analysis capabilities.
Support customer data integration across various platforms and systems.

This role will suit someone with a curious mind and transferrable skills and experiences, including:

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics or business information degree.
Proven experience in a data-focused role, with a passion for problem-solving and innovation.
Proficiency in SQL and experience working with large datasets and relational databases.
Familiarity with tools such as Dataiku or DataIQ similar ETL platforms is advantageous.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to derive actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills to present complex findings clearly and effectively.
Experience with data modelling, pipeline development, and analytical tools.
A collaborative mindset and a proactive approach to continuous improvement.

If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.

With a career at Transurban, you’ll enjoy a range of benefits, including:

A range of flexible working and leave options, including the option to purchase an additional six weeks of leave each year
16 weeks paid parental leave (regardless of gender or carer status), with no waiting period, with Superannuation paid during unpaid leave as well
Learning and development opportunities to support your career interests
Health and wellbeing support—access to Headspace and our EAP program, wellness facilities, and more
Share offers and insurance benefits
Social activities, community give-back programs and paid volunteer days

We offer a range of flexible working and leave options, so you can balance your work and life commitments and interests. Have a conversation with us about how this could work for you.

We embrace diversity with a foundation of safety, wellbeing and inclusion; where everyone belongs. We treat everyone with fairness, consideration and respect, regardless of gender, gender identity, marital or family status, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, religious beliefs, cultural or socio-economic background, perspective, and experience – whether they work for us or not. We want to ensure everyone feels comfortable and safe to express ideas, questions and concerns.

We strongly encourage applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people living with disability. If you require any adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please contact us on
careers@transurban.com
.

Ready to help us keep cities moving? Apply today.

Job Description:
Job no: 511510
Work type: Full time
Location: VIC - Metro
Categories: Information Technology, Merchandise
Iconic Australian owned and operated global retail business
Must have 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on forecasting models.
Hybrid role with a vibrant team culture where we embrace pace, encourage new ideas & leadership

Spotlight Retail Group is searching for a talented Data Analyst to join our team.
As a Data Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions and responsible for analysing large datasets, identifying trends, and developing sophisticated forecasting models to optimize our business operations.

Here's What Awaits You
Data Mastery: Collect, clean, and transform complex data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Model Development: Build and implement advanced forecasting models using statistical and machine learning techniques (e.g., ARIMA, SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, Prophet, and more).
Insight Generation: Analyse model performance, interpret results, and communicate actionable insights to key stakeholders.
Visual Storytelling: Create compelling visualizations and dashboards to effectively communicate complex data and trends.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest data technologies and techniques, and actively contribute to process improvements.

What We Are Looking For
Must have 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on forecasting models.
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and time-series analysis.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with a strong attention to detail.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is a plus.
Retail industry experience is highly valued.

What’s in it for you?
We pride ourself on providing our team members incredible career- growth and opportunities as part of the Spotlight Group team, we can offer you:
Exposure to key senior stakeholders and opportunities across one of Australia’s largest Private Businesses with continuing growth
Career progression, personal development, and mentoring
A culture that rewards initiative and creativity
Benefits – Discounts across all brands, EAP, Gym Membership Discounts and more

Who We Are
Spotlight Group Holdings (SGH) is a privately held $3bn+ Australian parent company which controls, operates and invests in a diverse set of businesses and assets.
Comprising of the long term existing iconic brands in Spotlight, Anaconda and Mountain Designs, together with the exciting addition of Harris Scarfe, SRG is acknowledged as the market leaders within the Australian retail Space.

Job Description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst - Money.
In this position you will play a key role in analysing and reporting on financial data to drive strategic insights and decision-making. Key outcomes include improved customer acquisition, retention, and alignment with business goals, measured by positive changes in key performance indicators.

Let’s look at some key responsibilities:
Analyse data on lending products, including funnel performance, to provide insights on key performance metrics and make recommendations to enhance leading indicators and overall performance.
Apply technical expertise in quantitative analysis, experimentation, and data presentation to develop strategies for our business and help solve its biggest challenges.
Identify and measure the success of product initiatives via reporting and conducting post implementation reviews.
Develop hypotheses via statistical approaches, using different methodologies and frameworks to test them.
Ensure compliance with data governance requirements to maintain data integrity and security
Use data insights to work alongside the Product Management team to shape product development and experience and quantify new opportunities.

Ideally, we're looking for the following:
Let’s look at you:
Analyse data on lending products, including funnel performance, to provide insights on key performance metrics and make recommendations to enhance leading indicators and overall performance.
Apply technical expertise in quantitative analysis, experimentation, and data presentation to develop strategies for our business and help solve its biggest challenges.
Identify and measure the success of product initiatives via reporting and conducting post implementation reviews.
Develop hypotheses via statistical approaches, using different methodologies and frameworks to test them.
Ensure compliance with data governance requirements to maintain data integrity and security
Use data insights to work alongside the Product Management team to shape product development and experience and quantify new opportunities.

Sometimes the best candidates don’t have 100% of what is listed above, but if you have most and are confident you’d be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you!
Recognition @ Latitude: Education support, Better giving programme with charity partners, Latitude matches dollar for dollar and Community partner days
Flexibility @ Latitude: Flexible work arrangements - balance work and personal responsibilities, Hybrid set up - work from home & the office, 3 Days paid volunteer leave annually, paid community service leave, paid compassionate / bereavement leave
Yearly salary reviews

Sound like you? That's a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas, we offer a flexible working environment and great compensation. We always support a safe, healthy, engaging, and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home and office, or a combination of both.
We're Latitude, partners in money Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it's taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans are what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better. Always living and breathing our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious.

Southern Adelaide Local Health Network – Flinders Medical Centre – Corporate and Finance

We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Corporate and Finance Team!
As the Senior Data Analyst you will work as a part of a team responsible for the support, maintenance, development, and continuous improvement of SALHN’s data and analytics platform. Accountable to the Digital Health Lead, SALHN you will provide insights, advice, training, and education to key stakeholders and provide mentorship and leadership to direct reports and junior staff.

Scope, develop, test and deliver appropriate Business Intelligence Applications to support data analytics, reporting, visualisations and business analysis
Ensure SALHN’s business priorities and data needs are achieved by undertaking complex investigations and analysis and developing and delivering expert assessments, recommendations and reports to management and staff

Self-motivated, organised, demonstrated initiative and an ability to operate independently while remaining focussed on agreed objectives that may have competing priorities and meeting tight deadlines
Demonstrated skills in analysing and interpreting data, communicating the information concisely and accurately, in either verbal or written format to accommodate the key stakeholder audience
Tertiary qualification/s in Public Health, Information Management, Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Technology, or related discipline
Extensive experience in working with computer systems and applications including business intelligence, spreadsheets, word processing, databases, statistical packages, and clinical costing systems

Job Description:
Wenco International Mining Systems (www.wencomine.com), a subsidiary of Hitachi Construction Machinery (HCM), provides industry leading, innovative technologies to customers in the mining and material movement sectors, enabling sustainable and safe operations.

Reporting to the Manager, Global Customer Experience, in the Consite Mine PoV team, the Data Analyst will be a subject matter expert in interpreting data and communicating insights on the performance and health of heavy mining equipment. You will collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their questions and leverage data to provide meaningful answers and solutions. This may involve the development of new data products to answer existing and emerging business challenges. You will gain an in-depth understanding of diverse data sets related to equipment performance and determine the best methods for processing and visualizing this data. Your work will facilitate action and assist end users in deriving value from available data.

Key Deliverables and Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Preparation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data from various sources. Develop data products and ensure data quality and consistency for analysis.
Data Analysis and Modelling: Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyse large datasets and identify patterns, trends, and anomalies. Build predictive models to optimize mining operations and equipment maintenance.
Visualization and Reporting: Create data visualizations and reports to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders, including management and operational teams. Develop interactive dashboards for real-time monitoring of mining processes.
Optimization and Efficiency: Work closely with engineers and mining experts to identify areas for improvement in operational efficiency of equipment. Collaborate on the development of algorithms and tools for automated decision support.
Experiment Designs and Results: Create plans and desired outcomes of studies that test the effects of different variables or interventions on asset health and productivity outcomes. May include experimental setups, data collection methods, statistical tests, and conclusions.
Dashboards and Applications: Create interactive tools that allow users to access, explore, and manipulate pre-aggregated and organised data products. May include graphs, charts, tables, filters, sliders, and other widgets that enable data visualization and user interaction.
Analysis Reports: Make documents or presentations that summarize the findings and insights from data exploration and analysis. May include descriptive statistics, visualizations, hypotheses, and recommendations for further actions or improvements.
Data Models: Develop machine learning, statistical and logical based models to produce outputs, predictions, classification, or recommendations. They may also include the data preprocessing and postprocessing steps.
Experience and Knowledge
Bachelor or higher degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering or similar.
Strong background in data exploration, statistics, data visualization, communication and problem-solving
Able to define the problem, scope the project, plan the resources, monitor the progress, evaluate the results, and deliver the solutions.
Proficient with data analysis, cleaning, visualization, and programming languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript.
Experience in SQL is essential
Experience with Grafana is a strong plus
Experience with visualisation libraries is a plus (Plotly, Matplotlib etc.)
Experience in using data on cloud computing, and big data platforms
Knowledge in data quality management practices, ensuring compliance and accuracy in data handling.
Experience in heavy industry is a plus
Fluency in English is a must, Japanese language ability is a plus.
Travel of up to 10% may be required (must have a valid passport and legally be able to travel internationally if required)
Skills and Abilities
Proactive technical problem solver.
Understand business context, objectives, and impact of their work.
Communicate clearly and effectively with different audiences, such as technical peers, business analysts, managers, and customers.
Proven self-starter with ability to turn objectives into actions and results.
Present their findings and recommendations using compelling and engaging visualizations and stories.
Think critically and creatively and generate new ideas and insights from data.
Contribute to a team environment towards common goals, be open to work sometimes outside of comfort zone to meet objectives.
Wenco advances the efficiency and safety of the world’s surface mining equipment through our fleet management systems. We are committed to providing a stable yet exciting work place environment for individual employees to build and grow their career with the Company.
Wenco is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description:
What You'll Do:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to support our
commercial teams in Australia, within the broader Pacific region. As part of our
APAC Analytics team, your role will be pivotal in harnessing our extensive
shopper and retailer data, combined with a deep understanding of performance
marketing and retail media technology, to provide actionable insights and
recommendations to some of the largest retailers and brands in Australia.
In this role, you'll have privileged access to one of the world's largest datasets,
alongside the computational power required to deliver insights into shopper
behavior, market trends, and product performance that can't be found anywhere
else.
The scope of this role involves technically rigorous work, including the use of
leading-edge data analysis technologies and daily interaction with other cross-
functional business units and external clients. Criteo’s high-growth business
model brings both opportunities and challenges. The ideal candidate functions
with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.
Performance Optimization: You will analyze complex data from multiple sources to gain a comprehensive understanding of campaign and retailer performance, detect root causes of issues, identify growth opportunities, and generate innovative and impactful insights for our clients.
Strategic Client Support: As the sole Data Analyst for Australia, you will collaborate closely with the commercial and technical teams to support and cultivate deep strategic relationships with clients, guiding their strategies and aligning with their long-term goals.
Reporting Tools and Metrics: You will develop and scale reports and metrics that provide actionable insights to various teams across the organization, including strategic leadership teams.
Testing: You will design, monitor, and analyze A/B tests to gain deeper insights into how our products perform for our clients.
Collaborative Projects: Collaborating on ad hoc projects with different teams (Commercial, Operations, Product, R&D, teams...) from different regions, you will automate analyses on a global scale, enhance internal processes, streamline workflows, and disseminate knowledge throughout the company.
Expertise Development: In parallel, you will develop a deep understanding of the online marketing ecosystem, with a strong emphasis on the retail media sector, while also providing support to our broader performance marketing business. Simultaneously, you will refine your analytical skills, devising new models and automation schemes to drive continuous improvement.
Australia Representation: You will represent Australia within the broader APAC Analytics community, ensuring that the country's insights and learnings are effectively shared across the APAC region.
Who You Are:
Your work experience: 3+ years in an analytical role in Technology, Consulting,
with a good understanding of internet advertising technologies (cookies, DSP,
SSP, RTB, etc.)

Your academic background: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a quantitative
or business discipline, with a primary emphasis on Analytics (Statistics,
Mathematics, Computer Science, and related areas....).

Your Analytics skills: You possess a comprehensive grasp of relational
databases, data architecture/governance, and the practical application of
statistical concepts, especially within a testing context. Your strength lies in your
exceptional attention to detail, complemented by your capacity to envision the
broader strategic picture.

Your technical skills: You have hands-on experience in working with databases,
have some programming experience, and are a fast learner. SQL and Python are
a must. Bonus point if you have experience in using technologies such as
Hadoop, Hive, Vertica, Tableau.

Your business skills: You are client-focused, able to create and convey clear
messages and straightforward recommendations, and have experience in
discussing with clients. You are able to explain technical concepts to a non-
technical audience. Engaging with clients and holding discussions is a crucial
aspect of this position.

Your personality: You are versatile, autonomous, able to multi-task and
prioritize; you like to interact and collaborate with people from various
backgrounds, mindsets, and cultures.
We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!
Who We Are:
Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.
Why Join Us:
At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Job Description:
At Carma, we’re more than just a car company, we’re on a mission to shake up the Australian automotive industry! As a digital pre-owned car dealership, we’re turning the car buying experience into a hassle-free, seamless journey that customers can truly enjoy. With our diverse and collaborative team managing everything from engineering to marketing and buying to reconditioning in-house, we’re powered by the best people and we’d love for you to come along for the ride.
The Data and Business Insights Analyst is responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions and growth at Carma. This role will work alongside various stakeholders and departments including buying, operations, sales, technology and marketing to support data-driven decision making across the organisation.
HOW YOU’LL DO IT
Gather, analyse and interpret internal and external data and create insightful, actionable reports to support business decisions
Input as a key stakeholder into the data management strategy and contribute to building consolidated, curated, reusable and fit-for-purpose data assets for the business
Interact with our engineering team to leverage Carma Data Platform in Snowflake and build reusable data assets using best practice engineering techniques (source control, DBT, automatic deployment and data pipelines).
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics
Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify trends, opportunities and areas for improvement
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations
Perform ad-hoc analyses to support various business needs
Present findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices for data collection, storage, and analysis
Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in data analytics and business intelligence tools
WHAT YOU’LL BRING
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role
Strong numerical and analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate them into actionable insights
Excellent proficiency in data analysis and visualisation tools including Excel, Power BI or similar
Strong SQL and database knowledge and experience
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
You are a team player with an ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with stakeholders across the business and manage multiple projects simultaneously
You are results driven with a continuous improvement mindset
Experience in automotive or e-commerce industries preferred, but not essential
An undergraduate degree in data, statistics, mathematics, business or a related field
This is a full time position based in Alexandria Sydney, with flexibility for hybrid working (2 days from home per week).

Job Description:
Sustainability Data Analyst
Job No.: 996996
Location: Melbourne - CBD & Inner
Job type: Full-Time
Country Road Group (CRG) is embarking on transformation to position itself for growth, leveraging our scale, capabilities and culture as a House of Brands. We are investing in new and existing capabilities and have a number of exciting opportunities available.
The Sustainability Data Analyst is responsible for coordinating data collection activities across the group relating to environment, human rights and ethical sourcing and community partnerships. This role reduces regulatory and legal risk by maintaining accurate and assurable datasets through controlled collection, collation, storage and management processes, and delivers accurate and insightful sustainability reporting that enables effective decision-making by CRG stakeholders.
The Sustainability Data Analyst will lead data science and reporting activities to create insights and support CRG’s regulatory reporting obligations and will proactively work to strengthen CRG’s data systems.
Key Accountabilities
Collect, analyse and interpret environmental and social sustainability data across CRG (e.g. energy, packaging, ethical sourcing, community partnership impact and donations)
Undertake data cleansing as required and ensure that data sets are accurately maintained
Lead data science and reporting activities to create insights and support CRG’s regulatory reporting obligations
Prepare reports and dashboards on business sustainability performance and product sustainability substantiation, highlighting key insights and trends
Support the evolution of our Good Business Journey by providing decision-useful data insights and trends
Support the delivery of key internal and external sustainability disclosures, including annual WHL and APCO packaging reporting, modern slavery statement and upcoming climate disclosures (AASB S2), as well as ad hoc external reporting requirements
Support the claims substantiation process by maintaining and updating the key data points relating to styles, purchase orders and PLM attributes in the centralised claims validation reconciliation report
Key Capabilities
Bachelor degree in Science, Sustainability, Applied Data Science or Information Technology (completed or in the process of completing)
Experience in data analysis for sustainability or other business-wide non-financial datasets.
Familiarity with sustainability reporting (e.g. Global Reporting Index) and carbon accounting frameworks (e.g. NGERS, GHG Protocol) desired.
Experience with Scope 3 GHG emissions data capture and analysis highly favourable.
Proficiency in Microsoft reporting software, including Excel and Power BI
Familiarity with common analysis software tools, including SQL databases
Strong communication skills, with clear understanding of the needs of different stakeholders and report audiences
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a strong eye for detail
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Has a passion for sustainability and driving positive outcomes
Why work for CRG?
The Country Road Group is one of Australasia’s largest Lifestyle Brand Houses comprising of iconic brands such as Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Here are some of the great things we offer:
Generous employee discounts across our House of Brands
Seasonal clothing allowance
An additional day of leave for your birthday
An Industry leading Parental Leave Program
Flexible working arrangements to support work/life balance
Annual learning calendar to support the ongoing development of our team
Support community partnerships across our Corporate Social Responsibility Program
We are committed to operating ethically, sustainably, and responsibly.
Country Road Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.

Country Road Group prefers to manage all sourcing directly, please submit your applications to this role if you are interested. Please note introductions via agency will not be accepted.

Job Description:
Data Analyst
Job Reference: 13425

Healius is an ASX-listed company providing world-class diagnostic services to consumers and doctors across Australia. Healius is supported by a team of Pathologists and Radiologists operating through a national network of 2,185 collections centres, 96 labs, and a portfolio of 18 different brands.

Healius is embarking on a major strategic transformation journey to re-imagine healthcare and create customer-centric health services that leverage the latest technologies. To embark on this journey Healius is looking for highly talented individuals that are passionate about healthcare and creating a positive impact.

As Data Analyst you will work with the Analytics team to discover and communicate insights into the business. This position is expected to work with a variety of stakeholders from different parts of the business to solve their analytics problems, as well as technical stakeholders to ensure data is accurate. This roles offer a package of $100 500.

Responsibilities:
Undertake analysis to uncover insights from a wide range of datasets
Development of dashboards using data visualization techniques to track key metrics for each of the businesses
Work with internal stakeholders to understand business drivers, provide ad-hoc analysis and communicate insights & actions
Work with analytics team to identify new data sources and specify data warehouse requirements
Learn & apply new analytics techniques


Skills and Experience

Strong SQL skills, able to interpret and produce complex SQL queries
Strong Power BI skills
Proficiency in Excel and/or Python advantageous
Passionate about using data to deliver actionable insights
Tech savvy, passion for learning different software
Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing priorities
2-3 years’ experience in an analytics environment developing dashboards & undertaking ad-hoc analysis
.

Fitness Passport – Access top fitness centres & pools across Australia at a subsidised rate.
Corporate health insurance discounts, banking benefits and novated leasing salary packaging.
Career growth and development opportunities with access to a comprehensive library of online courses and learning paths via our e-learning platform.
Confidential health and well-being support through our Employee Assistance Program, available to all employees and their family members.

Our Commitment to Diversity And Inclusion


Healius Pathology is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We seek to recruit from diverse applicants and create teams with skills, perspectives and experiences that complement each other at work. We welcome suitably qualified applicants regardless of age, ethnicity, socio-cultural background, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity.


Healius is committed to supporting Veteran Employment - Veterans and candidates with Australian Defence Force (ADF) experience are encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Sports Consultancy and Data Analyst Intern (Futures Sport & Entertainment)
Job Description:
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Requisition ID: 12284
Futures Sport and Entertainment
With offices in Sydney, London and New York we provide strategic consultancy services based on market leading analytics, to service premier sport’s governing bodies, leagues, teams and broadcasters across the globe. Internationally, our clients include the NFL, NBA, NHL, Manchester United, Adidas, PlayStation and the UFC whilst domestically we work alongside Tennis Australia, and Supercars to name a few.
An opportunity exists to join our team as part of a course-credit internship requirement, that will provide you with hands-on experience and a true taste for the sports industry and our business in consultancy, research and insights.
Working in either a single block or on a regular part-time basis you’ll be partnered with a Graduate Analyst or Analyst for the duration of your internship, briefly shadowing their experience while also getting an immediate opportunity to immerse yourself in the collection, review and analysis of real-life data. From the get-go interns are given the opportunity to understand how to interpret data and form insights that will inform commercial and business strategy that shapes the Australian sports landscape.
Specifically, the internship will see you undertake:
Use of internal apps and software to collect and store data required by analysts
Collection and cleaning of sports match data to explain trends in audiences and brand exposure patterns, boosting your Excel skills
Analysis and insights to help understand patterns in camerawork and drivers of brand exposure during sports broadcasts, putting your creative thinking to the test, through watching sport!
Analysis and summary of trends in Futures sports fan surveys
Other administration tasks requiring strong attention to detail

Have an interest in sport and the business of sport and entertainment
Be a driven and diligent self-starter
Have meticulous attention to detail
Have high academic grades
Ideally have experience with Excel

You are currently enrolled in an Australian tertiary course that requires you to undertake an internship/placement (arranged by the educational institution or the students’ own initiative) in line with the requirements of your course

Job Description:
Our Marketing Data Analysts work with our Customers to get their marketing and sales data into our Product, GrowthOS.We've built DataOS to help with this process, so you'll learn that product and become a subject matter expert for our Customers.This role is a combination of Customer Success, Marketing Analytics with some project management.You could come from one of those backgrounds or possibly Digital/Media agency strategy or analyst and want to move into the tech & startup world.
When customers with with Mutinex to measure their marketing effectiveness, you'll run the process to get their critical marketing data into our GrowthOS product, leveraging DataOS as the tool for gathering, collecting and ingesting that data.You'll be able to read marketing data and recognise the difference between good and bad marketing data. You can spot problems in datasets and know how to find & extract data from other sources.Working in the Customer team with other Marketing Analysts, you'll manage multiple customer projects at once which will require good organisational skills.
Key Responsibilities:
● Data Integration: Responsible for integrating marketing and sales data into our
GrowthOS product, within the specified timeframes. Ensure adherence to data quality
standards and alignment with business objectives under supervision.
● Learn DataOS: Develop a strong understanding of DataOS. Support senior team
members in guiding customers through the data ingestion process, focusing on clear
and accurate data interpretation and utilisation.
● Data Analysis: Perform analysis of marketing data to distinguish between different
quality datasets. Assist in identifying and resolving data-related issues with the
guidance of senior analysts.
● Collaboration with Teams: Collaborate with the Data Science, Product,
Engineering, and Customer Success teams. Contribute to ensuring integrated efforts
and learn to align these teams towards common goals and customer
experiences.Responsible for internal communications, ensuring effective project
updates using tools like Salesforce, Slack and Jira.
● Project Management: Manage and prioritise multiple customer projects. Develop
organisational skills and learn to handle project demands effectively under the
guidance of senior staff.
● Customer Interaction: Assist in building and maintaining relationships with
customers. Support senior team members in providing strategic recommendations on
datasets, structure, and quality.
● Professional Development: Engage in continuous learning opportunities. Contribute
to personal and professional growth, and the advancement of the team and
organisation.
What we are looking for:
● Around 1 years+ commercial experience in roles that require analysis of
marketing data
● Exploratory data analysis (EDA)
● Good SQL & Python knowledge
● Strong customer facing ability including communication, stakeholder
management & time management
● Highly organised people looking to join an exciting, fast-growing tech start up
ABOUT MUTINEX:
We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.
Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.
We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.
Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.
Founded in Australia, we've hit millions in ARR & have (very!) recent funding ($5 million in May 2023 & $9.5 million in October 2023 backed by EVP, and most recently $17.5m) that we'll use for growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.
We have a hybrid work environment at two days a week in the office (Monday, Friday) with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and New York.
With a team of around 70 people, we value high-quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.
Equity (ESOP) is offered to all staff on top of their salary and we also offer additional annual leave after 1 year of tenure (from 20 to 25 days a year) that continues to grow another day each year of service until you max out at 30 days per year.

Performance bonus

commercial experience in marketing data: 1 year (Required)

Job Description:
Binance is a leading global blockchain ecosystem behind the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume and registered users. We are trusted by over 230 million people in 100+ countries for our industry-leading security, user fund transparency, trading engine speed, deep liquidity, and an unmatched portfolio of digital-asset products. Binance offerings range from trading and finance to education, research, payments, institutional services, Web3 features, and more. We leverage the power of digital assets and blockchain to build an inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world.
Responsibilities
Work across all aspects of data from engineering to building sophisticated visualisations, machine learning models and experiments
Analyze and interpret large (PB-scale) volumes of transactional, operational and customer data using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits
Translate complex findings into simple visualisations and recommendations for execution by operational teams and executives
Be part of a fast-paced industry and organisation where time to market is critical
Requirements
Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as Mathematics/Statistics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering, or Life Sciences
3-5 years of full-time work experience in an Analytics or Data Science role

A natural curiosity to identify, investigate and explain trends and patterns in data and an ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication
A passion for Emerging Technologies related to Blockchain, Machine Learning and AI

Competency in two or more of the following:
An analytical software (e.g. R, SAS)
A data visualisation tool (e.g. Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI,)
A relational or graph database management tool (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Neo4J)
Programming (e.g. VBA, C++, Java, Python)

Why Binance
Shape the future with the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem

Thrive in a results-driven workplace with opportunities for career growth and continuous learning

Job Description:
$83,706 - $89,659 + up to 15.4% Superannuation
Campbell Park - ACT


The Role
Do you enjoy working with data to solve real-world problems? Are you ready to contribute to critical logistics business intelligence and analytics processes that support Defence’s mission? Join us as a Logistics Data Analyst, where your skills in data analysis and visualisation will drive insights and decision-making across Defence’s supply chain.

As a Logistics Data Analyst, you will work within a collaborative team to collect, analyse, and interpret logistics data, ensuring that the Joint Logistics Command is equipped with the information needed to optimise supply chain performance. Your insights will directly contribute to improving inventory management, forecasting accuracy, and operational preparedness.

About our Team
The Directorate of Logistics Performance and Improvement (DLPI) is a dynamic team that is involved in a wide range of Logistics improvements initiatives across Defence. The Directorate provides the Executive Director Logistics Assurance (EDLA) and Commander Joint Logistics (CJLOG) with the capability to lead reform by identifying and implementing logistics improvement activities across JLC and the wider DLN.

Much of the Directorates work to date has involved the identification of strategies to remediate existing logistic concerns identified by the Australian National Audit Office (ANAO) and the Defence Integrity Division. The Directorate is actively involved in business improvement initiatives in the Joint Logistics Units and wider Defence, including volumetrics and supporting the preparation and implementation of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP).

Our Ideal Candidate
As the ideal candidate, you enjoy the challenge of resolving complex problems while maintaining accountability and transparency in the process.
Strong analytical skills and a keen eye for identifying trends and insights.
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and reporting.
Knowledge of logistics or supply chain operations.
Proficiency in SQL or other database query languages.
Good communication skills to present complex data in a clear and actionable manner.
Advanced user of Microsoft Office suite of applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and analyse logistics data from various sources.
Assist with the development and maintenance of logistics dashboards and reports to monitor key logistics performance metrics.
Provide insights to support decision-making in areas such as inventory management, demand forecasting, and transportation optimisation.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of logistics data systems.
