Job Description:
Overview:
Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
Responsibilities:
We are looking for a motivated Program Manager to join the CTO Strategic Initiatives team focused on workforce planning and execution (Lighthouse). In this role, you will report to the Head of Lighthouse. As a key member of this dynamic group, you will be responsible for cyclical workforce planning activities, including collaborating with various team members, partners, SMEs and managers. We need your passion to build a world-class organization and work environment through driving workforce planning activities and coordinating with stakeholders to deliver key projects.
What you'll do
Execute on cyclical workforce planning programs with a focus driving clarity and efficiency for the CTO organization
Work with data infrastructure, tooling and process teams to triage data-quality issues and drive long term improvement
Approach and execute ad-hoc data requests creatively, identifying opportunities to scale and standardize these requests over time.
Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities. Leverage change management methodologies, process and tools to support adoption of the changes across work streams.
Proactively managing project risks, issues, and dependencies and reporting the project status to the stakeholders in a timely manner.
Qualifications:
Minimum 5+ years in workforce planning, data analyst, or similar role
Experience with data gathering, processing, validation and visualization.
Excellent communication skills with the skills to explain business problems, concepts and issues to a varied audience.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to business-driven changes.
You take ownership in situations to identify right stakeholders and drive the expected outcome.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Our perks & benefits
Atlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits to learn more.
About Atlassian
At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Job Description:
Senior Technical Business Analyst (Data)
Job Description

How will I help?

The Group Customer Master (GCM) Team is an Enterprise Application Team, supporting the Westpac Group's Customer Information Systems, such as OCH / UCM (Oracle Customer Hub / Universal Customer Master), CIS, GCIS, and Customer Domain APIs. We service every Brand in the Bank, and every Line of Business.

The Technical BA sits within the GCM Team. It is a hybrid Technical Business Analyst and Data Analyst function, that will primarily support the GCM Simplification Program. You may also be working across multiple smaller projects across the GCM LOB (Lines-Of-Business) Teams. These are: GCM Consumer Banking, GCM Business Banking and GCM WIB. Your project assignment will be based on business needs and will be determined by your Line Manager, so it is important you are highly flexible, adaptable and versatile.

What's in it for me?

You'll play a significant part of the future of a business that has been around for over 200 years. Our purpose is to create better futures together. So, we'll back you in the development of your career, internal career prospects, and flexible working. You'll also keep learning to grow your career, backed by a fantastic team of people with a can-do, supportive structure. Whatever shape your family takes, we offer generous paid and unpaid parental leave for your nominated primary and support carers. This includes leave to organise adoptions, surrogacy, and foster care arrangements. And we continue to pay your super contributions while you take all the time you need to get your new family settled.

What do I need?
At least 5 years of experience (combined) across the following fields: Business Analysis, Technical Analysis, and Data Analysis.
Tertiary qualifications in Business / Information Technology or equivalent experience.
Knowledge and practical experience in Project Management, Business Analysis and Data Analysis disciplines, processes, best practices, tools, and techniques.
Process and data analysis, mapping, and re-engineering experience.
Have solid proven and practical experience in Data Analysis (e.g. data lineage analysis, A-C mapping, data profiling, data querying), Data Migration, Data Profiling projects and work. Passionate and comfortable with data.
Systems Integration and Migration Experience with exposure to various integration technologies. API experience is highly regarded.
SQL skillset would be very beneficial for this role and some basic SQL experience is required.
Agile principles and best practices and how to write robust and complete user stories and acceptance criteria.
Senior-level experience in Functional, Data, Technology Service Specification Writing.
Practical experience in delivering end-to-end Agile and Waterfall Projects, including exposure to all related delivery processes, principles, best practices, tools, and techniques.
A strong understanding of, and experience in, Technology and Business Systems strategically and operationally.
Financial Services Experience.
Excellent Communication, Requirements Analysis, Technical Analysis, Data Analysis and Technical / Functional Documentation Skills.
Exceptional Attention to Detail and Problem-Solving Skills.
The ability to deliver to tight timelines in a team-based, complex environment, with a high level of resilience.
A high level of flexibility and adaptability and be able to respond to a very dynamic project environment.

What's it like to work there?

We are a collaborative team of passionate people with a shared ambition to make a difference for our customers, our communities and each other. At Westpac, making a difference means creating impact, unlocking our own and each other's passions, and transformative success stories to create better futures together.

As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family gives you access to a wide range of employee benefits to help you manage your priorities - whether that means family life, work/life balance, ambition to grow or all the little perks in between.

We'll empower you to shape your career path. Through personalised upskilling, mentoring, and training opportunities, you're in control of where you start and how you'll grow.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility - and champions inclusion.

Hear from some of our people and their experiences working with us. #LI-Hybrid.

How do I apply?

Start here. Just click on the APPLY or button.

At Westpac, we're all about creating a supportive culture and ensuring our workplaces, branches, products, and services are accessible and inclusive for everyone-our customers, employees, and the wider community. If you're interested in discussing workplace flexibility, please feel free to mention it in your application.

We invite candidates of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, cultural backgrounds, people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, veterans and reservists, and Indigenous Australians to apply. If you have questions about the recruitment process, please email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au.

Do you need reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process?

We can provide reasonable adjustments for individuals with disability and/or neurodiversity. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process at any stage, please email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au

Job Description:
Senior Insights Analyst
Do work that matters

Business Bank (BB) offers a wide range of services and solutions to our small to medium enterprise customers and our regional and agribusiness customers. We also take care of our personal and institutional online trading customers.

CommSec is Australia's leading online broker providing equities, international shares, exchange traded funds, research and margin lending services to our retail and sophisticated clients.

See yourself in our team

The CommSec Data and Insights Centre of Excellence (COE) is a central Data and Analytics function under the Pace model that supports the delivery of Data and Analytics offerings and services at Pace. The COE's mission is to provide trusted data, capabilities and actionable insights in partnership with our stakeholders to drive customer experience, empower decision making and safeguard our data.

The Insights and Decision Science Chapter within the COE is responsible for CommSec's Insights and Analytics functions. The team supports the strategic decision-making process of the business by way of regular reporting, campaign marketing and remediation analytics. We are also responsible for providing integrated online and offline behavioural insights, building analytics frameworks that help assess and drive customer engagement and building advanced analytics solutions and tools to help CommSec optimise its resources, improve its processes and minimise risk.

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for performing data analysis to support data remediations for CommSec in relation to Financial Crime incidents, and support the business stakeholders with ad hoc data requests. This role involves leveraging data to drive insights, improve processes, and support strategic decision-making within the organisation.

Key responsibilities
Perform analysis of CommSec data and systems to provide the business with crucial information to support Financial Crime remediation, including documentation of processes and controls.
Using SQL/Alteryx - design, prepare and build dataset that delivers targeted customer details and key data points for campaigns including remediation and marketing programs with Adobe MarTech knowledge a bonus.
Complete relevant project work stream deliverables including quality control/sign off for area of accountability
Perform detailed analysis of CommSec and Group data to provide the business with insightful information to make data-driven decisions

We're interested in hearing from people who have
Sound SQL Server experience and skills (preferably Microsoft SQL Server and/or Teradata)
Significant data, information management and analytics experience
Be commercially astute, with strong analytical skills, attention to detail and demonstrated ability to work with large and complex data sets.
Demonstrated delivery experience as performing analytical work in high complexity environment
Influencing and consulting skills - the ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels.

If this sounds like you then apply today!

We believe in working for a place that works for you. We have many flexible working options within our team so talk to us about which arrangements would work best for you.

If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Job Description:
Our mission and where you fit in
At Employment Hero, we’re an ambitious bunch of people on a mission to make employment easier and more valuable for everyone.
Since our inception in 2014, we've had some pretty impressive growth (100% YoY), reached unicorn status in 2022, and now serve 300,000 businesses globally, with 2 million+ users on the platform. We have no plans to slow down.
There’s never been a more exciting time to join one of the fastest-growing SaaS unicorns, so let’s see if we could be a match!
What your days might look like
Reporting to the Head of Data Platforms, you will be part of a highly collaborative but remotely distributed team delivering our core reusable data assets that enable a wide variety of use cases such as report building, insights generation, ML applications and customer marketing. We are focused on delivering the most valuable impacts first, while also lifting our documentation, standards and reusability to enable even more speed as we deliver.
As an Analytics Engineer, you’ll be:
Data assets development: Serve as the directly responsible individual (DRI) to translate business requirements and existing complex queries into reusable data models / assets using dbt.
Data assets cataloguing and documentation: Develop and maintain the documentation of core and business-specific data models / assets.
Data assets governance: Maintain the integrity of our data assets to ensure completeness and accuracy
Reverse ETL and customer engagement platform support: Develop and maintain data models specifically for our reverse ETL and customer engagement platform use cases.
dbt code convention: Maintain and enforce all coding conventions and standards across all dbt models, including naming.
dbt code performance: Maintain and develop all dbt models in line with best practices to ensure optimum performance.
Intra-team collaboration: Working with other Data Analyst(s) to translate requirements into reusable and performant data models and with Data Engineer(s) to ensure data model performance is optimised.
Are you ready to make a significant impact in a rapidly expanding analytics team? Are you excited about taking ownership of our data assets? If you're looking for a dynamic role where you can unleash your skills and contribute to the growth of a company, then we have the perfect opportunity for you!
What you will bring?
4+ years in the Data space as an analytics engineer / data engineer
Advanced proficiency in SQL
Demonstrated experience in ETL (or ELT) and data modelling projects
Demonstrated experience architecting flexible and scalable data warehouse and modelling practice
Demonstrated ability to understand and translate business requirements / metrics into technical data model development plans
Ability to connect the dots between technical implementation work and business context
Bonus Points:
dbt experience strongly preferred
Python experience preferred
Experience is important, but for us the biggest measure of success is people who can live and breathe The EH Way of working. Show us what you can bring to the table, and we’ll empower you to let your talents shine.
The EH Way
The EH Way is how we describe our culture at Employment Hero and how we all operate. It is our DNA. You can read all about it on our careers page: https://employmenthero.com/careers/
In short, you’ll love working with us if:
Revolutionising employment gets your heart racing.
You thrive on the flexibility (and responsibility) of a remote-first business.
Our values align, and shape how you show up every day.
You love the dynamic pace of a startup, are driven by innovation, and enjoy working with other smart people.
Plus, you’ll get to enjoy a number of great perks, including:
A generous budget for your home office.
Cutting-edge tools and technology.
Reward and recognition programs - because great work should be recognised and rewarded.
Cashback offers and discounts on popular brands through our Swag app.
Employee Share Option Program: be an owner of Employment Hero.
Annual Global Gathering - so far we’ve been to Thailand, Vietnam, Bali, and are excited to meet in Dubai in September 2025.
Are we a match?
Think we're the right match for you? Fantastic! Click 'Apply' and our talent team will reach out with the next steps.
At Employment Hero, we are committed to safeguarding the privacy of your application data. To understand how we do so, you can read our Applicant Privacy Policy here: https://employmenthero.com/legals/applicant-policy/
Employment Hero celebrates diverse perspectives and experiences, we invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.

Job Description:
Company Description

150+ restaurants across Australia, Singapore, Tokyo and the USA today, and opening30-35 new restaurants every year - Guzman y Gomez (GYG) is the fastest growing food company in Australia and we’re changing the perception of fast food.

Job Description

NEW STORE OPENING - GYG BAULKHAM HILLS

ARE YOU A LEADER ? THEN THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU

An important leadership position within our Restaurant Operations team, you’ll be responsible for supporting the daily management of the restaurant - Stepping up when the Restaurant Manager’s not around.
As a leader, you’ll be looked upon as a calming force when the heat’s on. On any given day you will be leading the team through busy service periods, crew training, proactively improving guest experience, supporting inventory and financial management as required.
Crew culture is important to us, so we like to keep it simple. We’re looking for people who share our love of food and our commitment to people.
It’s all about the food. Always. Forever. We never compromise on freshness or quality. GYG food is 100% clean.
Make every customer love us. In restaurant, drive thru or delivery, we’re all about the customer. Delicious fresh food. Cooked to perfection. Fun, energetic environments and exceptional service – Every time.
Be real – It takes all kinds to keep Australia’s fastest growing food brand going. We don’t have time for games or politics. Be yourself, respect each other, have fun, don’t make excuses and remember the two points above.
Got your back. When you join GYG, you are joining a family, culture is everything at GYG and we care about each other. We always have each other’s back.
It’s up to us. We never walk past a problem – We fix it now.

Qualifications

We’ll provide you with the support required to get the mechanics right. We’re scouting for attitude, maturity and energy. If what we’re doing strikes a few chords, we’d love to opportunity to find you a place in our team.
Running a shift at GYG is intense but rewarding, so to ensure you’re successful in the role, you’ll need experience. We appreciate ‘experience’ comes in may shapes and sizes – What we mean specifically is;
Experience leading a team within a busy, high volume hospitality environment
Experience delivering exceptional customer service.

Additional Information

Every position at GYG presents opportunity for growth and career development. Whenever we can, we promote from within – Particularly when opening new restaurants.
We also recognise every member of our team as a potential game changer. Whether it’s as a prospective Franchisee, Marketer, Accountant or Data Analyst, we’ll support your career growth each step of the way – We want to be a part of it.
More immediately, when starting with GYG you can expect;
We’ll deck you out with GYG merch/uniforms, ready for your first day
Great crew discounts in restaurant
Ongoing product, systems and skills training
Regular work schedules and hours

Job Description:
Data Engineer
Trading under Publicis Communications
Location: Sydney or Melbourne or Brisbane
Data Engineer (also known as BI Developer, Quantitative Data Engineer, Search Engineer, Technical Architect, Big Data Analyst, Solutions Architect, Data Warehouse Engineer, Data Science Software Engineer, ETL Developer)
The role of the Data Engineer is to work alongside solution architects, data analysts & data scientists to deliver various aspects of the marketing technology ecosystem. The Data Engineer is responsible for engaging machine learning techniques to create and sustain structures that allow for the analysis of data whilst remaining familiar with dominant programming and deployment strategies. Data engineering experience is critical, as well as knowledge of data warehousing, ETL strategies and tools, and BI tools. Experience in cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS and GCP is beneficial.
Data Engineer Responsibilities:
· Anticipating and mitigating delivery risks and following issues through to closure
· Advocating for data management methodologies and processes on all projects
· Assuming responsibility for data quality, ensuring that testing is carried out in a rigorous fashion resulting in production of high-quality deliverables
· Adopting a flexible approach to completing workload to ensuring timely delivery and reinforcing commitment to delivery and quality within the technical team, including offshore development centres
· Creating and managing the relevant technical design documentation and ensures the documents completeness and accuracy
· Ensuring that data architecture is implemented according to the design
· Ensuring solutions delivered use existing standards and frameworks
· Contributing to business development efforts through accurate project scoping, estimating and attending sales calls when required
· Collaborating with globally dispersed teams on international projects. This includes co-ordinating build activities with offshore development centres in India and Asia Pacific
· Remaining up-to-date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your outputs.
Data Engineer Requirements:
· All of the above roles require a relevant tertiary qualification or a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in lieu of qualification.
· Proven experience as a data engineer, software developer, or similar.
· Expert proficiency in Python, C++, Java, R, and SQL.
· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Works well independently but also a team player and able to work collaboratively
· Scrupulous approach to duties.
· Strong presentation and written communication skills, with ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical colleagues and clients
· Experience developing data processing and analytics solutions in a digital agency or IT consultancy as part of a multi-disciplinary team

Job Description:
Insurance Manager
Melbourne, VIC, AU, 3000
About us:
CitiPower, Powercor and United Energy own and operate the electricity distribution networks servicing 1.9 million customers located across 65% of Victoria. These customers include large numbers of households as well as commercial and industrial businesses, world class arts, health and sporting precincts, popular tourism regions and the biggest infrastructure projects in Victoria.
We provide reliable, safe and affordable electricity and our businesses are independently rated as the best in the country for their efficiency. Sustaining this is all the more critical and challenging as greater electrification of homes, fleets and industries becomes a core strategy for reducing carbon emissions and addressing climate change.
We proudly strive to provide a safe, inclusive and sustainable environment where all of our people feel respected, valued and supported to be the best they can be.

About the Role:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Insurance Manager, driving the strategy behind our insurance programs across our essential energy networks and diverse subsidiaries.
Reporting to the Treasurer, in this role you will manage over 30 insurance policies covering critical risks such as general liability (including bushfire risk coverage), property, and workers' compensation while ensuring cost optimisation and regulatory compliance.
Using your experience in a similar role you will partner with senior stakeholders, brokers, and underwriters to safeguard our business, deliver expert risk advice, and influence decision-making on major contracts and initiatives.
This represents an amazing opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a challenging and rewarding role! With many company benefits and incentives on offer, and a chance you to play a critical part in our business, this is a role that should not be missed.


Key duties and responsibilities:
Lead the design, placement, and management of comprehensive insurance policies, ensuring optimal coverage and cost efficiency.
Build and maintain strong relationships with insurance brokers and underwriters to secure competitive terms.
Provide expert risk advice on contracts, new initiatives, and emerging risks, collaborating with key stakeholders across our businesses.
Oversee claims management, data analysis, and reporting to better inform decision-making and enhance risk mitigation.
Manage the insurance budget, identifying opportunities for optimisation while ensuring compliance and coverage.
Deliver high-quality presentations and reports to senior leaders and committees on insurance strategies and updates.
Develop and coach team members, fostering a culture of excellence and growth.

Required skills and experience:
Strong experience in corporate insurance or commercial risk management, preferably in energy, infrastructure, or heavy industries.
Strong knowledge of insurance principles, risk management practices, and contractual risk assessment.
Proven ability to influence, negotiate, and manage diverse stakeholders at all levels.
Tertiary qualifications in Commerce, Finance, Risk Management, or a related field.

Your career with us:
We have a diversity of teams across our business, all contributing to great customer and community outcomes. Our people are our most important asset, and we continually invest in nurturing their capability.
Our greatest priority is the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and the communities we operate within. This includes their physical safety – ensuring everyone gets home safely everyday – as well as their psychological safety, by ensuring everyone has the resources and support needed to achieve a work-life balance.
We proudly strive to provide a safe, inclusive, and sustainable environment where all our people feel respected, valued, and supported to bring their whole selves to work and be the best they can be.
With an embedded Inclusion & Diversity Strategy and initiatives like our Women in Power networking group, and Sparkle, our LGBTIQ+ allies pride network, we’re committed to equal opportunities for all employees.
We are proud to be recognised as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for all women. Click here to check out our benefits. https://work180.com/en-au/for-women/employer/powercor/benefits

Submit your application by 15 December 2024 by clicking on apply now!

For the full Position Description reach out to Emma Jones in the Talent Team on ejones@powercor.com.au.

Beon, CitiPower Powercor and United Energy recognise Australia’s Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the First Peoples and Traditional Custodians of the lands on which we work. We pay our respects to Elders past and present and acknowledge their ancient and continuing connection to Country.

We work hard to ensure our organisation is inclusive and diverse. This means everyone can feel valued, trusted, authentic and safe at work.

Job Description:
Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

Our data team has expertise across engineering, analysis, architecture, modeling, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science. This discipline is responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights, building robust data infrastructures, and enabling data-driven decision-making and innovation through advanced analytics and predictive modeling.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with the Data Analyst/Data Scientist to understand evolving needs and define the data processing flow or interactive reports.
Discuss with the stakeholders from other teams to better understand how data flows are used within the existing environment.
Propose solutions for the cloud-based architecture and deployment flow.
Design and build processes, data transformation, and metadata to meet business requirements and platform needs.
Design and propose solutions for the Relational and Dimensional Model based on platform capabilities.
Develop, maintain, test, and evaluate big data solutions.
Focus on production status and data quality of the data environment.
Pioneer initiatives around data quality, integrity, and security.

Qualifications
+5 years working with the GCP ecosystem.
+5 years of experience in Data Engineering.
Proficiency in Apache Spark.
Proficiency in Python.
Some experience leading IT projects and stakeholder management.
Experience implementing ETL/ELT process and Data pipelines.
Experience with Snowflake.
Strong SQL scripting experience.
Background and experience with cloud data technologies and tools.
Familiar with data tools and technologies like:
Spark, Hadoop, Apache beam, Dataproc or similar.
BigQuery, Redshift, or other Data warehouse tools.
Real-time pipelines with Kinesis or Kafka.
Batch processing.
Serverless processing.
Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured data sensibilities.
Cloud certifications such as Associate Cloud Engineer will be an asset.

Additional Information

Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
Finance: Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
Career Development: Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
Learning Opportunities: Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
Work-Life Balance: Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
Health: Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
Community: Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.

Job Description:
About the role :
The Brand and Marketing team contributes to the delivery of the strategic goals of People First Bank by bringing to life our brand campaigns, sponsorships, community initiatives and communication strategies.
As the Marketing Communications Coordinator you’ll be responsible for supporting the Communications Hub to deliver on the direct marketing and member journeys program of work. You will develop and execute communications strategies in relation to projects, products, services, compliance and member education. This includes the development of copy, liaising with our external marketing suppliers or internal teams, overseeing implementation through to delivery and reporting on success.
What you’ll be doing:
Contribute to the development, execution and optimisation of direct marketing, journey program of work and marketing lifecycle strategies and campaigns.
Build, send and report of member communications and journeys through Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
Effectively work with internal business stakeholders to ensure member communications are developed and delivered in line with the brand tone of voice and on time to meet business needs, with the consideration for all member impacts and appropriate channels.
Write briefs and act as the key liaison between People First Bank and external direct marketing suppliers.
Utilise direct marketing platforms to build templates for eDM that adhere to best practice standards and brand guidelines.
Ensure campaign activity is measurable, with clearly communicated targets and tracking.
Work closely with the Marketing Data Analyst to leverage segmentation data, data insights and predictive analytics to develop and refine the communications strategy to deliver a greater customer experience. Oversee Communications Hub budgets and coordinate invoicing and journals for the accounts department.
About you:
We are looking for a confident copywriter who will maintain a persistent focus on the member. You will use automated member journeys and direct marketing to support the Communications Hub to achieve sustainable growth in new members and strong retention of the existing membership base. You will ensure that all member communications consistently embody our brand tone and align to our core values.
Desired Knowledge & Experience:
Effective communication, stakeholder management and relationship-building skills.
Exceptional writing skills required for crafting compelling and articulate content.
Digitally savvy, with an ability to quickly learn new systems and processes including experience with a variety of marketing automation and CRM platforms.
Understanding of basic database concepts and HTML skills.
Previous experience working in a Financial Services role.
Why you’ll love working here!
Are you ready to embark on a distinctive career opportunity with People First Bank? Following the merger of People’s Choice and Heritage Bank in March 2023, we are on an exciting journey to unify our member focus, products, services, and technology under a single company name and brand. People First Bank embodies our commitment to prioritising people above all else.
We are 100% member owned, with approximately 720,000 members and 1,900 employees. We have dual head offices in Adelaide and Toowoomba, and 95 branches across South Australia, Victoria, New South Wales, Queensland and the Northern Territory, trading under two brands, Heritage Bank and People's Choice.
When you come to work at People First Bank, you’ll be joining a team of inclusive, friendly, and motivated employees who value making a difference every day for our members, community, and the planet. We are committed to creating an outstanding working environment where you feel supported, can continue to develop and are proud advocates of our members and our business.
Putting ‘People First’ starts with our team members and we are committed to creating an outstanding working environment where you feel supported, can continue to develop and are proud advocates of our members and our business.

We believe the little extras can make a big difference in supporting your success!
We offer a range of attractive benefits for our team members including career development opportunities, discounts on financial products and services, and celebrate the work of our people through our peer driven recognition program.
Paid parental leave and special leave provisions.
Employee banking benefits and discounted insurances.
Career development opportunities, and ongoing training, coaching and support.
A dedicated Employee Assistance Program for you and your family to access in times of need.
Access to wellness initiatives for you and your immediate family members.
Paid volunteering days and access to a diverse range of community and charitable initiatives.
Next Steps :
Sounds like a great place to work, doesn’t it? We’d love to hear from you about this exciting opportunity. Click ‘Apply Now’ and submit your application, including an up-to-date resume and cover letter.
Applications close 8am Monday 9 December 2024.
If you have any questions or would like to discuss anything in more detail, please contact the Talent Acquisition Team: careers@peopleschoicecu.com.au or hr.recruitment@heritage.com.au

We are committed to diversity and inclusion and support candidate requests for adjustments to enable everyone to equitably participate in our selection process.

Job Title: Consultant or Senior Consultant - Transaction Analytics - Strategy and Transactions
Job Description:
If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

Join Transaction Analytics and you join a unique and rapidly growing area, leveraging data to derive insights through a commercial lens and enhancing our clients’ decision making on M&A transactions.

We’re looking for Senior Consultants and Consultants to help grow our team to new heights!

What’s in it for you?

In Transaction Analytics we provide data-driven solutions aimed to enhance our clients’ decision making during financial due diligence. You’ll join an established and market leading team of forward-thinking analytics professionals in a project delivery capacity.

This role comes with exciting, challenging and demanding client projects. In our downtime, it also provides the chance to innovate in our capability to develop assets that efficiently generate strategic and commercially relevant insights.

Moreover, because we are at the frontier of M&A decision making and its intersection with analytics, there is an exciting opportunity to experience the continued growth of the team and our overall capability as you also continue to develop in your own career.

These questions will help give you a sense of whether working with this team will be a rewarding experience:

Are you a corporate finance professional who jumps at the chance to dive into data and uncover deeper insights into business performance and growth?
Are you a qualified (or almost qualified) accountant at a mid-to-top tier firm, having picked up some analytics along the way, and keen to break into the world of M&A?
Or maybe your background is as a data analyst, yet you feel more comfortable as the storyteller and have a proven ability to use data to support high impact decisions (corporate strategy, finance, marketing, investing, etc.)?
Do you see data analytics playing an important role in the future of your career – yet are more driven by the questions it helps to answer than the tech, and/or don’t see yourself as a pure technologist?

About you

We consider candidates from a range of different professional backgrounds, however successful candidates will typically identify confidently with at least two of the following three areas:

Commercial acumen and ability to see the big picture. You’ll have experience in the likes of strategy, management consulting, corporate finance or accounting, and are comfortable contributing through these lenses when explaining the results of your analyses.
Quantitative / analytics skills and numerical reasoning. You are adept at both manipulating and interpreting large datasets, your eye for detail will mean you’ve reconciled your results and isolated any material anomalies, and you can translate business to technical and vice versa.
Consulting skills and predisposition towards agility. You are curious and articulate with clever questions and the ability to build rapport, you are comfortable with navigating through ambiguity and unfamiliar problems, and you take a proactive approach to planning your work and team communication.

While we’re looking for both Senior Consultant and Consultant level candidates, the above descriptions align more closely to our expectations at a Senior Consultant level.

A Senior Consultant level candidate will typically have at least 3 years of experience and are expected to coach juniors through solving problems more independently and improving on quality.

A Consultant level candidate will typically have up to 3 years of experience and can be confidently identified as being on the growth path to our Senior Consultant level expectations.

The technologies we use day-in and day-out include Alteryx, Power BI (including advanced DAX), Power Query and Power Pivot. We occasionally dabble with the likes of Python, R and SQL, which tend to be more on the basis of innovation or new types of projects.

Don’t feel like you need to be fully proficient in these technologies when you join us, as we provide both formal and on the job training. We’ll just be looking for evidence that you have what it takes to pick up the tech and hack it out in the long run.

Finally, to give you an idea of the cohort that you would be growing and progressing into in the future, here are some additional things set people apart from day one at a Manager level and beyond:

Experience in an M&A transaction environment, strategy or management consulting
Further post-graduate studies (completed or in progress) in a commercially oriented discipline (e.g. CA, CPA, CFA, MBA, etc.)
Demonstrable experience in having developed strong commercial awareness to analyse business context and performance and understand key business drivers
An entrepreneurial track record, to identify client needs and devise commercial propositions in the absence of precedent or guidance
A sensitivity for and motivation towards bringing the best out of team-mates at all levels
Strong team leadership and project management skills
A team-level-success-driven mindset

What we can offer you

Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
Discover the various ways our benefits can cater to your needs, across wellness, financial wellbeing, and family-friendly policies which include 26 weeks gender neutral paid parental leave at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

Diversity, equity, and inclusiveness (DE&I) are core to who we are, how we work and how we live our values. We hold a collective commitment to continue to drive an environment where all differences are valued, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging— where people are inspired to team and lead inclusively in their interactions every day. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations, and gender identities and are committed to providing an equitable and barrier free recruitment experience for all. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

The minimum salary for this role is AUD$72,000 inclusive of superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.

EY | Building a better working world

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

Job Description:
Description

Propeller is on a mission to take the guesswork out of moving dirt - reducing wasted fuel, time, and money. We do this through the power of maps.

Our customers use Propeller’s integrated hardware and software products to capture accurate 3D versions of their worksites using drones. With over 50,000 worksites worldwide using Propeller’s smart survey technology, we empower project teams to map, measure, and manage site activity.

Propeller empowers everyone to approach, own, and solve problems creatively. We’re data nerds who care about impact, honesty, and each other. We take pride in being a great place to work. We are proud to be recipients of BI Group's Excellence in Customer Experience award and Inspiring Workplaces of Australasia, being recognized as a Fast Company and BuiltIn Best Place to Work. You can learn more about us on Glassdoor.

Your Mission

As a Growth Product Manager at Propeller, you’ll be a key driver of impactful growth within an established and forward-thinking business. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on creating and iterating on solutions across product and business functions, with a focus on experiences that contribute directly to revenue and user expansion.
Leading Product for this team, you’ll collaborate closely with your squad’s designer, engineers, and data analyst, while aligning with marketing and other product squads. Together, you’ll build and refine customer journeys and experiences that drive immediate growth and chart the course for Propeller’s next phase. You’ll also be a key advocate for the Growth team, championing initiatives that expand its reach and align with core business goals.
This role requires an analytical, experiment-driven mindset, grounded in both qualitative and quantitative insights. You’re not only a strategic thinker but also a hands-on collaborator, setting measurable goals, fostering engagement across teams, and keeping the customer’s perspective at the forefront. A natural communicator, you’ll bring stakeholders along on the journey, ensuring every growth initiative enriches the customer experience and deepens their connection to our product.

Your Skills

Extensive Product Management experience in a SaaS environment, ideally focusing on growth-oriented goals and initiatives.
Data-driven mindset: Proficient in using data to inform decisions and communicate insights across teams, translating metrics into actions that drive growth.
Customer obsession: You have a deep commitment to understanding and resolving customer pain points to both help them and promote growth.
Bias toward action: You excel at bringing experimental ideas to life, turning insights into reality, driving tangible results and checking with qualitative and quantitative data that things are moving in the right direction.

Benefits

Employee share options
Professional development budget and leave
The opportunity to take part in our mentorship program
Mental health resources
Monthly telephone and/or internet allowance
Paid primary & secondary parental leave policies
Hybrid work arrangements and WFH equipment provided

About Propeller
Propeller is for everyone, so come as you are. We value all types of experience, skill, and ability. If you don’t think you meet all the requirements, but still think this role would be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you.

Diversity makes our team more creative, fun, and effective, so bring your whole self to the application process, and we will too!

If you’re interested in what life at Propeller is like, check out our employee-owned Medium blog page!

Our hiring process

Stage 1: Interview with Talent Acquisition
Stage 2: Interview with Hiring Manager
Stage 3: Propeller Aero Challenge
Stage 4: The Final Interview

Job Description:
Infosys Consulting is the worldwide management and IT consultancy unit of the Infosys Group (NYSE: INFY), global advisor to leading companies for strategy, process engineering and technology-enabled transformation programs.

We partner with clients to design and implement customized solutions to address their complex business challenges, and to help them in a post-modern ERP world. By combining innovative and human centric approaches with the latest technological advances, we enable organizations to reimagine their future and create sustainable and lasting business value.

A pioneer in breaking down the barriers between strategy and execution, Infosys Consulting delivers superior business value to its clients by advising them on strategy and process optimisation as well as IT-enabled transformation. To find out how we go beyond the expected to deliver the exceptional, visit us at www.infosysconsultinginsights.com Infosys Consulting - a real consultancy for real consultants.
Requirements
1. Role: Business Analyst
Location: NZ / Auckland
Roles: 2
Daily Rate: AUD 760 INC of All charges.
Experience as Sr BA/Lead BA; Mapping, understanding and re-imagining business process using BPMN standards and latest tools; Agile WoW , Understanding customer experiences; Engaging productively and creatively with business customers; Effective stakeholder collaboration through workshops and elicitation sessions; Ability to translate the very technical and complex into simple language that explains the value proposition a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders; Understand Tower technology landscape and work in details around the inter-relation and impacts with journey and technical squads; Strong communication skills expected.
2. Role: Data Analyst
Location: NZ/ Auckland
Roles: 1
Daily Rate: AUD 760 INC Of All charges
Skills: SQL, Python or R, PowerBI or similar, Snowflake etc.
Key Role Skill & Capability Requirements:
Experience as an Azure Data Bricks.
Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions.
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Synapse, and Azure SQL is required.
Experience in Data Warehousing Modelling- optional
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Good understanding OR ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Knowledge/experience in Azure IoT, Databricks / Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Stream Analytics is Mandatory
Knowledge of Python is a plus.
Experience preparing data for Data Science / Machine Learning / BI solutions
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
3. Role: Business Analyst
Location: NZ/ Auckland
Roles: 2
Daily Rate : AUD 600 to 760 INC of all Charges
In addition to attributes outlined for SSJ Sr BA) Experienced in examining, reviewing and identifying opportunities in Tower's business processes, Can take on smaller sub-projects and provide Process Specialist expertise; Engage well with people, have a growth mindset and be comfortable using their initiative to make progress. Attributes outlined for Sr BA for SSJ) In addition, understand and be very comfortable working with technology. Communicate easily with technical peers like engineers, QA, architects and PO and Delivery managers. Translate tech into bus speak for non-tech stakeholders
Benefits
We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We believe that employing a diverse workforce is the right thing to do and is central to our success. We offer you great opportunities within a dynamically growing consultancy. You will elaborate and deliver best practice solutions and will be able to further develop your solution design, implementation and project 2 management skills.

Job Description:
Dogs, cats, budgies and everything in between - pets deserve the world. They make us want to be better humans. That’s why we’ve made it our mission to build the most engaged and passionate community of pets and pet parents across the world. And we’re looking for talented team mates who can help us do it.

Founded in Sydney, our team of 500+ pet obsessives span Australia, New Zealand and the Philippines. We’ve scaled to become one of Australia's top five eCommerce companies and the no.1 online pet store. But we’re just getting started. Like a whippet who’s spotted their mate across the dog park, our growth is only going to accelerate, as we continue to disrupt the way that pet parents shop.

Excitingly, the pet industry is booming (as in $15 billion kind of booming) and online pet retail is set to grow exponentially in the next five years. So this is a unique career opportunity to be part of our epic growth story.

The Opportunity

Since its founding in 2011, Pet Circle has captured 50% of Australia's online pet market. We see an opportunity to build a unique specialty retail business by offering tailored products, advice, and services that consider both pets and their owners' needs. With over 1 million customers and substantial GMV, our goal is to evolve Pet Circle into a trusted companion for pet parents throughout their journey.

As VP of Product, you'll partner with our co-founder and CEO to lead our product vision, creating and executing differentiated strategies. You'll manage a team of product managers, designers, and data analysts, fostering innovation while delivering outstanding customer solutions. You'll also work closely with the executive team and board to shape our future. We're seeking a hands-on, visionary leader with strong analytical skills to inspire teams, create exceptional customer experiences, and set new global retail standards. You’ll lead a team of 7-10 in a flat structure, reporting to the CTO.

At Pet Circle, we believe we make a true difference in the lives of our customers and their furry friends. The opportunity we provide is for someone to connect with our purpose, be inspired by our vision and in turn inspire our teams to create extraordinary experiences that set a new bar globally as to how retailers engage, be helpful to their customers, and achieve incredible business outcomes.
Key Responsibilities:

Shape and drive execution of the Product strategy and plan:
Own Pet Circle’s digital product experience, providing leadership across the organisation as the custodian of our product vision.
Leading the creation of our product strategies, laying out the paths for the implementation of our vision. Operate with a lean team in a flat organisational structure, and able to be as hand-on in our Product Development processes as necessary.
Build a deep understanding of our customers, products and industry, continuously interacting with customers, enabling you to be a thought leader at Pet Circle.
Role-model solving problems in a way customers love, ensuring that these solutions are both valuable to customers and viable to the business.

Broader Business Leadership
Shape our Product culture, obsessing about the customer experience and driving frequent iterations and improvements, taking risks, cherishing learning opportunities.
Become an expert in our business, with knowledge and awareness of all influencing factors and constraints, be it veterinarian, commercial, operational, legal or other.

Team Leadership
Overseeing your team’s execution work across product planning, discovery and delivery, achieving extraordinary outcomes consistently, rapidly, and effectively.
Coach and develop your team to empower them to perform at their best. Our team is our biggest asset - so your role in enabling them to be high performing is pivotal. You’ll lead with context, humility and curiosity, share candid feedback often, and drive accountability at all levels.
Driving clear prioritisation for your team, remove roadblocks and influence the prioritisation of other teams to ensure business objectives are met
A bit about you:
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Engineering, Computer Science or another STEM discipline showing the ability to deeply understand complex technical concepts.
Proven people and team leadership experience, recognised as an attractor and developer of world-class talent. You’re also adept at driving outcomes with lean teams and are resourceful in the way you approach business challenges.
Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.
Extensive experience working on technology-powered products as either a product manager, product designer, engineer, data analyst, data scientist, or user researcher.
Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.
Experience considering both customer needs and commercial realities in order to drive meaningful product growth.
Strong analytical skills and capacity to thrive in data driven environments, moving from ideas to reality in very short periods of time.
Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship.
Role location
We believe that building connections and collaborating as Pet Circlers is super important. So this role is based in Sydney with a hybrid arrangement of 3 days per week in our pet friendly offices (your pet might love coming to the office even more than you). This could change in line with business requirements.

Why Join?
We reckon our mission to help the world Pet Better is an important one, but also an incredibly fun and rewarding one. Becoming a Pet Circler means you’re committed to help shape an entire industry - it’s pretty exciting stuff. Here’s what we stand for:

We’re better together
We operate with humble hearts and hungry minds
Pets matter; so pets and pet parents always have a seat at our table
We’re instinctively curious. Always

Belong at Pet Circle
Our unique perspectives and expertise is our superpower - we value diversity in all forms. So, no matter your background, please apply if this role makes you excited to bring your full self to work each day.
Skills: Skills: Power BI, Microsoft Excel, Data analysis skills, Tableau, SQL

Job Title: Product Manager, Payments Cards Modernisation (12 month opportunity)
Job Description:
Product Manager, Payments Cards Modernisation – 12 month fixed-term
Your business
Business Banking (BB) manages relationships with Commonwealth Bank’s small-medium enterprise customers, mid-market corporate customers, and regional and agribusiness customers, providing a wide range of financial services and solutions. It also services our personal and Institutional Banking customers. The Payments Product team is responsible for the product management and development of all CBA’s account based payment solutions for business clients. The key objective of the team is to deliver transformative technology and innovative solutions with profitable growth, for customers across all segments of CommBank and covers three payment streams; Batch, Real Time and International Payments.
Reporting to the Chapter Lead, Payments Product Management, you will be part of the domestic Batch Payments squad who is responsible for driving payment usage and conversion through channel engagement, frontline initiatives, process improvement, enhanced reporting as well as future opportunities to migrate BECS capability to help us meet customer needs.
Do Work That Matters
As a Product Manager (PM), you will support the strategy for Cards Modernisation within the Batch Payments systems, specifically the Bank Payments Hub (BPH) system.
You will be responsible for seeking information from various sources to enable monitoring of product/system performance and assessing that performance against key regulatory and performance objectives.
You will also be responsible for rolling-out strategic or risk buy-down change initiatives by engaging with all stakeholders, creating formal plans and documenting requirements & processes to ensure sound change management.
The PM is also responsible for acting as an SME on changes rolled out by business partners.
This is a 12 month secondment / fixed term opportunity.
More specifically you will:
Support and document the changes required from the Cards Modernisation Program within the Bank Payments Hub (BPH) system
Collaborate with squads to define, prioritise and manage the backlog to achieve the squad’s and program’s vision, goals and roadmap
Translate Cards Modernisation Program requirements into actionable tasks for squads, ensuring informed and strategic decisions
Support squad members in program activities displaying agility and flexibility to take on various roles (Business Analyst/Product Manager/Data Analyst/Customer/Risk)
Co-ordindate across Domains, Business Units and Support Units to ensure the Payments Domain aligns with Cards Modernisation Program priorities
Partner with cross-Domain teams, including client maintenance, risk, compliance, finance, technology and distribution, to deliver a seamless product experience
Monitor performance, KPIs and (internal/external) customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and growth opportunities, and prioritise tasks accordingly
Manage and document program changes and continuously improve processes to enhance the customer experience
Responsible for proactively managing risks associated to the program, including controls, governance and swift resolution of issues in relation to BPH
Problem solve, investigate and recommend solutions to complex technical challenges
Manage change to continuously improve the Cards Modernisation work within BPH, to facilitate the overall customer experience
Ensure compliance with Group and Industry Policies, Standards and Regulatory obligations
Monitor business results of recently introduced or enhanced features and recommend modifications in product features, pricing, and marketing approaches to improve results.
Help us deliver a better future for Business Banking:
Undergraduate and post-graduate degree in business, marketing, engineering, data decisioning or similar qualifications
Payments and/or Cards Product Management experience is highly desirable
Deep Domain knowledge in the cards value chain
Experience on card migration projects is highly desirable
Proven experience working across end-to-end Agile projects and technical delivery
Business Analyst skills are preferable
Influential and confident stakeholder management skills as this role will see you working across risk, product, digital, technology and compliance business partners
Experience in working within a highly complex operational environment
A proactive risk management mindset
The ability and enthusiasm to act as a ‘change leader' in supporting transformational change
Strong commercial acumen and sound judgement to provide recommendations and insights
Exceptional written and verbal communication including proven planning and time management skills to handle competing priorities.
If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.
We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.

Job Description:
The role
Join the Supply Relationship Leadership team as a Commercial Manager where you will be working amongst a team of claims professionals responsible for ensuring Auto and General has the best-in-class motor supply network. Your core focus will be utilising supplier performance data and surfacing insights to help the teams in the field improve network capacity and customer outcomes. You will be working on dynamic and varied datasets with and making best use of your problem solving, root cause analysis and data analyst skills to influence meaningful change.
You will:
Identify and realise market and internal opportunities to create competitive advantages
Convert data insights drawn from a variety of data sources and communicate readily consumable reports and recommendations for senior stake holders across the organisation.
Influence process enhancements and operational control systems to ensure high quality outcomes are always achieved.
Utilise your knowledge of operational management to design process enhancements and drive positive change.
Deliver & refine re-engineering programs that develop a true, cost effective Repair Service Platform and fully utilise the investment in technologies
In consultation with the relevant internal stakeholders, develop and implement appropriate supplier management and assessing strategies that meet the company’s overall objectives
Develop and implement - policy with regards to supplier management; advanced commercial techniques; strategic sourcing or supply process improvements; & systems and tools to monitor and manage contract deliverables, service levels and commercial outcomes
Oversee the network’s performance, ensuring alignment between cost control methodologies and customer service/brand reputation outcomes
Support drafting of high-quality contract documents and carry out contract variations, including updating or expanding scopes of services
Provide contract management support to project teams throughout the contract life cycle and provide guidance to others in your team, while engaging in high level strategic planning for the business, providing training as required
What experience you’ll bring
Claims and/or significant Insurance Industry experience preferred
Significant experience utilising large datasets to surface insights and make recommendations
Demonstrated advanced experience utilising software packages including PowerBI, Excel, Audanet, etc to harness the power of data for decision making
Demonstrated best practice strategic procurement, including centralisation of commercial strategies and achievement of significant cost savings
Significant knowledge of the delivery of services and products through traditional Customer Service channels as well as Digital and Omni Channel strategies
A track record of exploiting technology to solve customer and operational challenges in large enterprise environments would be an advantage
Demonstrated success at implementing and delivering on operational efficiency & business process enhancement initiatives
Demonstrated negotiation skills, superior communication skills with a strong knowledge of legislative frameworks preferred
Our Perks
Location – This role can be based at either our North Lakes or Kawana Waters sites
North Lakes - Save the long commute to Brisbane and work for a growing company close to home and within walking distance to some of the north side’s best retail outlets, restaurants and other amenities.
Kawana - Housed on the sunny coast and close to local retail, restaurants and other amenities, we enjoy views across Kawana Lake and we’re only five minutes from the closest beach. If you love the water and coastal life, this is the perfect place for you. Be rewarded - we recognise high performance and reward our people for their hard work through bonuses and other perks.
Options for leave - life happens, so we’ve got volunteer days, an additional paid ‘ME’ day, paid parental leave and the opportunity to purchase additional leave to cover all of the big stuff.
Grow with us - we’ve got learning and professional development opportunities to suit everyone.
Give back - our A&G Difference program gives you the power to change our community for the better through volunteering, fundraising and donation opportunities for causes that you’re passionate about.
Take care of yourself - your wellbeing is important to us and our healthy mind and body hub, mental-health support and fitness discounts will help you be your best self.
Celebrate the wins - we love sharing our successes and celebrating together - join us and you’ve got a ticket to our many on-site events throughout the year, family fun days and annual celebrations.
Save money - as well as discounts on insurance products, we’ve teamed up with some incredible retailers, hospitality providers and others to bring you discounts on your purchases, no matter where you are in Australia.
About us
Auto & General (A&G) is the fastest-growing major Motor and Home insurer in Australia, providing insurance products and solutions to safeguard a brighter future for our customers and community.
Our range of general insurance products including Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents Pet and Travel products are delivered through our multi-award-winning brand Budget Direct and partnerships with leading brands - ING, Qantas, Virgin Money and Coles Insurance.
We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.
Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.
*A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Description:
About ISG
ISG is a dynamic global construction services company.
We have had a hand in some of the world’s most impactful and recognisable places, but our legacy is about far more than buildings. Across Europe, the Middle East and Asia, we deliver places where people and businesses make memories, forge new experiences, and reach their goals.
In short, we deliver the places that enable people and businesses to thrive.
Key accountabilities
At ISG we value everyone’s opinion in every matter. Our inclusive culture is hugely important to ISG, and we are looking for intellectually curious, compassionate people who would like to expand their skills whilst working on exciting new products.
Team Player
Ensure culture of knowledge sharing within the team by sharing insights into the work you have delivered, creating high quality knowledge articles, and sharing learnings in team environments.
Support individuals with their learning journeys, identifying opportunities for people to learn and grow.
Collaboration
Work closely with other technical teams including Service Delivery and our Portfolio teams to proactively share knowledge of technical solutions.
Create and nurture business relationships with 3rd party partners, Product Owners, and other areas of the business, understanding the impact of technical solutions and desired outcome.

Daily Role Requirements
This is a hands-on role for a Senior AppOps engineer who wants to be part of a new product driven organisation and influence the development, build and ongoing maintenance and upkeep of ISG’s core business applications including Microsoft Dynamics - Business Central, ServiceNow, WorkDay, SmartSource.
This role requires a dynamic work ethic with a deep technical background who can ensure these critical applications are running smoothly, efficiently, and securely. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain scalable systems, troubleshoot complex issues, and drive operational excellence, with a particular focus on leveraging Azure applications and integration hubs.
Collaborate with Portfolio Strategists, Owners, Architects and Cloud Infrastructure Engineers to deliver industry leading application performance.
Lead our portfolio projects aiding in the design, implementation, and maintenance of our ERP, BI, CRM, and Procurement business applications, including Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, ServiceNow, SmartSource, and Workday.
Monitor and manage application performance and reliability, ensuring high availability and scalability.
Automate operational processes, including deployment, monitoring, and alerting.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex application issues in collaboration with development, functional, and IT teams using our ITSM solution ServiceNow.
Collaborate with our DevOps teams s to design and optimize our deployment pipelines.
Develop and maintain a “Just Enough” documentation mantra for AppOps processes and procedures.
Work within a wider AppOps team and provide mentorship and provide guidance to our other AppOps engineers.
Utilise Azure Application Services and Integration Hub to streamline and enhance AppOps.
Leverage strong SQL skills for database management, optimization, and troubleshooting.
Work to a high degree of accuracy with good attention to detail, resulting in consistent technical configuration and documentation.
Promptly and efficiently resolve issues and problems and ensure they do not reoccur.
Develop and maintain robust monitoring solutions tailored specifically to our business applications, ensuring early detection of issues and anomalies.
Lead incident response efforts during critical incidents, coordinating with cross-functional teams to restore normal operations swiftly.
Conduct and create regular audits and assessments to identify and address potential security vulnerabilities, specifically within the ISO27001 framework
Lead efforts to diagnose and resolve application-related issues, collaborating closely with DevOps squads to implement effective solutions as well as maintain healthy relationships with our third-party partners.
Provide evolving monitoring solutions to provide fixes before they are detrimental to the platform.
Analyse existing business processes, identify areas for improvement, and propose innovative solutions to streamline operations.
Work in an agile environment, participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Break down projects into user stories and tasks, estimating effort and providing regular updates on progress.
Share insights and best practices with other AppOps team members to enhance and breed a collective expertise and responsibility within our AppOps team.
Utilise Power BI for the design, build, and maintenance of dashboards and reports for business intelligence purposes, collaborating with our data team to provide data accuracy and accessibility.
Personal Skills:
At ISG, we are people first, we encourage and nurture personal and professional collaborations wherever we can, to be successful in the role, we will be looking for:
The ability to convey yourself with skilled verbal and communication in a professional manner.
Be comfortable and enthusiastic in new and uncharted waters. We are building something new at ISG for our IT teams where sometimes we may need to pivot and change quickly. Our teams will need to learn modern technologies and patterns quickly both from training courses and from team members.
A real desire to teach others and share knowledge. We are looking for team players. We want you to coach other team members on your skills, practices, design principles, and implementation patterns.
Ability to see the long term. We do not want you to sacrifice the future for the present. We want you to choose technologies and approaches based on the end goals and manage your time appropriately.
Lofty standards. We are looking for people who expect personal performance and team performance to be nothing short of the best.
Clarity of thought. ISG’s product model is built upon agile ways of working, and we value people who are economical with their time and clear with their thoughts and opinions.
Can place yourself in the position of the customer/client, understand their concerns and issues and work collaboratively to a resolution.
Comfortable working within a geographically distributed team
Required Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions..
Proficiency with Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, ServiceNow, SmartSource, and Workday among others
Strong scripting and automation skills (e.g., Python, Bash, Ansible, Terraform).
In-depth understanding of CI/CD pipelines and tools (Azure DevOps, GitLab).
Experience with monitoring and logging tools.
Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure, networking, security, and system administration.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Extensive experience with Azure Application Services and Integration Hub.
Solid SQL skills and experience with database management, optimization, and troubleshooting.
Experience with Power BI, including data modelling, report building, and dashboard creation.
Proven experience with integration technologies, APIs, and web services for seamless data exchange between systems.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels and explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic environment and quickly learn innovative technologies and business processes.
Experience working in an agile environment, following agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban.
Preferred Experience:
Experience as an AppOps Engineer or in a similar role, demonstrating the ability to support, improve and implement complex business applications.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment.
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably Azure, for scalable and flexible system architecture.
Certifications (desirable):
AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator
MB-910: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Fundamentals (CRM)
DP-300: Administering Relational Databases on Microsoft Azure
PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst
AI-102: Designing and Implementing an Azure AI Solution
ServiceNow Certified System Administrator
ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist
Workday HCM Certification
What's in it for you?
Ongoing career development and accredited learning
Annual recognition and values awards
Global employee assistance program
Pension scheme
Life assurance
Private healthcare including private GP service and mental health pathways
As part of our wellbeing offering, ISG offers a monthly wellbeing allowance
Cycle to work scheme
Electric vehicle salary sacrifice scheme
Industry-leading family friendly policies (39 weeks maternity leave and 8 weeks paternity at full pay)
Volunteer day
Discounts such as cinema to ensure you're still loving ISG even when you leave the office
Most Friday's are a 4 pm finish providing work is completed for the week
Your work-life balance really matters to us, so in addition to your holiday allowance we have a You Day to allow you to take an extra day off to celebrate a special event, spend time with your family or just do something that will make your life easier or more enjoyable
Thriving networks including I-NOW (Women's Network), Race and Faith, LGBTQIA+, Armed Forced Covenant and the menopause working group, everyone’s invited
If you'd like to speak to the Talent Acquisition team, please contact tateam@isgltd.com below for more details.
